post_name: What 2,000 Calories Looks Like
post_message: We show you what roughly 2,000 calories looks like at some large restaurant chains including Ruth's Chris Steak House, Chipotle Mexican Grill and more.
post_description: Even as restaurants talk about smaller portions, they continue to serve a full day's worth of calories in a single meal — or even a single dish.

post_name: In Sweden, the Land of the Open Door, Anti-Muslim Sentiment Finds a Foothold
post_message: NA
post_description: Arson is suspected at mosques in three cities over the last 10 days, and an anti-immigrant party gained power this year.

post_name: Raising Questions Within Islam After France Shooting
post_message: "Some people who feel crushed or ignored will go toward extremism, and they use religion because that is what they have at hand." — Said Ferjani, an official of Tunisia’s mainstream Islamist party, Ennahda, speaking about the broader phenomenon of violence in the name of Islam.
post_description: Muslims are debating why their religion appears cited so often as a cause for violence and bloodshed.

post_name: Chicago Man Is Indicted on Charge of Trying to Aid ISIS
post_message: NA
post_description: Mohammed Hamzah Khan, a 19-year-old Muslim, was charged with trying to travel to Syria in October to join the terrorist army trying to overthrow governments in the Middle East.

post_name: After Terrorist Attacks, Many French Muslims Wonder: What Now?
post_message: France’s Muslim population — the largest in Europe — seems braced for a potential backlash, both political and personal, after the terrorist attacks in Paris.
post_description: France’s Muslim population — the largest in Europe — seems braced for a potential backlash, both political and personal, after the terrorist attacks.

post_name: Muslim Employee of Kosher Market in Paris Praised for Hiding Customers From Gunman
post_message: Lassana Bathily, 24, is credited with saving the lives of some customers by hiding them in a cold-storage room at the Hyper Cacher supermarket in Paris.
post_description: A Muslim employee, credited with saving the lives of customers at a kosher market in Paris on Friday, was praised online for his efforts.

post_name: 4 Victims of Attack at Kosher Supermarket in Paris Are Buried in Jerusalem
post_message: “I cry, but I know that you’re all crying with me, and I thank you all for all of this.”
post_description: Hundreds of Israelis, many of them recent immigrants from France, gathered to bury the men, who were killed in a hostage-taking last week.

post_name: New Charlie Hebdo Drawing Shows Muhammad, Raising Muslim Concerns
post_message: Muslim groups in France, Egypt and elsewhere said the cartoon on Charlie Hebdo Officiel's first cover since the attack on its journalists last week would exacerbate tensions.
post_description: Six days after the attack on Charlie Hebdo, Muslim groups in France, Egypt and elsewhere said the newspaper’s new cover would exacerbate tensions.

post_name: Share Your Experience as a Muslim in Europe
post_message:
The attacks on Charlie Hebdo Officiel and elsewhere in Paris heightened tensions in Europe, where the increasing radicalization of young Muslims appears to coincide with a growing anti-Islamic sentiment. 

We would like to hear from Europeans about what types of anti-Muslim bias, if any, they’ve witnessed or experienced. Please click the link to share your story.
post_description: The New York Times would like to hear from Europeans, particularly Muslims, about their experiences.

post_name: The Anger of Europe’s Young Marginalized Muslims
post_message: "What happened last week is not about lack of humor, or a failure to understand caricature. Nor is it about hatred of the West. It’s about anger taking a wrong turn." Read on in Opinion.
post_description: When everyone seems to mock your faith the pull of extremism is powerful.

post_name: House Votes to Revoke Legal Protections for Millions of Immigrants
post_message: The White House has said President Barack Obama will not sign any bill that blocks his executive actions on immigration.
post_description: Some Republican members deserted their party to vote against a bill denying safeguards for undocumented immigrants, including the young known as Dreamers.

post_name: New Charlie Hebdo Muhammad Cartoon Stirs Muslim Anger in Mideast
post_message: How governments and other authorities in Mideast countries responded to the new Charlie Hebdo Officiel cover.
post_description: The authorities in Egypt and Turkey moved to place restrictions on the cartoon, which shows the prophet shedding a tear over the Paris massacre.

post_name: After Suspending Supplier, Chipotle Takes Pork Off Menu in 600 Stores
post_message: Chipotle Mexican Grill has some bad news for some of the 6% of you who only eat the carnitas.
post_description: The unidentified meat supplier failed a routine audit to ensure that it met the company’s animal-welfare standards, causing a shortfall in the main ingredient in carnitas.

post_name: Seeking Legal Immigration Status, Longtime New Yorker Can’t Return to U.S.
post_message: “He was committed to making New York City better. He can’t do that now because he can’t come back,” said Robert C. Smith, a professor in the School of Public Affairs at Baruch College who became a mentor to Mr. Cabrera.
post_description: Angelo Cabrera lived in New York for 24 years, getting two degrees and founding a social services group. But when he went to Mexico to fix his immigration status, he was told he couldn’t return.

post_name: The Cruel Waste of America’s Tech Talent
post_message: When the Spare Parts Movie ends in 2004, the futures of the four young immigrants featured in it are bright. “Unfortunately, that’s not how the story really ends,” writes Op-Ed Contributor Joshua Davis, whose reporting inspired the movie. Read more in Opinion.
post_description: The not-so-heartwarming story of four young immigrants.

post_name: Fascination Persists Over Pets and the Afterlife
post_message: Maybe your dog isn’t just soulful, but is also, in fact, a member of a faith community. Maybe your dog is a Christian, perhaps of one denomination or another. Presbyterian pooch. Methodist mutt. Or maybe your dog is Mormon. Or Muslim? Perhaps even Jewish.
post_description: A comment attributed incorrectly to Pope Francis has led to renewed interest in a longstanding theological discussion.

post_name: Suspect in Disappearance of 43 Mexican Students Is Held
post_message: NA
post_description: Families of the missing young men have questioned the assumption that they were killed.

post_name: Pictures of the Day: Paris
post_message:
The French government said Thursday that it would award immediate citizenship to Lassana Bathily, an immigrant from Mali. 

Lassana Bathily was credited with saving the lives of several shoppers when the kosher market where he was working came under attack. Read more: http://nyti.ms/1Bi2fTU
post_description: Photos from Bahrain, India, China and France.

post_name: Fox News Becomes the Unwilling Star of a French TV Satire
post_message: "They did this on a weekend when all France and Paris was in a state of shock,” said the host of "Le Petit Journal." “I cried.” But, he said, it was also “irritating, so we chose humor to campaign against Fox News."
post_description: Fox issued a correction and an apology after “Le Petit Journal,” a mock news program, satirized the American channel for reporting on “no-go zones” for non-Muslims.

post_name: Paris Mayor Plans to Sue Fox Over False Reports of ‘No-Go Zones’
post_message: Mayor Anne Hidalgo said that the “very shocking, stupid” and “insulting remarks” from Fox News anchors and guests, indicating that parts of Paris were as insecure as Iraq or Afghanistan, had so “damaged the reputation and honor of Paris and Parisians” that she felt compelled “to go to court in order to have these words removed.”
post_description: Mayor Anne Hidalgo announced plans to take legal action against Fox News for inaccurate reports that areas of her city are Muslim-ruled enclaves.

post_name: Say It Like It Is
post_message: "When you don’t call things by their real name, you always get in trouble. And this administration, so fearful of being accused of Islamophobia, is refusing to make any link to radical Islam from the recent explosions of violence against civilians (most of them Muslims) by Boko Haram in Nigeria, by the Taliban in Pakistan, by Al Qaeda in Paris and by jihadists in Yemen and Iraq. We’ve entered the theater of the absurd," writes Op-Ed columnist Thomas Friedman. Read on in Opinion.
post_description: You can’t dance around the topic of radical Islam.

post_name: Leader of German Anti-Immigrant Group Steps Down Over Hitler Photo
post_message: Lutz Bachmann declined to comment on the image found on his Facebook page. Nor would he address another exchange on social media in which he is quoted as having referred to immigrants as “scumbags,” “stupid cows” and “trash.”
post_description: Lutz Bachmann, of Pegida, or Patriotic Europeans Against the Islamization of the West, had appeared as Adolf Hitler in an image on his Facebook page.

post_name: Jorge Ramos, Voice of Latino Voters on Univision, Sends Shiver Through G.O.P.
post_message: Univision TV anchor Jorge Ramos is “not only a journalist, he’s become the voice of the Latino constituency,” a campaign adviser to George W. Bush said. “And that’s where Republicans have to worry — you don’t want to lose Jorge Ramos.”
post_description: Mr. Ramos, the influential Univision and Fusion anchor, has begun criticizing Republicans over their immigration stance, posing a challenge to their 2016 hopes.

post_name: Law Favoring Cuban Arrivals Is Challenged
post_message: Cuban-American legislators in Washington and local officials in Florida are calling for reconsideration of a once-sacrosanct element of American foreign policy — the 1966 law that gives Cubans broader protections than any other immigrants arriving in the United States.
post_description: The U.S. law giving Cubans broader protections than other immigrants is unfair and unnecessary with the restoration of diplomatic relations, critics say.

post_name: The Muslims of Early America
post_message: "In a sense, Islam is as American as the rodeo." Read on in Opinion.
post_description: Like the rodeo, Islam is an indelible part of our culture.

post_name: In Chapel Hill Killing of 3 Muslims, a Question of Motive
post_message: “They were gems of their communities and left a lasting impression on the people around them,” Suzanne Barakat, a sister of Deah Barakat, said Wednesday.
post_description: The suspect, Craig Stephen Hicks, was a neighbor of the victims near the U.N.C. campus. A woman who called 911 said she heard five to 10 gunshots and screams.

post_name: In Chapel Hill Shooting of 3 Muslims, a Question of Motive
post_message: Quotation of the Day: "There is a tendency to say ‘This is a nice place, these eruptions of violence don’t belong here.’ And yet here we are. This is, in all of the heartbreak and violence and sadness, where we are." -- Omid Safi, a professor of Islamic studies, after three Muslim students were shot to death near the University of North Carolina.
post_description: Craig Stephen Hicks, 46, was charged with first-degree murder in the Chapel Hill, N.C., shooting. The police cited a parking dispute, but friends wondered if the victims’ faith played a role.

post_name: Funerals Planned for 3 Muslim Students Killed in North Carolina
post_message: This college town and its neighboring cities awoke Thursday to a day of grief as families prepared to lay to rest three Muslim students shot dead in a crime that has stunned the community with its senselessness.
post_description: The man charged in the killings, Craig Stephen Hicks, was transferred to a state prison, with officials citing security concerns.

post_name: Netanyahu Urges ‘Mass Immigration’ of Jews From Europe
post_message: “Jews have been murdered again on European soil only because they were Jews,” Benjamin Netanyahu - בנימין נתניהו said Sunday in Jerusalem. “Of course, Jews deserve protection in every country, but we say to Jews, to our brothers and sisters: Israel is your home.”
post_description: The day after a man was shot dead outside a Danish synagogue, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said that his government was encouraging a “mass immigration,” reopening a contentious debate about Israel’s role.

post_name: Boehner Says He’d Allow Homeland Security Shutdown
post_message: NA
post_description: Despite Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky’s pledge to avoid shutdowns, John A. Boehner, the House speaker, said he would allow funding for one of the government’s most vital agencies to lapse amid the immigration dispute.

post_name: A Summary: The Hidden Money Buying Condos at the Time Warner Center
post_message:
For more than a year, The New York Times examined the influx of global cash fueling the city’s high-end real estate boom. Here are links to each installment in the "Towers of Secrecy" series: 
- Part 1: Time Warner Center: Symbol of the Boom http://nyti.ms/1MrDsjL

post_name: Obama Immigration Policy Halted by Federal Judge in Texas
post_message: A federal judge in Texas has ordered a halt, at least temporarily, to President Obama’s executive actions on immigration, siding with Texas and 25 other states that filed a lawsuit opposing the initiatives.
post_description: An injunction was issued in a lawsuit by 26 states opposing the president’s initiatives to protect from deportation millions who are in the United States illegally.

post_name: Sexual Assault Allegations Against Illinois Imam Stir Divisions in Insular South Asian Community
post_message: In a community where discussion of sex is taboo and many girls are forbidden from attending school health classes, allegations against a leading figure in Chicago's South Asian Muslim community have added baggage.
post_description: Sexual abuse allegations and a planned lawsuit against Mohammad Abdullah Saleem in Elgin have divided segments of the imam’s followers and those in the community who reject the idea that the case should be handled privately.

post_message: NA

post_name: Pasco Police’s Shooting of Rock Thrower Draws Comparisons to Michael Brown Case

post_description: The shooting of a man who threw rocks at the police in Pasco, Wash., has led to comparisons to Ferguson, Mo., and drawn condemnation from the Mexican president and multiple investigations.

post_name: Faulted for Avoiding ‘Islamic’ Labels to Describe Terrorism, White House Cites a Strategic Logic
post_message: The last thing President Barack Obama should do, his aides say, is imply that the U.S. lumps the world’s 1.5 billion Muslims with vicious terrorist groups.
post_description: With remarkable consistency, President Obama and his aides have favored bland, generic terms over anything that explicitly connects attacks or plots to Islam.

post_name: Muslim Leaders in U.S. Seek to Counteract Extremist Recruiters
post_message: Though he has persuaded several young men to forget their plans to join the Islamic State, their recruiting efforts have become even more disturbing and nonstop.
post_description: The rise of the Islamic State and its recruitment efforts have jolted Muslim communities in the United States into action.

post_name: Obama Calls for Expansion of Human Rights to Combat Extremism
post_message: “When people spew hatred toward others because of their faith or because they’re immigrants, it feeds into terrorist narratives,” President Obama said. “It feeds a cycle of fear and resentment and a sense of injustice upon which extremists prey. And we can’t allow cycles of suspicion to tear the fabrics of our countries.”
post_description: President Obama, at a summit meeting on extremism, called on nations around the world to expand freedom, religious tolerance and peaceful dialogue as they struggle to combat a spate of terrorism.

post_name: U.S. Muslims Take On ISIS’ Recruiting Machine
post_message:

Imam Mohamed Magid, on persuading a teenager in Virginia to resist Islamic State recruiters, who inveigle through social media.
post_description: The rise of the Islamic State and its recruitment efforts have jolted Muslim communities in the United States into action.

post_name: White House to Seek Emergency Order to Let Immigration Plan Proceed
post_message: The move came in response to a ruling issued by a federal judge indefinitely postponing President Barack Obama’s sweeping executive actions on immigration.
post_description: During its appeal of a judge’s ruling, the Obama administration will seek an order to begin allowing immigrants to apply for benefits under President Obama’s executive action.

post_name: When Americans Lynched Mexicans
post_message: "Americans are largely unaware that Mexicans were frequently the targets of lynch mobs, from the mid-19th century until well into the 20th century, second only to African-Americans in the scale and scope of the crimes." Read on in Opinion.

post_name: Concerns Mount as Homeland Security Shutdown Looks Likely
post_message: The notion that Congress might actually shut down the Department of Homeland Security as part of a broader fight over President Barack Obama's immigration policies seemed laughable just a few weeks ago.
post_description: A little over a year after the last federal shutdown, officials at the Department of Homeland Security face having to furlough about 30,000 employees, creating worries about daily operations.

post_name: McConnell Offers Plan to Avoid Shutdown of Homeland Security Dept.
post_message: Senator Mitch McConnell proposed a vote on a bill to fund the Department of Homeland Security and a vote on whether to halt President Barack Obama's executive actions on immigration.
post_description: Senator Mitch McConnell, Republican of Kentucky and the Senate majority leader, offered a two-step path on Tuesday to avert a shutdown of the Department of Homeland Security, which runs out of money on Friday.

post_name: In a Case of Religious Dress, Justices Explore the Obligations of Employers
post_message:
“Then I learned I was not hired by Abercrombie because I wear a head scarf, which is a symbol of modesty in my Muslim faith,” said Samantha Elauf. “This was shocking to me.”

Here's how her encounter at an Abercrombie Kids store in Oklahoma became part of a vigorous argument before the Supreme Court.
post_description: A vigorous argument before the Supreme Court explored religious stereotypes, employment discrimination and the symbolism of the Muslim head scarf, all arising from an encounter at a clothing store in Tulsa, Okla.

post_name: A Mission of Mercy
post_message: I wasn’t worried about whether the baby would die. I knew he would,” writes Seema Jilani. “My fear was that I couldn’t keep him alive long enough so he could take his last breath in his mother’s arms.” Read on in Opinion.
post_description: This immigrant mother had to make a wrenching choice about her desperately ill newborn.

post_name: Servando Gómez, Mexican Drug Lord Known as La Tuta, Is Captured
post_message: Servando Gómez was one of the most wanted drug kingpins still at large in Mexico. He was eating a hot dog at a street stand when he was apprehended.
post_description: Mr. Gómez, who led the Knights Templar gang, vowed in taunting videos not to be taken alive. He was arrested at a hot dog stand, news reports said.

post_name: Los Angeles Police Veteran Makes Outreach to Muslims Part of His Mission
post_message: Chief Downing established a regular forum to meet with Muslim leaders, modeled after one he had formed with the gay activists in Hollywood.
post_description: In a 33-year career, Deputy Chief Michael Downing has forged bonds both durable and contentious between the police force and minority groups.

post_name: New York Today
post_message:
From New York Today: 

“They say, ‘Your father is ISIS, are you ISIS?’ "
post_description: What it's like to be 14 and Muslim in New York City, in the age of ISIS, Charlie Hebdo and "American Sniper." Meet Sandra Ibrahim.

post_name: Balancing Islam and Middle School in Queens
post_message: In fifth grade, Sandra Ibrahim started to wear the hijab. But there was teasing and bullying, her family said. Students at her public school yanked it from her head at least twice. So she took it off.
post_description: By most measures, New York is a religiously tolerant place, but public school, especially middle school, can be a testing ground for young Muslims.

post_name: Unhappy With a Moderate Jeb Bush, Conservatives Aim to Unite Behind an Alternative
post_message: The leaders of evangelical and other socially conservative groups say they do not believe that Jeb Bush would fight for the issues they care most about: opposing same-sex marriage, holding the line on an immigration overhaul and rolling back abortion rights.
post_description: Leaders of evangelical and socially conservative groups who believe that only a conservative can rally the base to win in 2016, have been vetting some contenders.

post_name: Which States Make Life Easier or Harder for Illegal Immigrants
post_message: For immigrants in the U.S. illegally, life can be very different from one state to another.
post_description: How different laws affect unauthorized immigrants in each state.

post_name: Shabab Attack on a Kenya University Kills 147, Officials Say
post_message: Update: At least 147 people were killed after attackers forced their way into student dorms at a university in eastern Kenya.
post_description: Gunmen attacked a campus in Kenya, clashing with guards, forcing their way into dormitories, taking hostages and singling out non-Muslims, the police said.

post_name: Report Sees Religions Growing and Shifting in Next Few Decades
post_message: Christianity has long been the world’s largest religion by far, but the population of Muslims is growing so fast that they will match Christians by 2070 and outnumber them by the end of the century, according to the Pew Research Center.
post_description: The report, from the Pew Research Center, projects that Muslims will outnumber Christians by 2070, and that birth rates will increase religious populations.

post_name: Shabab Attack on a Kenya University Kills 147, Officials Say
post_message: Breaking News: The death toll in the Thursday attack on a university in Kenya has risen to 147. The Shabab has issued a statement claiming responsibility.
post_description: Gunmen attacked a campus in Kenya, clashing with guards, forcing their way into dormitories, taking hostages and singling out non-Muslims, the police said.

post_name: Hillary Clinton’s Chipotle Order: Above Average
post_message: The potential bowl: chicken, white rice, black beans, fresh garden salsa, shredded cheese, lettuce and guacamole. Almost 75 percent of meals ordered at Chipotle Mexican Grill had more calories.
post_description: A semi-serious analysis comparing her lunch to those of everyday Americans.

post_name: Her Majesty’s Jihadists
post_message: "Can you imagine, a 20-year-old kid whose peers are getting drunk, obsessed with finding a girlfriend, as opposed to doing something in Syria or Iraq that, within an hour, gets a response from the president of the United States?"
post_description: More British Muslims have joined Islamist militant groups than serve in the country’s armed forces. How to understand the pull of jihad.

post_name: Palestinian Women Join Effort to Keep Jews From Contested Holy Site
post_message: They say it is their role to protect the integrity of the Noble Sanctuary from religious Jews who want to pray at a contested site that is held sacred by both.
post_description: The women say it is their role to protect the integrity of a Jerusalem site known to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary and to Jews as the Temple Mount.

post_name: Book by Slain Charlie Hebdo Editor Argues Islam Is Not Exempt From Ridicule
post_message: “If tomorrow all the Muslims of France convert to Catholicism or abandon all religion, that would change nothing to racist discourse: These foreigners or French citizens of foreign descent will still be singled out as responsible for all problems."
post_description: The book, published Thursday, was finished just two days before the editor, Stéphane Charbonnier, was killed by Islamist extremists.

post_name: Palestinian Women Join Effort to Keep Jews From Contested Holy Site
post_message: “Everybody must protect Al Aqsa so the Jews don’t take it," said a 57-year-old woman. "They have their eyes on it.”
post_description: The women say it is their role to protect the integrity of a Jerusalem site known to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary and to Jews as the Temple Mount.

post_name: France Announces Stronger Fight Against Racism and Anti-Semitism
post_message: Deadly attacks on Jews by Muslim extremists in January and a sharp spike in anti-Muslim acts since then have prompted the French government to elevate the fight against racism into “a great national cause."
post_description: Prime Minister Manuel Valls announced on Friday that there would be harsher punishments for racist acts and increased monitoring of online hate speech.

post_name: Migrants Face Fortress Europe’s Deadly Moat
post_message: "The European Union should stop treating migrants as criminals, and border control as warfare. It must dismantle Fortress Europe, liberalize immigration policy and open up legal routes for migrants. Some argue this would lead to a flood of immigrants, but current policy is not preventing people from migrating; it is simply killing them, by the boatload." Read on in The New York Times Opinion.
post_description: Thousands of migrants are dying at sea because of inhumane E.U. policy.

post_name: Tequila Is Getting Company: Sotol, Bacanora and Raicilla
post_message: Need a cocktail tonight? Meet the “other agaves.”
post_description: There’s more to agave than tequila and mezcal. Sotol, bacanora and raicilla are increasingly showing up in New York bars and restaurants, and not just Mexican ones.

post_name: French School Deems Teenager’s Skirt an Illegal Display of Religion
post_message: The case has lit up social networks in France and infuriated many who see the school system’s censure of the girl as discriminatory.
post_description: A secondary school in northeast France sent a 15-year-old student home for wearing a long skirt that the principal judged was “an ostentatious sign” of the girl’s Muslim faith.

post_name: Official Identifies One Suspect in Attack at Texas Anti-Islam Event
post_message: Breaking News: A law enforcement official has identified one of the suspects in the attack at an anti-Muslim event in Texas on Sunday as Elton Simpson of Phoenix. In 2010, federal prosecutors in Arizona charged Simpson with plotting to travel to Somalia "for the purpose of engaging in violent jihad."
post_description: A law enforcement official identified Elton Simpson of Phoenix as one of the gunmen who opened fire at an exhibit in Garland, Tex.

post_name: McDonald’s Chief Promises Turnaround in a Restructuring
post_message: A new generation is eschewing 麥當勞 burgers on the cheap, instead heading to rivals like Chipotle Mexican Grill and Shake Shack. Are the golden days over for the Golden Arches?
post_description: Steve Easterbrook, the new chief executive of the fast-food company, spoke of an “urgent need to reset this business” in a video message on Monday.

post_name: Dave Goldberg, Silicon Valley Executive, Said to Have Died After Exercising
post_message: Update: The death of Dave Goldberg, the CEO of SurveyMonkey and husband of Sheryl Sandberg of Facebook, occurred Friday night after he collapsed at the gym at a private resort in Mexico, a person close to the family said on Monday. A government spokesman said he died of head trauma and blood loss.
post_description: The 47-year-old chief of Survey Monkey, who was married to Sheryl Sandberg of Facebook, collapsed at a Mexican resort, a person close to the family said.

post_name: Dave Goldberg, Silicon Valley Executive, Died of Head Trauma, Official Says
post_message: Dave Goldberg, the chief executive of SurveyMonkey and husband of Sheryl Sandberg of Facebook, died of head trauma and blood loss Friday night after he collapsed at the gym at a private resort in Mexico, according to a Mexican government official.
post_description: The chief of SurveyMonkey, who was married to Sheryl Sandberg of Facebook, collapsed while exercising at a Mexican resort, according to a government official.

post_name: A Path to Citizenship, Hillary Clinton Says, 'Is at Its Heart a Family Issue'

post_name: Muslims in Texas Walk a Fine Line After Garland Shooting

post_name: Shooting Clouds Life as Both Muslim and Texan

post_name: Shooting Clouds Life as Both Muslim and Texan

post_description: The attack at a gathering that showcased artworks depicting the Prophet Muhammad has prompted Muslims to condemn extremism of any kind while also questioning when free speech becomes hate speech.

post_name: At the Cannes Film Festival, Reality Intrudes in a Make-Believe World
post_message: At the Festival de Cannes - Page Officielle, economic strife and other troubles of contemporary life are evident in this year's selection.
post_description: Economic strife, immigration travails, drug and human trafficking, and myriad contemporary woes push their way up in the usual garden of filmic delights.

post_name: Homeland Beckons Immigrants as Retirement Nears
post_message: “After all is said and done, after you’ve been here for 25 to 30 years, you want to go home.”
post_description: More immigrants to the United States are returning to their native countries, experts say. Some return for family reasons and others for a higher standard of living.

post_name: Want a Green Card? Invest in Real Estate
post_message: For foreign investors who have the money, the program can be an easy way to gain legal residency in the United States.
post_description: Investing in real estate projects in exchange for legal immigration status has become big business in New York City.

post_name: Prospect of Hillary Clinton-Marco Rubio Matchup Unnerves Democrats
post_message:
A Marco Rubio-Hillary Clinton contest could ultimately come down to Florida. 

Check out our sister page The New York Times Politics and Washington for more.
post_description: They are worried that Mr. Rubio, a son of Cuban immigrants, could win over Hispanic voters and that he would offer a sharp generational contrast.

post_name: Muslim Frenchwomen Struggle With Discrimination as Bans on Veils Expand
post_message: Politicians in France are continuing to push for measures to deny veiled women access to jobs, educational institutions and community life. Observant Muslim women say the constant talk of new laws has made them targets of abuse, from being spat at to having their veils pulled or being pushed when they walk on the streets.
post_description: The head coverings of observant Muslim women have become one of the most potent flash points in the nation’s tense relations with its Muslim population.

post_name: Muslim Frenchwomen Struggle With Discrimination as Bans on Veils Expand
post_message:
More than a decade after France first passed a law restricting the wearing of veils in public schools, the head coverings have become potent flash points in the country's relations with its Muslim population.  

We are hoping to hear from Muslim women on this issue. Do you choose to wear a veil or not? Tell us where you're from and what it has been like for you to wear, or not wear, a veil. 

A reporter will be reading the responses, and The Times may publish a selection of the comments.

These visas are controversial among Americans. Some see them as complementing American workers, others as displacing them. 

We want to hear from those in India. What's your take?

post_description: Donald Trump is derided as “a nutcase” in France and “a racist” in China, and his anti-immigrant rhetoric baffles Germany, where his grandparents were born.

post_name: Training Midwives to Save Expectant Mothers in Mexico’s Chiapas
post_message: In Chiapas, Mexico, traditional midwives are respected and loved for their skilled hands and wisdom, and for the warmth, affection and comfort they bring to women in labor. Now, officials hope to improve their skills.
post_description: The Mexican state, like many poor areas, has a high death rate among mothers in childbirth. In an effort to change that, village midwives are being linked to modern medicine.

post_name: Training Midwives to Save Expectant Mothers in Chiapas
post_message: In Mexico, a fight against maternal death links midwives to modern medicine.
post_description: The Mexican state, like many poor areas, has a high death rate among mothers in childbirth. In an effort to change that, village midwives are being linked to modern medicine.

post_name: Donald Trump’s Shaky Grasp of the Immigration Situation
post_message: Three researchers estimated that the tightening of border enforcement since 1986 actually added 4 million people to the population of immigrants living illegally in the United States in 2010.
post_description: That border wall already exists, but demographics and other factors have significantly shrunk the population of Mexicans who want to cross it.

post_name: What Donald Trump Understands About Republicans
post_message: How "demographic upheaval" is playing into Donald J. Trump's campaign, from The New York Times Opinion
post_description: Fifty years of Republican policies on race and immigration have readied the party for his candidacy.

post_name: Hungarian Leader Rebuked for Saying Migrants Must Be Blocked ‘to Keep Europe Christian’
post_message: "We have a right to decide that we do not want a large number of Muslim people in our country," Hungary's prime minister said.
post_description: “Is it not worrying in itself that European Christianity is now barely able to keep Europe Christian?” Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary asked.

post_name: Migrants Cross Austria Border From Hungary
post_message: Thousands of migrants who have been bottled up in Hungary, demanding passage to the West, will be allowed into Austria and Germany. Early Saturday, the first buses carrying them arrived at the Hungary-Austria border.
post_description: After thousands embarked on a 300-mile march toward Germany on Friday, the government retreated from enforcing European immigration restrictions.

post_name: This Broadway Season, Diversity Is Front and Center
post_message: It has been a long journey from “Tradition” to “Tradición.”
post_description: Tales of race and immigrants open doors this fall in shows like “The Color Purple,” “On Your Feet!” and “Allegiance.”

post_name: Egypt Forces Kill Tourists From Mexico
post_message: Police and military forces mistakenly shot at a Mexican tourist convoy while pursuing militants in Egypt’s Western Desert, killing at least 12 people, officials said.
post_description: Police and military forces mistakenly shot at a Mexican tourist convoy while pursuing militants in the country’s Western Desert, killing at least 12 people, officials said.

post_name: Egyptian Military Fired on Tourists During Picnic, Witnesses Say
post_message: The mistaken airstrike by the Egyptian military that killed a dozen people on a Mexican tourist trip in the Western Desert hit at a picnic in the middle of the day, witnesses said.
post_description: The attack in broad daylight by a helicopter raised new questions about the extent of the error and the official explanations.

post_name: A Migration Juggernaut Is Headed for Europe
post_message: The sooner Europe acknowledges it faces decades of heavy immigration, the sooner it will develop the policies to help integrate large migrant populations into its societies.
post_description: Europe can expect several decades of heavy immigration, and the sooner it develops policies to help integrate migrants the better for all concerned.

post_name: Focus on Donald Trump at ‘Undercard’ Debate Irks Low-Polling Candidates
post_message: He was called a “narcissist who only believes in himself” and “unfit” to be president. Despite not being on stage, Donald J. Trump loomed large over parts of the undercard #GOPDebate.
post_description: The four participants in Wednesday’s “undercard” debate, who failed to make the main forum because not one was above 1 percent in an average of polls, clashed on immigration and same-sex marriage.

post_name: Handcuffed for Making Clock, Ahmed Mohamed, 14, Wins Time With Obama
post_message: Quote of the Day: "Cool clock, Ahmed. Want to bring it to The White House? We should inspire more kids like you to like science. It's what makes America great." — President Barack Obama, on Twitter, to Ahmed Mohamed, a Texas 14-year-old who was detained after taking a homemade clock to school.
post_description: President Obama praised an Irving high school freshman’s interest in science after his arrest raised questions of bias toward a Muslim student who happens to love tinkering.

post_name: New White House Campaign Will Encourage Legal Immigrants to Become Citizens
post_message: The campaign could add millions of voters to the electorate in time for the presidential election next year.
post_description: The nationwide effort would be for legal immigrants and could add millions of voters to the electorate in time for the presidential election next year.

post_name: Hungarian Mayor Threatens Migrants in Homemade Action Movie
post_message: Laszlo Toroczkai, an ultranationalist mayor, threatened migrants with arrest and displayed his town’s security in a video edited in the style of a big-budget action movie.
post_description: Laszlo Toroczkai, an ultranationalist with a flair for the dramatic, released a video that threatens “illegal immigrants” with arrest.

post_name: Donald Trump Does Not Correct a Man Who Called Obama a Muslim
post_message: At a town hall event, Donald J. Trump took a question which began with the statement: “We have a problem in this country. It’s called Muslims.” The audience member continued, “We know our current president is one.” And as Mr. Trump responded, perhaps reflexively, “Right.”
post_description: Other presidential candidates are criticizing Mr. Trump’s silence after a man said the president was a Muslim who was not born in America.

post_name: Europe Should See Refugees as a Boon, Not a Burden
post_message: "There is good reason to believe that these immigrants will contribute more to Europe economically than they will take from it." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Immigrants generally pay more in taxes than they claim in government benefits.

post_name: Pope Francis to Find a Church in Upheaval
post_message: Special Report: The Roman Catholic Church that Pope Francis will encounter on his first visit to the U.S. is being buffeted by immense change. Its power base is shifting as some churches are bursting with immigrant parishioners, while others struggle to stay open.
post_description: Some U.S. churches are bursting with immigrant parishioners, while others struggle to stay open.

post_name: Without Calming Voice, G.O.P. Is Letting Divisive Ones Speak on Muslims
post_message: When Dr. Ben Carson said that he would not want to see a Muslim elected president, he exposed the lack of a unifying GOP leader who can temper the impulses of the rank-and-file.
post_description: When Ben Carson said he would not want to see a Muslim elected president, he reignited a volatile conversation and exposed a fissure between many Republican leaders and elements of the party’s grass roots.

post_name: An Unexpected Partner Helps Preserve a Manhattan Synagogue
post_message: “My eldest daughter, Sara, she asked me recently, ‘Poppy, are you the first Muslim to build a synagogue?’ I said: ‘No, honey, I’m sure there were others before. But maybe in New York I am.’”
post_description: Sharif El-Gamal, a real estate developer who is also Muslim, will build a new synagogue in his 29-story Dream Hotel for the one displaced in the development.

post_name: The Republican Attack on Muslims
post_message: Dr. Ben Carson's remarks reflect a habit among GOP leaders of "pandering to an angry, disaffected and heavily white base by demonizing selected minorities. Muslims are just the current target," the Editorial Board writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: The presidential candidates’ demagogy panders to a disaffected base and ignores American values.

post_name: Pope Francis’ Popularity Bridges Great Divides
post_message: “I’m a Muslim. But I believe that maybe God sent this guy to unite everybody together.”
post_description: When Francis speaks, millions listen — whether they are Muslim or Baptist, Hindu or atheist. He is a celebrity to those who admire his warmth and a rudder to those who share his concerns.

post_name: Pope Francis, in White House Ceremony, Praises Obama’s Action on Climate Change
post_message: During brief remarks, Pope Francis waded into two of America’s most highly charged political debates.
post_description: During an elaborate arrival event on the South Lawn, the pope waded into two of America’s most highly charged political debates, speaking on immigration and the environment.

post_name: Stampede Near Mecca Leaves at Least 453 Dead
post_message: Update: The death toll in the stampede outside Mecca has increased to at least 310.
post_description: The accident, in which 719 were also injured, occurred on the first day of Eid al-Adha, one of the holiest holidays in the Muslim calendar.

post_name: Stampede Near Mecca During Hajj Leaves at Least 717 Dead
post_message: Update: At least 717 people were killed, and 863 were injured, in a stampede near Mecca, Saudi Arabia, on Thursday morning.
post_description: The accident, in which 863 were also injured, occurred on the first day of Eid al-Adha, one of the holiest holidays in the Muslim calendar.

post_name: Pope Francis’ Popularity Bridges Great Divides
post_message:
Quote of the day: "I’m a Muslim. But I believe that maybe God sent this guy to unite everybody together." 
— Mostafa El Sehamy, a native Egyptian who is married to a Catholic of Mexican descent and won tickets to see Pope Francis
post_description: When Francis speaks, millions listen — whether they are Muslim or Baptist, Hindu or atheist. He is a celebrity to those who admire his warmth and a rudder to those who share his concerns.

post_name: Pope Francis Addresses Congress: ‘Most of Us Were Once Foreigners’
post_message: "In recent centuries, millions of people came to this land to pursue their dream of building a future in freedom. We, the people of this continent, are not fearful of foreigners, because most of us were once foreigners. I say this to you as the son of immigrants, knowing that so many of you are also descended from immigrants," Pope Francis said.
post_description: Pope Francis will visit Washington, New York and Philadelphia this week during his first trip to the United States.

post_name: Pope Francis Challenges Congress to Heal World’s ‘Open Wounds’
post_message:
Francis beseeched a nation that generates a disproportionate share of the world’s wealth to not let money drive its decisions at the expense of humanity. 

“Politics is, instead, an expression of our compelling need to live as one, in order to build as one, the greatest common good,” he told a joint meeting of Congress.
post_description: Speaking to lawmakers on Thursday, the pope issued a call to action on issues largely favored by liberals, including a critique of the excesses of capitalism and a defense of immigration.

post_name: What Happened at the Hajj Stampede Near Mecca
post_message:
More than 700 people were killed in a stampede near Mecca, Saudi Arabia, as millions of Muslims were making their pilgrimage, or hajj, to Mecca. 

Follow the latest developments: http://nyti.ms/1LPoUHi
post_description: Maps showing where more than 700 people were killed in a stampede near Mecca, Saudi Arabia.

post_name: A Gay Muslim Filmmaker Goes Inside the Hajj
post_message: A new documentary shows images of the annual pilgrimage that Saudi officials do not want others to see.
post_description: The filmmaker Parvez Sharma hopes that his new documentary, “A Sinner in Mecca,” will inspire questions among Muslims around the world. “Islam’s reformation is long overdue,” he said.

post_name: Refugee Crisis in Syria Raises Fears in South Carolina
post_message: “The U.N. calls it ‘refugee resettlement’ — the Muslims call it hijra, migration,” said another speaker, Jim McMillan, a local businessman. “They don’t plan to assimilate, they don’t plan to take on our culture. They plan to change the way of American life.”
post_description: The possibility of a wave of refugees has divided the state’s northwest corner, where critics worry they will burden services and alter the character of communities.

post_name: Highlights of Pope Francis’ Remarks in the U.S.
post_message: From his speech to Congress, his remarks at the United Nations, his homily at Madison Square Garden and more.
post_description: Over six days, the pope addressed Catholics and non-Catholics alike as he pleaded for environmental stewardship and compassion for immigrants and the poor in the halls of power.

post_name: Share of Immigrants in U.S. Nears Highs of Early 20th Century, Report Finds
post_message: “This most recent period really does reflect the notion that the United States is a nation built on immigration and has been able to absorb many immigrants from different parts of the world."
post_description: A Pew Research Center report revealed major shifts in immigration to the United States since Congress passed the Immigration and Nationality Act a half-century ago.

post_name: New Poll Finds Anti-Muslim Sentiment Frighteningly High
post_message: Donald J. Trump may be amusing to some, but many take him seriously. And a recent North Carolina poll has found alarming levels of xenophobia. Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Donald Trump may be amusing to some, but many take him seriously. And a recent North Carolina poll has found alarming levels of xenophobia.

post_name: Syria, Obama and Putin
post_message: "Putin stupidly went into Syria looking for a cheap sugar high to show his people that Russia is still a world power. Well, now he’s up a tree. Obama and John Kerry should just leave him up there for a month — him and Assad, fighting ISIS alone — and watch him become public enemy No. 1 in the Sunni Muslim world." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: It’s better to be wary of getting involved in Syria than rushing to do so.

post_name: Pope Francis, Kim Davis and Culture Wars Revisited
post_message: The news that Pope Francis met privately with Kim Davis "throws a wet blanket on the good will that the pontiff had garnered during his U.S. visit,” said Francis DeBernardo, executive director of an advocacy group for gay Catholics.
post_description: Pope Francis’ meeting with Kim Davis cheered conservatives troubled by his words on poverty, the environment and immigration, and dismayed liberals who said it negated much of the good will he had built up on his trip.

post_name: Miscalculation on Visas Disrupts Lives of Highly Skilled Immigrants
post_message: An abrupt change of course by the State Department has dashed the hopes of thousands of legal immigrants who had been waiting for their green cards.
post_description: An abrupt change of course by the State Department has dashed the hopes of thousands of legal immigrants who had been waiting for their green cards.

post_name: For Muslim-Americans, Baby Aidan or Baby Muhammad?
post_message:
"Should we give our baby a less Muslim-y name?"

Read more from The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: I d­id O.K. as Wajahat. My son would be fine with his ‘Muslim-y’ name too.

post_name: Mob Attack, Fueled by Rumors of Cow Slaughter, Has Political Overtones in India
post_message:
A group of men heard a rumor that a cow had been slaughtered. They responded by beating a man to death.

"Had the administration done their job at protecting our cows well," one leader in India's Bharatiya Janata Party said, "these men would not have been forced to take the law in their hands."
post_description: Ten men are charged with murdering a Muslim man over rumors that a cow had been killed, raising questions about a group allied with Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party.

post_name: On Sunday Nights, New York’s Busboys Become Cowboys
post_message: Go inside New York's "banda" scene, where cowboy boots light up the dance floor. (via New York Today)
post_description: Mexican immigrants flock to La Boom, in Queens, once a week to dance to songs of the outlaw life.

post_name: Publisher Promises Revisions After Textbook Refers to African Slaves as ‘Workers’
post_message: A Houston teenager was reading a textbook in his high school geography class when he came upon a map of the U.S. that caught his attention.
post_description: A Houston teenager noticed the reference in a geography textbook that included the slave trade in a chapter about immigration.

post_name: Mexican Wedding Cookies Recipe
post_message: A classic dessert that the whole family will love.
post_description: This recipe was brought to The Times in 1990 in an article about traditional Christmas cookies, but these butter-rich confections are delicious any time of year Sometimes called Mexican wedding cakes (or polvorones or Russian tea cakes or snowballs), their provenance is often debated, but this much…

post_name: Muslim Winner of Baking Contest Defies Prejudice in Britain
post_message: Her victory in "The Great British Bake Off" has been greeted by many in Britain as a symbol of immigration success.
post_description: The victory of Nadiya Jamir Hussain, a 30-year-old, head-scarf-wearing mother of three, has been greeted by many as a symbol of immigration success.

post_name: Historical Certainty Proves Elusive at Jerusalem’s Holiest Place
post_message: Within Jerusalem’s holiest site lies an explosive historical question that cuts to the essence of competing claims to what may be the world’s most contested piece of real estate
post_description: Many scholars have never definitively determined the precise site of two ancient Jewish temples at the Jerusalem site known as the Temple Mount to Jews and the Noble Sanctuary to Muslims.

post_name: Ben Carson Finds Momentum in Provocative Remarks
post_message: Ever since Dr. Ben Carson said that he did not think a Muslim should be president, his campaign has watched grass-roots support grow and donations pour in.
post_description: Mr. Carson’s campaign team once feared that his controversial comments could sink him. Now they’re seeing support for the Republican candidate grow.

post_name: With Anti-Muslim Campaign, Canada Has Its Trump Moment
post_message:
Used to the moral high ground, Canadians are watching their own politics getting dragged into divisive immigrant-bashing. 

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Used to the moral high ground, Canadians are watching their own politics getting dragged into divisive immigrant-bashing.

post_name: ‘El Chapo’ Fled as Security Forces Closed In, Mexico Officials Say
post_message: They tracked Mexico's most-wanted drug lord to a hide-out in the mountains — but he fled as they approached, officials say.
post_description: Security forces hunting for the escaped drug kingpin Joaquín Guzmán Loera tracked him to a hide-out in Mexico’s remote northwestern mountains, but he fled as they approached, injuring his leg and his face, Mexican officials said late Friday.

post_name: Time to Retire the Term ‘Alien’
post_message: Referring to immigrants as “aliens” plays to the xenophobic crowd and poisons the political debate, the Editorial Board argues in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Referring to immigrants as “aliens” plays to the xenophobic crowd and poisons the political debate.

post_name: Anti-Immigrant Violence in Germany Spurs New Debate on Hate Speech
post_message: “The incitement against refugees has reached a level which is absolutely horrifying and completely unacceptable.”
post_description: Politicians have called on social media to take down hateful language, and the government openly accuses the far right of organizing anti-immigrant rallies.

post_name: Donald Trump Says He Would Be Open to Closing U.S. Mosques to Fight ISIS
post_message: Donald J. Trump said that he wasn't sure about the legality of closing mosques, but that it was certainly something that should be looked at.
post_description: Prompting criticism from Muslim groups, Mr. Trump said on Fox Business Network that though he was not sure about the legality of closing mosques, “I would do that, absolutely” if, for example, “the mosque is, you know, loaded for bear.”

post_name: Wrongly Profiled and Deported
post_message: A deportation case in Louisiana suggests immigration enforcement agents are willing to work with corrupt police departments to further racial profiling and unjust detention, the Editorial Board writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Immigration enforcement has led to unjust detentions by corrupt police departments.

post_name: Myanmar’s Persecuted Minority
post_message:
Aung San Suu Kyi was interviewed on "60 Minutes" on Sunday night. 

Back in 2014, Op-Ed columnist Nicholas Kristof and Adam B. Ellick visited Myanmar and shared this collection of stories focusing on the Rohingya. Take a look back in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: A collection of stories from a recent trip focusing on a Muslim minority who are confined to camps and villages. UPDATED June 20: Nicholas Kristof responds to readers’ questions.

post_name: Mexico Moves to Scale Back a Successful Tax on Soda
post_message: The seemingly unquenchable thirst for soda in Mexico has made the soft drinks industry economically and politically powerful.
post_description: Two years ago, the Mexican government imposed a tax of about 10 percent on sugary drinks. Now, legislators are trying to roll it back, angering public health experts.

post_name: Channel Tunnel Migrant Emerges at Center of Asylum Debate
post_message: Arrested sneaking through the Channel Tunnel, is a Sudanese migrant a refugee or a criminal?
post_description: Human rights groups say Abdul Rahman Haroun, incarcerated for nearly three months, is a scapegoat at a time when immigrants are not welcome in Britain.

post_name: An Arab, Muslim, and Israeli Officer at the Center of a Storm
post_message: "I believe in the law, not because I want to be more Jewish than the Jews. I am a proud Arab with Palestinian roots, and I am the proudest Israeli."
post_description: Police work has been a calling for Superintendent Luba Samri since she joined the force, and she is at the crossroads of competing loyalties and emotions.

post_name: Paul Ryan Says He Won’t Work With Obama on Immigration Reform
post_message: Representative Paul Ryan, the new House speaker, said it would be "ridiculous" to try and work with President Barack Obama on immigration policy reform.
post_description: In a series of interviews televised on Sunday, the new House speaker signaled an antagonism that is likely to appeal to the conservatives within the Republican Party.

post_name: Latino Groups Call on ‘SNL’ to Drop Donald Trump
post_message: The decision by "Saturday Night Live" to invite Donald J. Trump as its host this week is no laughing matter for Hispanic and pro-immigration groups.
post_description: Leading Hispanic groups are calling for “Saturday Night Live” to rescind an invitation to Donald J. Trump, citing comments he made about Mexican immigrants.

post_name: Mexico’s Supreme Court Opens Door to Legalizing Marijuana Use
post_message: Breaking News: The Mexican Supreme Court delivered a pointed challenge to the nation’s strict substance abuse laws, adding its weight to the growing debate in Latin America over the costs and consequences of the war against drugs.
post_description: Ruling that individuals should have the right to grow and distribute marijuana for personal use, the court waded into the debate on the war on drugs.

post_name: Indian Muslim, Accused of Stealing a Cow, Is Beaten to Death by a Hindu Mob
post_message: Mohammad Hasmat Ali was beaten to death by a mob of Hindus who suspected him of stealing a cow.
post_description: It was the fourth time in six weeks that Hindus had killed Muslims they suspected of slaughtering, stealing or smuggling cows, which are seen as revered religious symbols.

post_name: Britons Perturbed by a Troubling Shortage of Curry Chefs
post_message: The curry industry has found itself in a pickle: There are not enough curry chefs in Britain.
post_description: Curry is so important to the British palate that it has its own committee in Parliament, but curry advocates say immigration restrictions are causing staff shortages.

post_name: Appeals Court Deals Blow to Obama’s Immigration Plans
post_message: The court said that President Barack Obama could not move forward with his plans to overhaul immigration rules by providing up to 5 million people with work permits and protection from deportation.
post_description: A federal appeals court said the president could not move forward with his plans to overhaul immigration rules by providing up to five million people with work permits and protection from deportation.

post_name: Obama Appeals Immigration Ruling to Supreme Court
post_message: Barack Obama will ask the Supreme Court to clear the way for his long-delayed immigration overhaul.
post_description: A federal appeals court ruling blocked the president’s plan to provide work permits to as many as five million undocumented immigrants while shielding most of them from deportation.

post_name: In Republican Debate, Candidates Battle Sharply on Immigration
post_message: In the most substantive debate so far, Jeb Bush and John Kasich tried to energize their campaigns by criticizing Donald J. Trump's immigration plan.
post_description: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida tried to gain political momentum by heaping scorn on Donald J. Trump’s plan to deport unauthorized immigrants.

post_name: G.O.P. Fight Now a Battle Over What Defines a Conservative
post_message: The GOP debate exposed a dispute over what it means to be a conservative.
post_description: The debate opened a new season of the campaign shaped by the glaring policy fissures that are dividing Republicans, from immigration and bank regulation to taxes and national security.

post_name: Spicy Lentil and Sweet Potato Stew With Chipotles Recipe
post_message: Warm up with this easy 5-star recipe from our friends The New York Times Food.
post_description: The sweetness of the sweet potatoes infuses this Mexican-inspired lentil dish along with the heat of the chipotles, which also have a certain sweetness as well because of the adobo sauce they’re they are packed in The combination, with the savory lentils, is a winner.

post_name: Immigration Fight Boils Over as Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio Battle
post_message: Ted Cruz accused Marco Rubio of “trying to jam this amnesty down the American people’s throats.”
post_description: The long-distance skirmishing illustrated the degree to which several Republican candidates see immigration as the most potent weapon in the presidential contest.

post_name: Marco Rubio’s History on Immigration Leaves Conservatives Distrustful of Shift
post_message: Marco Rubio finds his shifting views on immigration under attack, caught up in the anti-immigration passions roiling the GOP.
post_description: Anti-immigration passions have roiled the Republican Party through the primary and debate season. And the shifting views of one Republican presidential candidate seen by some as a rising star, Marco Rubio, are under attack.

post_name: Parisians Fear Terror Attacks Will Divide, Not Unite, the City
post_message: The Paris attacks provoked fear and concern about France’s ability to manage the gulf between Muslims and non-Muslims.
post_description: Friday’s killings came just 10 months after the massacre at Charlie Hebdo, provoking new concern about France’s ability to manage the deep gulf between Muslims and non-Muslims.

post_name: Invoking Nazis, Marco Rubio Hits Hillary Clinton for Not Saying U.S. at War With 'Radical Islam'
post_message: Senator Marco Rubio criticized Hillary Clinton's reluctance to describe the U.S. as “at war with radical Islam.” (via The New York Times Politics and Washington)
post_description: Attacking Mrs. Clinton, the Florida senator drew a parallel between members of the Nazi Party who did not commit acts of violence and Muslims who are not violent extremists.

post_name: Video: Muslims in Paris Condemn Attacks
post_message: "Religious terminology cannot be used to describe these individuals. I would call them terrorists, and only terrorists. Not jihadists nor Islamists, because in the end they are terrorists."
post_description: Muslims in the French capital condemned the terrorists that attacked their city, saying they tarnished Islam.

post_name: In Suspects’ Brussels Neighborhood, a History of Petty Crimes and Missed Chances
post_message: Just 8 days before Ibrahim Abdeslam blew himself up in Paris, authorities in the heavily immigrant Brussels district of Molenbeek already had the future terrorist in their sights.
post_description: The inability to stop a suspect in the deadly Paris attacks was just one example of missed opportunities by the Belgian and French authorities and intelligence services.

post_name: After Paris Attacks, a Darker Mood Toward Islam Emerges in France
post_message: Unlike after the Charlie Hebdo attacks in January, calls for solidarity with Muslims have been rare.
post_description: Unlike after the Charlie Hebdo attacks in January, calls for solidarity with Muslims have been rare while even the left-wing government considers harsher security measures.

post_name: Marine Le Pen’s Anti-Islam Message Gains Influence in France
post_message: "France and the French are no longer safe," Marine Le Pen said in a speech the day after the Paris attacks, demanding a crackdown on Islamists in the country.
post_description: The leader of France’s far-right National Front party has pushed the main center-right party toward a stronger anti-immigrant stance after Friday’s attacks.

post_name: The Attacks in Paris Reveal the Strategic Limits of ISIS
post_message: "ISIS will hit the same wall as Al Qaeda: Globalized terrorism is no more effective, strategically, than conducting aerial bombings without forces on the ground. Much like Al Qaeda, ISIS has no support among the Muslim people living in Europe. It recruits only at the margins." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Globalized terrorism is no more effective than conducting aerial bombings without forces on the ground.

post_name: Refugees Across Europe Fear Repercussions From Paris Attacks
post_message: The migrants, most of them Muslim, are likely to be viewed with greater suspicion — making it more difficult to settle into the communities they had hoped to join.
post_description: After fleeing their homeland to escape war and Islamist extremism, many now find that their long trek to the Continent may offer no guarantee of protection.

post_name: After Myanmar Election, Few Signs of a Better Life for Muslims
post_message: Muslims in Myanmar have been denied citizenship rights and are confined to bleak villages and camps. That doesn't seem likely to change.
post_description: Experts said they expected no drastic changes in government policies toward Muslims, but they held out hope that things at least would not become worse.

post_name: To Stop Radicalization, the French Need More Fraternité
post_message: From The New York Times Opinion Section: "In the wake of last week’s carnage in Paris, revenge is easy. Changing a culture will be difficult."
post_description: If France is going to defeat ISIS, it will have to find solutions for the alienation and seclusion felt by its own Muslim citizens.

post_name: More Mexican Immigrants Leaving U.S. Than Entering, Report Finds
post_message: A Pew report found that from 2009 to 2014, about a million Mexicans returned to live in Mexico, while about 870,000 Mexicans came to the U.S.
post_description: The shift marks the first time since immigration from Mexico began to rise in the 1970s that fewer Mexicans came into America than returned home.

post_name: Donald Trump Says He'd 'Absolutely' Require Muslims to Register
post_message: When asked how this would differ from Jews having to register in Nazi Germany, Donald J. Trump repeatedly said, "You tell me," until he stopped responding to the question.
post_description: Donald J. Trump, who earlier in the week said he was open to requiring Muslims in the United States to register in a database, said in Iowa on Thursday night that he “would certainly implement that — absolutely.”

post_name: Donald Trump's Call for Muslim Registry Denounced by Democrats
post_message: When asked how compiling a database of Muslims would be different from Jews having to register in Nazi Germany, Donald J. Trump repeatedly said, “You tell me,” until he stopped responding to the question.
post_description: Donald J. Trump’s remarks took hours to penetrate over social media, but by Friday morning, Democrats were calling him out. Jeb Bush was one of the few Republican presidential candidates calling Mr. Trump’s contentious words “just wrong.”

post_name: Donald Trump Steps Back From Calling for Muslim Registry
post_message: Donald J. Trump drew back from calling for a database to keep track of Muslims in America, saying that the suggestion had come from a reporter.
post_description: Mr. Trump said the idea that Muslims in America should register with the federal government had come from a reporter.

post_name: Donald Trump Sets Off a Furor With Call to Register Muslims in the U.S.
post_message: “We had expected a rise in Islamophobic rhetoric during the election cycle, but we never thought it would hark back to the rhetoric of the 1930s."
post_description: Mr. Trump drew back from his call for a mandatory registry of Muslims in the United States, capping a week where candidates discussed their approaches to terrorism.

post_name: Anti-Muslim Is Anti-American
post_message: Op-Ed columnist Charles M. Blow on the "cesspool of Islamophobic rhetoric coming from Republican candidates" after the Paris attacks.
post_description: Demonizing a single religion is a slippery slope, with the danger of hateful acts getting progressively worse.

post_name: Ben Carson Says He Also Saw Muslims Celebrating on 9/11
post_message: Dr. Ben Carson has joined Donald J. Trump in saying that he too saw Muslims cheering when the World Trade Center fell on Sept. 11, 2001. (via The New York Times Politics and Washington)
post_description: Ben Carson has joined Donald J. Trump in saying that he, too, saw American Muslims celebrate as the World Trade Center fell — an assertion for which there is no evidence.

post_name: In France, Some See the Police Security Net as Too Harsh
post_message: The police in France are now free to pick up and interrogate suspects virtually at will.
post_description: With expanded police powers extended for three more months, some, particularly Muslims, question whether the loss of liberties is appropriate.

post_name: A Definitive Debunking of Donald Trump’s 9/11 Claims
post_message: Few people can address the circumstances more definitively than John Farmer Jr., who served as senior counsel to the 9/11 commission.
post_description: Few are more qualified than John J. Farmer Jr. to assess the idea being peddled by Mr. Trump that Muslims danced in the streets of New Jersey when the World Trade Center fell.

post_name: ‘I’m Frightened’: After Terrorist Attacks, New York City Muslims Cope With a Backlash
post_message: “It feels like everybody’s staring like you’re on stage and you’re scared to do anything wrong.”
post_description: Since assailants killed more than 100 people in France earlier this month, Muslims have reported being attacked and harassed, leading friends, imams and parents to urge one another: Stay alert.

post_name: At Donald Trump Rally, Ohio Students Become Part of a Lesson
post_message: They came to a Donald J. Trump rally to get extra credit for a history class. They were about to become part of the lesson.
post_description: Donald J. Trump’s heated language on surveillance of Muslims, immigration and Syrian refugees is firing up his crowds and at times resulting in physical clashes between supporters and protesters.

post_name: For Carly Fiorina, Peripatetic Childhood Helped Build Worldview
post_message: Before her rise, Carly Fiorina was Carleton Sneed, moving from school to school around the country and the world and learning how to quickly make, if not keep, friends.
post_description: The Republican candidate’s upbringing included performing Shakespeare at a girls school in London and waking to the sound of Muslims praying in Ghana.

post_name: For Carly Fiorina, Peripatetic Childhood Helped Build Worldview
post_message: Before her rise, Carly Fiorina was Carleton Sneed, moving from school to school around the country and the world and learning how to quickly make, if not keep, friends.
post_description: The Republican candidate’s upbringing included performing Shakespeare at a girls school in London and waking to the sound of Muslims praying in Ghana.

post_name: Safety Lapses and Deaths Amid a Building Boom in New York
post_message: New York City's building boom has come at a sobering cost.
post_description: An increase in fatalities and injuries has mostly affected undocumented immigrant laborers and far exceeds the rate of new construction.

post_name: From Indonesia, a Muslim Challenge to the Ideology of the Islamic State
post_message: An Indonesian Muslim organization that claims more than 50 million members has launched a global campaign against jihadism.
post_description: The campaign comes at a time when Islam is at war with itself over central theological questions of how the faith is defined.

post_name: Why I Miss George W. Bush
post_message:
"I did not expect to ever find much to admire about President George W. Bush. But as a Muslim who has come to work in America, I have recently had to revise my opinion." 

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Unlike this crop of G.O.P. bigots, he showed respect for Muslims.

post_name: ISIS Promise of Statehood Falling Far Short, Ex-Residents Say
post_message: “ISIS wants to build a new society, but they’ll end up all alone.”
post_description: Cruelty, a lack of services and an onerous tax system are driving people from areas controlled by the Islamic State, challenging its claim of being a government for the world’s Muslims.

post_name: Avenue Spared in Paris Attacks Embodies What Terrorists Targeted
post_message: With its bobo bars toward one end and Muslim enclave at the other, Rue Jean-Pierre Timbaud is Paris in a nutshell.
post_description: Rue Jean-Pierre Timbaud, just around the corner from the Bataclan theater, reflects the civic pluralism and street life that the attackers loathed and feared.

post_name: France Shuts Down Three Mosques and Four Muslim Prayer Rooms
post_message: The French government has shut down three mosques and several informal Muslim prayer rooms out of concern that they were contributing to Islamic radicalization.
post_description: The interior minister told the National Assembly that the state of emergency made the action necessary, but there are political overtones.

post_name: Smooth Visa Process for Woman in Attack Is Focus of Inquiry
post_message: Tashfeen Malik passed through 2 rounds of criminal and national security background checks as she obtained a “fiancé visa.”
post_description: Federal officials were reviewing the immigration records of Tashfeen Malik, who came here to marry Syed Rizwan Farook and was killed after the San Bernardino massacre.

post_name: Muslims in America Condemn Extremists and Fear Anew for Their Lives
post_message: Muslims and leaders of mosques in the U.S. say they are experiencing death threats, assaults and vandalism unlike anything they have experienced since the aftermath of 9/11.
post_description: Muslims across the United States say they are experiencing a wave of death threats, assaults and vandalism unlike anything they have experienced since the aftermath of Sept. 11.

post_name: President of Liberty University Urges Students to Get Gun Permits
post_message: "I've always thought if more good people had concealed-carry permits, then we could end those Muslims before they walked in and killed us," Liberty University President Jerry Falwell Jr. said. "Let's teach them a lesson if they ever show up here."
post_description: Jerry Falwell Jr. suggested that the victims of the California shootings might have defended themselves if they had been armed.

post_name: ‘You Ain’t No Muslim, Bruv’: Response to London Attack Inspires Hashtag
post_message: The words of a bystander, shouted at the suspect in a knife attack in a London subway station, became a worldwide trending term on Twitter.
post_description: A knife attack in London was being investigated as a "terrorist incident." But the words of a bystander are what have captured public attention.

post_name: Marco Rubio, Switching Focus, Aims to Halt Ted Cruz’s Momentum
post_message: Marco Rubio is portraying Ted Cruz as a hypocrite on immigration. Cruz has welcomed the attacks as confirmation of his own growing strength.
post_description: In interviews, speeches and in stealthier ways, Mr. Rubio has abruptly changed the course of his campaign to zero in on Mr. Cruz.

post_name: Donald Trump Calls for Barring Muslims From Entering U.S.
post_message: Donald J. Trump called for the United States to bar all Muslims from entering the country. “Until we are able to determine and understand this problem and the dangerous threat it poses, our country cannot be the victims of horrendous attacks by people that believe only in jihad, and have no sense of reason or respect for human life,” he said.
post_description: Mr. Trump called on Monday for the United States to bar all Muslims from entering the country until the nation’s leaders can “figure out what is going on” after the terrorist attacks in San Bernardino, Calif., an extraordinary escalation of rhetoric aimed at voters’ fears about members of the Islami…

post_name: Donald Trump's GOP Rivals Condemn His Call to Ban Muslims From Entering U.S.
post_message: "Donald Trump is unhinged. His 'policy' proposals are not serious." — Jeb Bush
post_description: Donald J. Trump’s call to ban Muslims from entering the United States has drawn swift condemnation from his Republican rivals for the nomination, raising the question of whether the billionaire businessman has finally gone too far.

post_name: Democrats Begin Fund-Raising Off Trump's Proposed Ban on Muslims
post_message: The campaigns of Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders have responded to Donald J. Trump's proposal to ban Muslims from entering the U.S.
post_description: On Monday night, Hillary Clinton’s longtime aide, Huma Abedin, sent a mass email to supporters, saying that Mr. Trump’s “Islamophobia” did not reflect the nation’s values and “could even threaten our national security.”

post_name: Donald Trump Defends Call to Block Muslims, Citing Roosevelt
post_message: "This is a president highly respected by all; he did the same thing," Donald J. Trump said, citing Franklin D. Roosevelt's classification of thousands of Japanese, Germans and Italians in the U.S. during World War II as "enemy aliens."
post_description: Mr. Trump pointed to President Franklin D. Roosevelt’s actions toward Japanese, German and Italian aliens during World War II as precedent.

post_name: Donald Trump’s Call to Bar Muslims Reverberates Abroad
post_message: “A country that voted twice for Obama cannot elect a man like that.” —Laura Albat, France
post_description: The Republican presidential candidate’s comments drew condemnation from Europe and beyond, as well as questions about the direction of the United States.

post_name: Chipotle’s Safety Woes Worsen as Scores of Students Fall Ill in Boston
post_message: The number of Boston College students who became ill after eating at a Chipotle grew to 80.
post_description: Chipotle Mexican Grill’s stock continued to fall after worries about food safety spread to Boston, where 80 college students got sick after eating at one of its restaurants.

post_name: Trump’s Anti-Muslim Plan Is Awful. And Constitutional.
post_message: Donald J. Trump's proposal is awful. But it's not unconstitutional. Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: The Supreme Court would have to approve his proposal to bar Muslim immigrants. But that doesn’t mean Americans should accept it.

post_name: For Immigrants, America Is Still More Welcoming Than Europe
post_message: Why is the U.S. more successful than Europe at integrating immigrants into the national fabric?
post_description: While its policies are often hostile, the United States is more successful than Europe at integrating immigrants into the national fabric.

post_name: British Petition to Keep Donald Trump Out of Country
post_message: So many people have signed the petition that Parliament is now legally required to consider debating the matter.
post_description: Angered by the candidate’s comments about Muslims, more than 100,000 people have signed the petition to bar him from Britain on hate-speech grounds.

post_name: Mosque Shows That Muslims Have Long Been a Part of New York
post_message: Muslims have been called many things lately in America. New Yorkers, however, have had their own word for them, going back more than a century: Neighbors.
post_description: Evidence is coming to light that Muslims not only lived in a downtown community near the turn of the 20th century, but worshiped there, too.

post_name: Obama Calls for End to Bigotry, in Implicit Rebuke of Donald Trump
post_message: President Barack Obama called for Americans to reject bigotry, appearing to use the 150th anniversary of the amendment abolishing slavery to challenge Donald J. Trump's anti-Muslim politics.
post_description: The president appeared to use the 150th anniversary of the amendment abolishing slavery to challenge the anti-Muslim politics espoused by the Republican candidate.

post_name: Donald Trump Loses Luster When Words Reach the Middle East
post_message: “I now feel ashamed to live in a building associated with such a vile man,” said Melek Toprak, 38, who lives at Trump Towers Istanbul.
post_description: Donald Trump’s plan to bar Muslims from entering the United States has provoked outrage in the Middle East that could threaten his brand’s golden appeal there.

post_name: #You Ain’t No American, Bro
post_message: Donald J. Trump, by alienating the Muslim world with his call for a ban, is acting as ISIS's secret agent, Thomas Friedman writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Donald Trump is doing real damage to America’s ability to lead a coalition, the only vehicle that can effectively address ISIS.

post_name: German Woman Denies Role in Murders in Neo-Nazi Case
