post_message: Beate Zschäpe, 40, rejected charges that she had been part of an underground cell that killed 9 immigrants and a policewoman.
post_description: Beate Zschäpe, in a statement to a Munich court, rejected charges she had been part of an underground cell that killed nine immigrants and a policewoman from 2000 to 2007.

post_name: Muhammad Ali Defends Islam After Trump’s Remarks
post_message: "We as Muslims have to stand up to those who use Islam to advance their own personal agenda," Muhammad Ali said in a statement.
post_description: Mr. Ali called on political leaders to foster understanding about his faith after Mr. Trump’s call to bar foreign Muslims from entering the United States.

post_name: Mark Zuckerberg of Facebook Reassures Muslim Users
post_message: “If you’re a Muslim in this community, as the leader of Facebook I want you to know that you are always welcome here and that we will fight to protect your rights and create a peaceful and safe environment for you," Mark Zuckerberg said.
post_description: Mr. Zuckerberg’s new openness on social media has met up with business considerations.

post_name: 'Do You Know Me? Do You Know My Heart?' On Being Muslim in NYC
post_message:
“When I’m on the train, people don’t want to sit beside me. I’d like to talk but it’s easier to be silent. It’s sad. It’s easier for those who look American, but people who dress like me with a beard and kufi and my wife, who is covered, guys on the train see you and give you a grilled look.

“Do you know me? Do you know my heart? Why are you judging by looking at me?”
post_description: New York City Muslims respond to Donald Trump’s call to bar followers of Islam from entering the United States.

post_name: Donald Trump’s Words Have Added Sting for 2 Muslims in Congress
post_message: “It would be unacceptable and even un-American for me to not speak up and fight back,” Representative André Carson said.
post_description: “It would be unacceptable and even un-American for me to not speak up and fight back,” said Representative André Carson of Donald J. Trump’s call to bar members of his faith from entering the United States.

post_name: Voter Insecurities Feed Rise of Right-Leaning Populist Politicians
post_message: A new breed of right-leaning populists like Donald J. Trump, Marine Le Pen in France and Viktor Orban in Hungary are surging in popularity by capitalizing on a climate of insecurity.
post_description: Financial worries and fears about terrorism and immigration are contributing to a rise in right-wing politicians in Europe similar to Donald J. Trump.

post_name: The Words That Killed Medieval Jews
post_message: "Today’s purveyors of anti-Muslim, anti-immigrant, anti-police and anti-abortion rhetoric and imagery may not for a moment intend to provoke violence against Muslims, immigrants, police officers and health care providers. But in the light of history, they should not be shocked when that violence comes to pass." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: History tells us that violent speech leads to violent acts.

post_name: In These Hard Times, How Do You Talk to Your Children About Being Muslim?
post_message: The Times wants to hear from Muslim parents about how they talk to their children about the rise in anti-Muslim speech as well as attacks by extremists in the name of Islam.
post_description: The Times wants to hear from Muslim parents about how they talk to their children about the rise in anti-Muslim speech as well as attacks by extremists in the name of Islam.

post_name: Even Donald Trump’s Critics Admit Rising Anxiety Over Security
post_message: “We all have to safeguard against an inner Trump.”
post_description: In interviews with Americans, those who deplore Mr. Trump’s call to ban Muslim immigrants are nonetheless more fearful after the attack in California.

post_name: Goose-Steppers in the G.O.P.
post_message: What Donald J. Trump has "done is to give marginalized Americans permission to hate," Timothy Egan writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: The party is home to millions who would welcome a police state against Latinos and Muslims, and enforce a religious test for entry into the country.

post_name: U.S. Visa Process Missed Zealotry on Social Media
post_message: One of the San Bernardino attackers, Tashfeen Malik, talked openly on social media about supporting violent jihad. Three background checks missed it.
post_description: Tashfeen Malik passed three background checks by American immigration officials but none uncovered what she had made little effort to hide — that she talked openly on social media about her desire to take part in violent jihad.

post_name: The Rise of Hate Search
post_message:
"We can explain some of the rise and fall of anti-Muslim hate crimes just based on what people are Googling about Muslims."

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: What we type into Google gives us a glimpse of our darkest impulses. It can also predict anti-Muslim crimes.

post_name: Young Muslim Americans Are Feeling the Strain of Suspicion
post_message: Instead of occupying herself with a teenager’s normal concerns, Hebh Jamal has had to contend with growing anti-Muslim sentiment, adjusting her routines to avoid attacks and worrying about how she appears to the rest of society.
post_description: Growing up amid the fight against terrorism, a generation is buffeted by prejudice and politics, and parents and counselors are growing concerned about the toll it is taking.

post_name: Young Muslim Americans Are Feeling the Strain of Suspicion
post_message: Quote of the Day: "I feel like the past 2 months have probably been the hardest of my life." — Hebh Jamal, 15, of the Bronx, on dealing with a rise in anti-Muslim sentiment.
post_description: Growing up amid the fight against terrorism, a generation is buffeted by prejudice and politics, and parents and counselors are growing concerned about the toll it is taking.

post_name: Obama to Counter Anti-Muslim Talk by Welcoming New Citizens
post_message: 25 Republican governors have vowed to block the entry of Syrian refugees into their states. President Barack Obama has condemned such comments as contradicting American values.
post_description: The president’s speech at a naturalization ceremony on Tuesday comes as many Republican governors have vowed to bar Syrian refugees from their states.

post_name: How Unpopular Is Trump’s Muslim Ban? Depends How You Ask
post_message: Exactly how unpopular it is depends on what question a pollster asked.
post_description: Many pollsters have sought to gauge the public view on this issue in recent days, and the varying results highlight a challenge in polling.

post_name: Muslim Parents on How They Talk to Their Children About Hatred and Extremism
post_message: "I let them know that I am not afraid to wear my hijab out and that they should be proud of being both American and Muslim."
post_description: A wave of recent attacks by extremists acting in the name of Islam has contributed to a rise in anti-Muslim speech.

post_name: In Republican Debate, Rivals Berate Donald Trump on Muslim Ban
post_message: The Republican debate was dominated by negative exchanges, put-downs and criticism — particularly of Donald J. Trump and Marco Rubio.
post_description: The negative tone reflected an intensely competitive race and a belief that voters are seeking an assertive leader.

post_name: Wheaton College Professor Is Put on Leave After Remarks on Islam
post_message: A Wheaton College professor who put on a headscarf and talked about the similarities between Christianity and Islam is now facing discipline for her statements.
post_description: Dr. Larycia Hawkins, an associate professor at the Christian college who also donned a headscarf, wrote on social media that “Christians and Muslims worship the same God.”

post_name: Malala Yousafzai, Nobel Winner, Calls Donald Trump's Remarks on Muslims 'Full of Hatred'
post_message: "Well, that’s really tragic that you hear these comments which are full of hatred, full of this ideology of being discriminative towards others," Malala Yousafzai said in response to Donald J. Trump's remarks on Muslims.
post_description: Ms. Yousafzai, the youngest winner of the Nobel Peace Prize, is the latest to denounce Mr. Trump’s proposals on Muslims.

post_name: Conservative Ire Grows Over Marco Rubio’s Past on Immigration
post_message: Marco Rubio is suddenly facing a torrent of criticism from within his own party unlike anything he has faced so far in the presidential race.
post_description: Mr. Rubio has taken to questioning Senator Ted Cruz’s toughness on illegal immigration, a line of attack that some Republicans say they find disingenuous.

post_name: I Worry About Muslims
post_message:
"Islam teaches me to care about all human beings, and animals too, but life is short and I can’t even find enough time to worry about all the Muslims."

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Mostly I worry about my kind of Muslims, those who are expected to explain to the world what real Islam is like.

post_name: Norway Offers Migrants a Lesson in How to Treat Women
post_message: "There are lots of men who haven’t learned that women have value,” said a former Oslo police officer. "This is the biggest problem, and it is a cultural problem."
post_description: A pioneering program seeks to combat sexual violence by helping new immigrants adapt to a society whose sexual norms they may find confusing.

post_name: Chipotle E. Coli Cases Rise, With 5 More Ill in Midwest
post_message: 5 more people became sick after eating at 2 more Chipotle Mexican Grill restaurants.
post_description: The latest outbreak was tied to two outlets in Kansas and Oklahoma. The restaurant chain still does not know which of the 68 ingredients it uses might be tainted.

post_name: Transgender Muslims Find a Home for Prayer in Indonesia
post_message: Al Fatah Pesantren in Yogyakarta, Indonesia, is the only Muslim academy or madrasa for transgender people in the world, its leader says.
post_description: Transgender women have few opportunities to worship, as their defiance of strict gender categorization challenges conventional Muslim views about gender.

post_name: The Actress Cynthia Erivo Rises With ‘The Color Purple’
post_message: Critics call her "incandescent" and "transcendent."
post_description: Ms. Erivo has received much praise for her portrayal of Celie in this Broadway revival, the latest step in a career that began as the daughter of Nigerian immigrants to London.

post_name: American Muslims Under Attack After San Bernardino and Paris Terror
post_message: The rate of suspected hate crimes against Muslims in the U.S. has tripled since the attacks in Paris, one recent analysis found.
post_description: Reports of attacks and threats against Muslims in the United States have surged, researchers and civil rights groups say.

post_name: U.S. Muslims Begin to Publicly Confront Questions on Islam and Violence
post_message: “I feel like the Muslim community does need to do more. We had a shooter from our mosque do this.”
post_description: Across the country, many American Muslims are now saying it is no longer enough to denounce terrorism and assert that Islam is a religion of peace.

post_name: Barring of British Muslim Family Flying to Disneyland Touches Nerve
post_message: A member of the family said they had reached the boarding gate when they were abruptly told they could not board.
post_description: The passengers said American officers at Gatwick Airport near London did not give a reason for denying them permission to board a flight to Los Angeles.

post_name: A Christmas Economy Thrives All Year in the Mountains of Mexico
post_message: Michoacán is no North Pole. Yet it celebrates Christmas every day of the year all the same, as a production center of handmade ornaments for the Mexican, American and Canadian markets.
post_description: Tourists come from across Mexico and the world to the small village of Tlalpujahua, known for its festive glass ornaments hand-crafted by local artisans.

post_name: ISIS, Facing Losses, Releases Recording Said to Be of Leader
post_message: ISIS released an audio recording of a speech purportedly made by the organization’s leader, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, in which he implored more Muslims to fight on behalf of his increasingly besieged group.
post_description: In a recorded speech, whose authenticity could not be confirmed, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi implored more Muslims to fight on behalf of his group.

post_name: Chilaquiles to Welcome the New Year
post_message: A strong candidate for your first breakfast of 2016.
post_description: Adding eggs to the comforting Mexican dish of fried tortillas and salsa makes a perfect breakfast for Jan. 1.

post_name: Virginia Lawmaker Faces Wrath of Donald Trump Supporters
post_message: He called Trump a moron on Twitter. Since then, he has received more than 5,000 hateful tweets and a flood of threatening emails.
post_description: A Republican state lawmaker from Virginia who stood up to Donald J. Trump is feeling the wrath of his angry supporters, who have accused him of being a Muslim terrorist.

post_name: Donald Trump’s Remarks on Muslims Are Cited in Terrorism Case
post_message: "His statements have become a rallying cry inciting public fear of Muslims and the desire to ostracize and marginalize followers of Islam."
post_description: A lawyer for Minh Quang Pham, a practicing Muslim from Britain who is facing terrorism charges in New York, said in a court filing that Mr. Trump’s call to ban Muslims could prevent seating an impartial jury.

post_name: U.S. Doesn’t Know How Many Foreign Visitors Overstay Visas
post_message: Nearly 20 years ago, Congress passed a law requiring a system to track people who overstayed their visas. The U.S. still can't give more than a rough estimate.
post_description: The issue has taken on added urgency as part of a broader examination of immigration policy following the mass shootings in San Bernardino, Calif.

post_name: Xinjiang Seethes Under Chinese Crackdown
post_message: The Chinese government has introduced unprecedented measures aimed at shaping the behavior and beliefs of China’s 10 million Uighurs, a Muslim minority in the country’s far west.
post_description: The Chinese government has introduced unprecedented measures aimed at shaping the behavior and beliefs of China’s 10 million Uighurs.

post_name: What if the Oregon Protesters Were Black or Muslim? Debate Ensues
post_message: Some have speculated that the police would have used violent force to remove the protesters if they were Muslim or black.
post_description: An already intense social media debate about policing, race and terrorism finds a new focus after a federal refuge is taken over by armed white men.

post_name: New York to Appoint Monitor to Review Police’s Counterterrorism Activity
post_message: Breaking News: New York City will appoint a monitor to review police surveillance tactics, like those that targeted Muslim neighborhoods and mosques.
post_description: An agreement, coming as the city moves to settle lawsuits over surveillance targeting Muslims, would restore some of the outside oversight that was eliminated after the Sept. 11 attacks.

post_name: Donald Trump Says He’ll Pull Scotland Investment if Britain Bars Him
post_message: Donald J. Trump threatened to abandon plans to invest more than $1 billion in Scotland if Britain bars him from entering the country.
post_description: After his comments on Muslims, interest surged in a petition calling for Mr. Trump to not be allowed to enter the country on the basis of laws against hate speech.

post_name: Drug Kingpin ‘El Chapo’ Has Been Recaptured, Mexican President Says
post_message: Breaking News: Nearly 6 months after his escape from a maximum security prison in Mexico, the drug kingpin Joaquín Loera Guzmán, also known as El Chapo, has been arrested by Mexican authorities, according to the Twitter feed of the country’s president, Enrique Peña Nieto.
post_description: The drug kingpin Joaquín Loera Guzmán, also known as El Chapo, has been arrested by Mexican authorities, the country’s president announced on Twitter.

post_name: El Chapo, Escaped Mexican Drug Lord, Is Recaptured in Gun Battle
post_message: Will Mexico try to hold El Chapo for a third time — he has already escaped from prison twice — or will they hand him over to the Americans?
post_description: Joaquín Guzmán Loera, also known as El Chapo, was caught in the city of Los Mochis, a seaside area in his home state, Sinaloa.

post_name: Mexico May Extradite Drug Lord Known as El Chapo
post_message: Mexico's government is actively considering extraditing El Chapo to the U.S., a Mexican official said.
post_description: Mexican officials said the process to extradite Joaquín Guzmán Loera could take months, and his lawyers are expected to fight it.

post_name: Mexican Drug Lord’s Quest for Movie Fame Helped Lead to Capture, Official Says
post_message: El Chapo wanted a biopic. And that, in part, helped Mexico's government find him.
post_description: With a beauty queen wife and two Houdini-like escapes from prison under his belt, El Chapo wanted to make his own biopic.

post_name: ‘El Chapo,’ Mexican Drug Lord, Sat for Interview With Sean Penn during final days
post_message: Here's what they talked about.
post_description: Before he was captured, Joaquín Guzmán Loera met with the actor in his jungle hideout for seven hours in October and spoke about his his empire, Donald Trump and the movie business for Rolling Stone.

post_name: Sean Penn Sat for Secret Interview With ‘El Chapo,’ Mexican Drug Lord
post_message: They talked about Hollywood economics and Donald Trump. They communicated via 'burner' cell phones, BBM messenger and couriered videos.
post_description: Before he was captured, Joaquín Guzmán Loera met with the actor in his jungle hideout for seven hours in October and spoke about his his empire, Donald Trump and the movie business for Rolling Stone.

post_name: Cubans, Fearing Loss of Favored Status in U.S., Rush to Make an Arduous Journey
post_message: American law has long given Cubans special status to live in the U.S. and apply for a green card — provided they can make the treacherous journey.
post_description: Worried that an advantage in immigration law may end as the United States restores relations with their country, many Cubans have rushed off the island, only to be stalled in Central America.

post_name: Germany on the Brink
post_message: "The issue isn’t just that immigrants are arriving in the hundreds of thousands rather than the tens of thousands. It’s that a huge proportion of them are teenage and twentysomething men." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: How today’s migration could unsettle Europe for generations.

post_name: Kate del Castillo, Actress Tied to El Chapo, Set Up Sean Penn Meeting
post_message: After she addressed El Chapo on Twitter in 2012, urging him to use his wealth for good, he sent her flowers. The contact flourished after his 2014 capture. He wanted his story on film, and he chose her to produce it. Then Sean Penn stepped in.
post_description: Ms. del Castillo, a Mexican television star, is believed to have brokered the meeting between the drug lord, Joaquín Guzmán Loera, and Mr. Penn last year.

post_name: Purported Video of El Chapo Raid Shows Volley of Gunfire
post_message: A shaky, 30-second video reportedly shows military personnel firing dozens of shots into El Chapo's hide-out.
post_description: CNN broadcast a shaky, 30-second video that shows Mexican military personnel firing dozens of shots into what was identified as Joaquín Guzmán Loera’s hideout in Los Mochis.

post_name: A Climate of Fear Widens Divisions in Europe’s Migrant Crisis
post_message: Right-wing extremists and anti-immigration groups have seized on the assaults in Cologne, Germany, to discredit all migrants as criminals or hooligans.
post_description: The refugee crisis is provoking new levels of public anxiety in Europe after the New Year’s Eve sexual assaults in Germany.

post_name: El Chapo Enticed by Star Power of Mexican Actress, Not Sean Penn
post_message: El Chapo had never even heard of Sean Penn before Kate del Castillo contacted him.
post_description: Conversations between the drug lord Joaquín Guzmán Loera and the actress Kate del Castillo offer a window into the psyche of one of the world’s most wanted criminals.

post_name: Sexual Attacks Widen Divisions in European Migrant Crisis
post_message: Quote of the Day: "This has been the elephant in the room that no one is prepared to acknowledge: that the great fear is the fear of Islam."— Alexander Betts, director of refugee studies at University of Oxford, on the anxieties across Europe provoked by reports of attacks by asylum seekers in Germany.
post_description: Anti-immigration groups and right-wing extremists have seized on a wave of assaults in Cologne, Germany, on New Year’s Eve to discredit all migrants as criminals or hooligans.

post_name: Why Cartels Are Killing Mexico’s Mayors
post_message:
Hours after Gisela Mota had been sworn in as the first female mayor of the quiet Mexican town of Temixco, she was killed by hired assassins. 

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Forget drugs. Forget El Chapo. A new generation of gangsters is trying to take over local governments themselves.

post_name: The Manhunt for the Drug Kingpin El Chapo
post_message:
He had evaded multiple raids by the Mexican authorities, including a close brush after he sat for an interview with Sean Penn. 

Then his luck ran out.
post_description: Joaquín Guzmán Loera’s meeting with the movie star Sean Penn gave the authorities the break they needed to help recapture him.

post_name: Supreme Court to Hear Challenge to Obama Immigration Actions
post_message: Breaking News: The Supreme Court will review an order by President Obama that could shield illegal immigrants from deportation.
post_description: A coalition of 26 states has sued over the president’s efforts to provide work permits for millions of illegal immigrants, accusing him of abuse of power.

post_name: Denmark’s New Front in Debate Over Immigrants: Children’s Lunches
post_message: “It’s incomprehensible that pork has been made into a problem. It’s such a shame. As a Muslim, you get thick-skinned.”
post_description: Pork has become the latest weapon in a fight to preserve national identity after Randers, Denmark, voted to require day care centers and kindergartens to include it on menus.

post_name: Lawsuits Claim Disney Colluded to Replace U.S. Workers With Immigrants
post_message: They say Disney broke the law by using temporary visas to bring in immigrant workers, knowing Americans would lose their jobs.
post_description: The suits claim Disney and two consulting companies broke the law by using temporary visas to bring in foreign workers, knowing Americans would be displaced.

post_name: Study Finds Children of Immigrants Embracing ‘Frenchness’
post_message: The children of immigrants are doing their part to become French. The challenge for French society is to let them finish the job.
post_description: But the landmark study also found persistent discrimination against the so-called visible minorities in France, mainly those of African origin.

post_name: Not in the Republican Debate, Donald Trump Casts a Shadow
post_message: Donald J. Trump's absence left Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio trading ferocious attacks during the debate.
post_description: The final Republican presidential debate before the Iowa caucuses took a surreal turn Thursday night as seven candidates clashed over immigration, border security and government surveillance, yet found their messages overshadowed by Donald J. Trump’s boycott of the event.

post_name: U.S. Placed Immigrant Children With Traffickers, Report Says
post_message: The Department of Health and Human Services placed more than a dozen immigrant children in the custody of human traffickers after it failed to conduct background checks of caregivers, according to a Senate report.
post_description: The Department of Health and Human Services put more than a dozen minors in the care of human traffickers after inadequate background checks, a Senate inquiry found.

post_name: The Lives and Lies of a Professional Impostor
post_message: He had more than 27 aliases in 5 states. His birth certificate had been altered several times. He had been deported more than once as an illegal immigrant. Now he is at Rikers Island, awaiting trial.
post_description: “Jeremy Wilson,” now at Rikers Island facing fraud charges, has used dozens of aliases as a professor, a commando, numerous executives and an Irishman, among other cons.

post_name: Migrant Group’s Desperate March Through Mexico
post_message: We trek with 10 migrants as they push toward the U.S. despite Mexico's crackdown.
post_description: Two days with 10 men who left Central America in early November to embark on an exhausting journey, made riskier by the Mexican authorities’ crackdown on migrants.

post_name: Wheaton College and Professor to ‘Part Ways’ After Her Remarks on Muslims
post_message: She donned a hijab and said "I stand in religious solidarity with Muslims." The school, an evangelical Christian institution, responded by starting the termination process.
post_description: Larycia Hawkins had faced possible termination by the Christian college after she donned a hijab and said “I stand in religious solidarity with Muslims.”

post_name: New, Reading-Heavy SAT Has Students Worried
post_message:
The new SAT is: 
A) too wordy 
B) more fair 
C) none of the above
post_description: Some educators fear that the revised test — one of the biggest redesigns ever — will penalize certain students, like immigrants and the poor.

post_name: A Three-Ring Circus in Finland: Soldiers, ‘Loldiers’ and Asylum Seekers
post_message:
A leather-clad patrol called the Soldiers of Odin says it's trying to protect a city in Finland from people seeking asylum from Syria, Iraq and other places.

A troupe of clowns is mocking and sometimes confronting anti-immigrant groups, including the soldiers.
post_description: About 1,200 refugees so far have relocated to Finland’s third-largest city, prompting a rise in nationalists, and in champions of multiculturalism.

post_name: Tension Simmers as Cubans Breeze Across U.S. Border
post_message: “The people here are starting to feel resentment. They are asking, is it fair that the Cubans get to stay and the Central Americans are being deported?”
post_description: More Cubans are entering the country under a law passed in 1966, creating a disparity at the border, where Central Americans are detained and sent to immigration court.

post_name: The Sexual Misery of the Arab World
post_message:
"People in the West are discovering, with anxiety and fear, that sex in the Muslim world is sick, and that the disease is spreading to their own lands," writes Kamel Daoud.

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: We act as though sex doesn’t exist, and yet it determines everything that’s unspoken. Sex is everywhere. Especially after death.

post_name: Anxiety Rises in Mexico as the Peso Tumbles
post_message: The peso is worth less, and the global drop in oil prices is partially to blame.
post_description: The Mexican currency has fallen more than 30 percent against the dollar over the past year, and past collapses have led to deep recessions.

post_name: France’s Emergency Powers Spur Charges of Overreach From Muslims
post_message: Depending on who is telling the story, Daoud Muradyan, a blind 21-year-old, is either a potential terrorist or a harmless immigrant who embodies everything that is wrong with France’s broad new antiterrorism powers.
post_description: Critics of the state of emergency say the human cost of warrantless searches has been disproportionate to their efficacy.

post_name: Live Updates as Pope Francis Visits U.S.-Mexico Border
post_message: Pope Francis will step directly into the angry American political debate about immigration on as he visits Ciudad Juárez, Mexico, at the border with the United States. Follow our live blog for updates.
post_description: Pope Francis is making an important trip to the U.S.-Mexico border and jumping into the heated political debate over immigration.

post_name: Francis Wanted a Powerful Image, and He Got One
post_message: Pope Francis wanted to commemorate those who have died crossing the U.S. border and offer a reminder of the families who are separated.
post_description: Pope Francis is making an important trip to the U.S.-Mexico border and jumping into the heated political debate over immigration. This is a hugely symbolic moment, particularly given Donald J. Trump’s statements on building a border wall.

post_name: Who Are We?
post_message:
"America didn’t become the world's richest country by practicing socialism, or the strongest country by denigrating its governing institutions, or the most talent-filled country by stoking fear of immigrants." 

Read on from Thomas Friedman in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: The leading presidential candidates are missing the real America if they believe their attacks on the pillars of the nation’s strength.

post_name: Pope Francis Suggests Donald Trump Is ‘Not Christian’
post_message: Breaking News: Pope Francis suggested that Donald J. Trump "is not Christian" because of the harshness of his campaign promises to deport more immigrants and force Mexico to pay for a wall along the border.
post_description: The pope, inserting himself into the presidential race, pointed to the harshness of Mr. Trump’s campaign promises to deport more immigrants.

post_name: Donald Trump Calls Pope's Criticism 'Disgraceful'
post_message: "No leader, especially a religious leader, should have the right to question another man's religion or faith," Donald J. Trump said, going on to claim that Pope Francis was being used for political purposes by the Mexican government.
post_description: Donald J. Trump said it was “disgraceful” that Pope Francis questioned his faith and suggested that his presidency would be the answer to the Vatican’s prayers because he would protect it from terrorists if elected.

post_name: Facebook Post Revives Debate on Whether Monotheists Worship Same God
post_message: Do Jews, Christians and Muslims worship the same god? A Facebook post by Larycia Hawkins, a professor at Wheaton College, ignited a debate.
post_description: An uproar ensued over an image of a professor at an evangelical Christian school and a caption that said that Christians and Muslims worship the same deity.

post_name: My Friend, the Former Muslim Extremist
post_message:
As a young Pakistani, Nicholas Kristof writes, Rafi hated the U.S. and backed the Taliban. But he changed.

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Today Rafiullah Kakar is a voice against the Taliban, against conspiracy theories and against blind anti-Americanism.

post_name: Trump’s Remarks on Pigs’ Blood Elicit Challenge From Sister of Chapel Hill Victim
post_message: Donald J. Trump made his remarks about blood-dipped bullets at a rally on Friday in South Carolina, before winning the state’s Republican primary the next day.
post_description: Suzanne Barakat, the sister of a Muslim student killed last year, said Donald J. Trump’s words were “a moment when I just said, ‘enough is enough.’”

post_name: What Today’s Republicans Don’t Get About Reagan
post_message:
He supported the biggest amnesty bill in history for illegal immigrants, advocated gun control, used Keynesian stimulus to jump-start the economy, favored personal diplomacy even with the country’s sworn enemies and instituted tax increases in six of the eight years of his presidency.

He was Ronald Reagan.

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section
post_description: How did the party of Ronald Reagan turn into the party of Donald Trump and Ted Cruz?

post_name: Melania Trump Backs Husband's Views on Immigration and Muslims
post_message: “I don’t feel he insulted the Mexicans,” Melania Trump said about her husband, Donald J. Trump.
post_description: In an MSNBC interview, Melania Trump, a former model who was born in Slovenia, made clear that she agrees with some of her husband’s most contentious proposals, including stances on Mexican immigration and temporarily barring foreign Muslims from entering the United States.

post_name: Video: Fact Check: Texas Republican Debate
post_message: Did Donald J. Trump really use illegal immigrant labor? A fact check of last night’s GOP debate.
post_description: The New York Times checks assertions made from the Republican presidential candidates during Thursday’s debate in Houston.

post_name: Marco Rubio Pushed for Immigration Reform With Conservative Media
post_message: Over dinner 3 years ago, Marco Rubio appealed to News Corporation executives and Rush Limbaugh on behalf of legislation that would have provided a path to citizenship for 11 million immigrants.
post_description: Marco Rubio served as the chief envoy to conservative media on behalf of legislation that would have provided a path to citizenship for immigrants.

post_name: Demagogue for President
post_message: "This is a guy who began his presidential bid by branding Mexican immigrants as drug mules, criminals and rapists," Charles M. Blow writes on Donald J. Trump's candidacy in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: A nativist, sexist, arguably fascist and racist liar is the front-runner for the Republican Party’s presidential nomination.

post_name: In Mexico City, Comedians Punish Society’s Scofflaws With Humiliation
post_message: Bad behavior often goes unpunished in Mexico. These comedians want to change that.
post_description: Meet the Supercívicos, comedians who embarrass the bad actors of Mexican society with their humor and then put videos of the shaming on social media.

post_name: 10 Shots Across the Border
post_message: The 16-year-old was on one side of the border. The Border Patrol agent who shot him was on the other.
post_description: The killing of a Mexican 16-year-old raises troubling questions about the United States Border Patrol.

post_name: Look Out, Canada, Here They Come
post_message: “I used to say that George W. Bush was my best marketing ally," an immigration lawyer in Vancouver, David Aujla, said. "And I’m going to elevate Donald J. Trump to that position as soon as he becomes president.”
post_description: A surge in Twitter outbursts, Google searches and helpful how-to guides on how to emigrate North mark another U.S. election cycle.

post_name: In Mexico City, Comedians Punish Society’s Scofflaws With Humiliation
post_message: Quote of the Day: "If you experience that small trauma of being exposed and shamed, it is very unlikely you will break the same rule twice." — Alejandro Marín, a co-founder of Supercívicos, an activist group of comedians whose mission is to embarrass the wrongdoers of Mexican society with punishing humor.
post_description: Meet the Supercívicos, comedians who embarrass the bad actors of Mexican society with their humor and then put videos of the shaming on social media.

post_name: The Beast Is Us
post_message: If the pope couldn’t dent Donald J. Trump, Mitt Romney surely will not, Timothy Egan writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Trump’s supporters know what he stands for: hatred of immigrants, racial superiority, a sneering disregard of the basic civility that binds a society.

post_name: Marco Rubio’s Policies Might Shut the Door to People Like His Grandfather
post_message: Under the stricter screening Marco Rubio supports, his grandfather would most likely have been deported, depriving him of knowing the man he has called his mentor and closest boyhood friend.
post_description: In an interview, Mr. Rubio acknowledged that some would see a conflict between the stricter immigration and refugee policies he supports and his grandfather’s experience.

post_name: More Latinos Seek Citizenship to Vote Against Trump
post_message: “I want to vote so Donald Trump won’t win,” said Hortensia Villegas, a legal immigrant from Mexico. “He doesn’t like us.”
post_description: Mr. Trump’s harsh language against Mexicans immigrants has compelled legal residents to seek citizenship in time to vote against him in November.

post_name: Egyptian Aviation Student Who Made Trump Threat Is Leaving U.S.
post_message: Emadeldin Elsayed, 23, wrote a threatening comment on Facebook about Donald J. Trump that drew the attention of the Secret Service and led to the cancellation of his student visa.
post_description: Emadeldin Elsayed’s comments on Donald J. Trump’s idea to bar Muslims from the United States stirred debate about what is a threat or “mouthing off.”

post_name: Immigrant Crime Victims Seeking Special Visas Find a Tough Path
post_message: She wanted protection from an abusive ex-boyfriend. The police thought she was only after a visa.
post_description: The experiences of a Honduran immigrant who says she faced domestic violence reveal the difficulties in securing a special visa for crime victims that is championed by New York officials.

post_name: In the Democratic Debate, Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Clash On Immigration
post_message: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders clashed vividly over immigration reform and deportations.
post_description: Mrs. Clinton and Mr. Sanders attacked each other’s records and argued over who would better represent Hispanic voters’ interests.

post_name: Democratic Debate Takeaways: Tensions Rise as the Race Tightens
post_message: Hillary Clinton and U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders traded attacks over immigration, the government bailout of the auto industry and Donald J. Trump.
post_description: The Democrats saved their most raucous debate for what could be their last.

post_name: Who Won the Debate? Substance Over Theater
post_message: Many thought Donald J. Trump seemed to be running out the clock, while Marco Rubio delivered a sharp performance that probably came too late.
post_description: There was little sparring and only a few barbs as the Republican presidential candidates largely stuck to talk of trade, terrorism and immigration.

post_name: What Are Trump Fans Really ‘Afraid’ to Say?
post_message:
"A voter whose preferred immigration policy involves 'a wall' and 'a list' makes it clear where he stands on the humanity of refugees. A voter who thinks it’s perfectly reasonable not to immediately disavow the support of a white nationalist makes it clear where she stands on the Black Lives Matter movement. A voter who feels well represented by a candidate who has called women 'fat pigs' and 'dogs' makes it clear he is not to be trusted when it comes to women’s health."

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Glance at your worst relative’s Facebook page. No one really holds back.

post_name: French Student Who ‘Took Some Breaks’ Earns Doctorate at 90
post_message: "It took me a while because I took some breaks. ... I did the best that I could. I received much encouragement from my advisers, and I think the jury was satisfied. I am very moved."
post_description: Colette Bourlier became one of the oldest people in France to be awarded the degree, 30 years after she first began researching immigrant workers.

post_name: Merrick Garland’s Path to Nomination Marked by Deference, With Limits
post_message: For Merrick Garland, who spoke with tears in his eyes of his roots as a grandson of Jewish immigrants, a seat on the Supreme Court was a job he has dreamed of for years.
post_description: A series of carefully considered steps has positioned Judge Merrick B. Garland for a job his friends say he has dreamed of for decades: a seat on the United States Supreme Court.

post_name: 36 Hours in Mexico City
post_message: For a capital with such a long and layered history, there is much that’s new in Mexico City.
post_description: The Mexican capital is more cosmopolitan than ever, with world-class museums, vibrant street art, top-notch restaurants and bustling markets.

post_name: 36 Hours in Mexico City
post_message: Mexico City is primed to bewitch and baffle, challenge and enchant. Spend 36 Hours there.
post_description: The Mexican capital is more cosmopolitan than ever, with world-class museums, vibrant street art, top-notch restaurants and bustling markets.

post_name: Ted Cruz Faulted for Adviser With Anti-Islam Views
post_message: The adviser for Ted Cruz once wrote an op-ed in The Washington Times suggesting that President Obama is Muslim.
post_description: Senator Ted Cruz came under fire after unveiling a list of national security advisers that included Frank Gaffney Jr., a former member of the Reagan administration who is now best known for holding extreme views about Islam.

post_name: Warning of U.S. Attacks, Donald Trump Advocates Allowing Torture
post_message: Donald J. Trump reiterated his call for a moratorium on foreign Muslim immigrants entering the U.S. and advocated expanding international laws to allow forms of torture.
post_description: Donald J. Trump condemned the terrorist attacks in Belgium in television interviews, reiterating his call for a moratorium on foreign Muslim immigrants entering the United States, advocating expanding international laws to allow forms of torture and bluntly predicting, “This is going to happen in th…

post_name: Ted Cruz's Call to 'Secure' Muslim Neighborhoods Stirs a Backlash
post_message: "We need to empower law enforcement to patrol and secure Muslim neighborhoods before they become radicalized," Ted Cruz said in a statement.
post_description: Ted Cruz angered American Muslims with a call to “patrol and secure Muslim neighborhoods” in the wake of the terrorist attacks in Brussels.

post_name: Presidential Candidates Walking a Tightrope Over the Fight on Terrorism
post_message: Within hours of seeing images of the carnage in Belgium, Donald J. Trump renewed his calls for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S.
post_description: In the current atmosphere, a strike like the one on Tuesday in Brussels rekindles every debate about whether the United States should use diplomacy, isolation or military might.

post_name: Radovan Karadzic, a Bosnian Serb, Gets 40 Years Over Genocide and War Crimes
post_message: Breaking News: Radovan Karadzic was convicted of genocide for the slaughter of 8,000 Bosnian Muslims at Srebrenica.
post_description: The United Nations tribunal for the former Yugoslavia convicted Mr. Karadzic of genocide for the Srebrenica massacre but acquitted him of other charges.

post_name: Álvaro Enrigue: By the Book
post_message:
Álvaro Enrigue, the author of "Sudden Death," says he doesn't favor Mexican writers over others: "The notion of national literatures does not accurately reflect the reality of reading."

(via The New York Times Books)
post_description: The author, most recently, of “Sudden Death” says literature has its limits: “Life is larger than books. Any bully has more character-building effects on you than the most moving of books.”

post_name: Feeling G.O.P. Peril, Muslims Try to Get Out Vote
post_message: “If you’re not at the dinner table, you’re on the menu,” said Reema Ahmad, a community organizer in Chicago.
post_description: National advocacy groups are encouraging mosques to turn themselves into voter registration centers before the November election so that Muslims can make their voices heard at the polls.

post_name: The Sexual Politics of 2016
post_message: Donald J. Trump "effectively tells men: You may be struggling, but at least you’re better than women, Mexicans and Muslims." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Donald Trump has given misogyny a twist.

post_name: St. Louis Violence Is Traced to Cheap Mexican Heroin
post_message: "The gangs have to have a lot of customers because the heroin is so cheap. What we are seeing is these crews becoming more violent as they look to expand their turf."
post_description: In recent years, Mexican drug traffickers have inundated the St. Louis area with a new, potent form of heroin, drastically reducing prices to lure suburban users.

post_name: Immigrants for Donald Trump? Some in New York Show Their Support
post_message: “That’s why I like Donald Trump when he says, ‘Let’s build a wall.’ I believe anybody who came in this country illegally should be deported.”
post_description: Despite Mr. Trump’s inflammatory comments, some immigrants have come forward to praise, and even endorse, him as he seeks the Republican presidential nomination.

post_name: The Islamic State of Molenbeek
post_message: "A heavily Muslim district of Brussels had in effect seceded," Roger Cohen writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Europe must fight an ideological battle against Wahhabi Islam.

post_name: A ‘Big Science Guy’ Named Obama Hosts Young Innovators One Last Time
post_message: Last year, President Obama had invited Ahmed Mohamed, a Muslim high schooler from Texas who had been arrested after teachers mistook a clock he invented for a bomb: "Cool clock, Ahmed. Want to bring it to the White House?"
post_description: The president will host his final White House Science fair on Wednesday to emphasize the importance science, technology, engineering and math.

post_name: Poll of British Muslims Reveals Startling Views, but Some Question Methodology
post_message: Among the poll results were relatively high levels of disapproval for homosexuality, with 52% of respondents saying it should be illegal.
post_description: A new poll of British Muslims revealed attitudes on homosexuality and terrorism sharply out of step with broader public opinion.

post_name: At Refugee Camp in Greece, Pope Francis Urges Response to ‘Desperate Need’
post_message: Breaking News: Pope Francis is taking 12 Muslim refugees from Syria, including 6 children, back to Rome after visiting a detention center in Greece.
post_description: The pontiff visited Lesbos, the heart of Europe’s migrant crisis, asking for deeper sympathy at a moment when attitudes are hardening.

post_name: On Immigration, Law Is on Obama’s Side
post_message: "The nature of immigration enforcement and the resources (or lack thereof) appropriated by Congress necessitate exactly the type of choices that President Barack Obama has made." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: The president has operated under longstanding provisions of law that give the executive branch discretion in enforcement.

post_name: Supreme Court Weighs Obama’s Immigration Plan, With Much at Stake
post_message: Breaking News: The Supreme Court began arguments on Obama’s plan to shield immigrants with sharp questions.
post_description: A lawyer for the Obama administration faced sharp questions from several justices on the president’s plan to shield millions from deportation.

post_name: Latvia Wants to Ban Face Veils, for All 3 Women Who Wear Them
post_message: Only 3 women in Latvia are believed to wear the face veil. But for Latvia’s Ministry of Justice, that's 3 too many.
post_description: A proposal to ban the veils, or niqabs, from public spaces is one expression of broader fears about immigration and Muslims in this small, homogeneous country.

post_name: A Close Look at Brussels Offers a More Nuanced View of Radicalization
post_message: What accounts for the high number of Moroccan Belgians behind recent terror attacks?
post_description: A look at Molenbeek and other parts of Brussels suggests that immigrants from North Africa, particularly Morocco, are angrier and more alienated than the city’s Turks.

post_name: Drug-Smuggling Tunnel, Found in San Diego, Is Longest Yet
post_message: Rails, lights, ventilation. The only thing this Mexican smuggling tunnel lacked was El Chapo.
post_description: Federal officials say the tunnel began in Tijuana, Mexico, ran for half a mile, and had rails and ventilation. Cocaine and marijuana were seized.

post_name: What I Will Do When I Get My Papers
post_message: "If DAPA goes through, I could apply for a driver’s license and take my children to school like the parents of their classmates do." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: An immigrant waits on the Supreme Court, and hopes.

post_name: A Few Miles From San Bernardino, a Muslim Prom Queen Reigns
post_message: Zarifeh Shalabi was crowned prom queen after her non-Muslim friends campaigned for her by wearing hijabs in solidarity.
post_description: Zarifeh Shalabi received the ultimate symbol of teenage acceptance when her non-Muslim friends campaigned for her by wearing hijabs in solidarity.

post_name: Black in Algeria? Then You’d Better Be Muslim
post_message: Why do some black migrants in Algeria pretend to be Muslim? Because they know that charity is reserved for people of the same religion, Kamel Daoud writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: In the West, racists see skin color. In Algeria, they see religion.

post_name: gph.is
post_message:
They’re banned in France, mandated in Saudi Arabia and a fashion statement in Indonesia. Here’s your guide to Muslim veils.  
http://nyti.ms/1Tt5JqK

Illustration: Antonio de Luca
post_description: NA

post_name: ‘President Trump?’ Here’s How He Says It Would Look
post_message:
What Donald J. Trump says his first priorities as president would be:
- Design the wall with Mexico
- Enact the immigration ban on Muslims
- Move to repeal the Affordable Care Act
post_description: The presumptive Republican nominee has already been giving some thought to what he would do in his first hundred days in office.

post_name: British Elections Pose Test for Jeremy Corbyn, Labour Party Leader
post_message: Labour's Sadiq Khan could become London's first Muslim mayor. But outside London, the party might face more ominous results.
post_description: Mr. Corbyn faces continuing dissent from some of his own lawmakers. Poor results in Thursday’s elections could add to the pressure.

post_name: Sex Talk for Muslim Women
post_message:
"I am an Egyptian, Muslim woman who waited until she was 29 to have sex and has been making up for lost time. My upbringing and faith taught me that I should abstain until I married. I obeyed this until I could not find anyone I wanted to marry and grew impatient. I have come to regret that it took my younger self so long to rebel and experience something that gives me so much pleasure." 

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: I realized I had to speak frankly about my own sexual experience to free others to do so, too.

post_name: What’s That You’re Wearing? A Guide to Muslim Veils
post_message: Veils for Muslim women come in all sizes, shapes and colors — and with terminology that can mean different things in different places.
post_description: Veils for Muslim women come in all sizes, shapes and colors — and with terminology that can mean different things in different places.

post_name: Sadiq Khan Is Elected Mayor of London
post_message: Breaking News: London has elected its first Muslim mayor, Sadiq Khan, after a campaign dominated by issues of religion and ethnicity.
post_description: His victory is a ray of hope for the Labour Party, which lost ground in Scotland, and ends eight years of Conservative rule over Britain’s capital.

post_name: Aung San Suu Kyi Asks U.S. Not to Refer to ‘Rohingya’
post_message: Myanmar recognizes 135 ethnic groups within its borders. But No. 136? They are the people-who-must-not-be-named.
post_description: The leader of Myanmar’s first democratically elected government in decades advised the American ambassador against using the term to describe a persecuted group of Muslims.

post_name: A Confession of Liberal Intolerance
post_message: "We progressives believe in diversity, and we want women, blacks, Latinos, gays and Muslims at the table — er, so long as they aren’t conservatives," Nicholas Kristof writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: We’re big on diversity, but not when it comes to conservatives in academia. That’s wrong.

post_name: Muslim Leaders Are Waging a Fight Against Extremism, and ISIS Is Taking Note
post_message: "It's an honor to be denounced by ISIS," says Imam Suhaib Webb, who engages young Muslims on YouTube, Facebook and Snapchat. "I consider it one of my greatest accomplishments in life."
post_description: The militant group has threatened the lives of 11 imams and scholars in the West, in a fight carried out at mosques and Islamic conferences, and on social media.

post_name: Judge in Mexico Says El Chapo Can Be Extradited to U.S.
post_message: In the U.S., Mexico's most notorious drug lord would have far slimmer chances of escaping prison.
post_description: The ruling puts the drug kingpin Joaquín Guzmán Loera, who has escaped from Mexican prisons twice, one step closer to prison in the United States.

post_name: Donald Trump Says New London Mayor Could Be Exception to His Ban on Muslims
post_message: Donald J. Trump suggested that Sadiq Khan would be among the exceptions to his Muslim ban.
post_description: Mr. Trump said he was “happy” that London had elected its first Muslim mayor, Sadiq Khan, and suggested that he would be among the exceptions to his proposal to bar Muslims from entering the United States.

post_name: Sadiq Khan vs. Donald Trump
post_message: "The 21st century world is going to be shaped by booming cities that celebrate diversity, not by some bullying, brash, bigoted, 'America first' white dude who wants to build walls," Roger Cohen writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: The new mayor of London is a Muslim. Trump would bar him from the United States.

post_name: Fraud Charges Mar a Plan to Aid a Struggling Vermont Region
post_message: They promised the biggest economic development in Vermont history. Now, they've been accused of perpetrating the biggest fraud in Vermont history.
post_description: Two businessmen have been accused of perpetrating the biggest fraud in state history, throwing investors’ immigration status into doubt and leaving a hole in the ground.

post_name: Donald Trump Is ‘Ignorant About Islam,’ London’s Muslim Mayor Says
post_message: Donald J. Trump is “playing into the hands of extremists,” Sadiq Khan said.
post_description: The new mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, asserted that Mr. Trump was playing into the hands of extremists.

post_name: Sadiq Khan and the Future of Europe
post_message: "Londoners, in the words of their new mayor, chose 'hope over fear, and unity over division.' It's an example for the rest of Europe." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: London’s new Muslim mayor is a model for integration and acceptance. The Continent should pay attention.

post_name: In Paris Suburbs, Adopting a Dreaded School Test as a Tool of Integration
post_message: In teaching people “good French,” the dictation sessions are a first step toward integration into French society.
post_description: Every Saturday in the heavily immigrant suburbs of Paris, people of all ages and social backgrounds gather to do a dictation, a step toward learning “good French.”

post_name: The Vaquita, the World’s Smallest Porpoise, Slips Closer to Extinction
post_message: The Mexican government has deployed new fast boats, planes, helicopters and even drones to help protect the fish.
post_description: Scientists say only about 60 are left in the Gulf of California, threatened by nets that fishermen illegally use to catch totoaba, a source of a Chinese delicacy.

post_name: ‘Brexit’ Vote Worries European Up-and-Comers Lured to Britain
post_message: What will happen to European immigrants if Britain votes to leave the EU? No one knows for sure.
post_description: London has long been a popular destination for young workers from the Continent, but many are scrambling to find ways to stay if Britain votes to leave the European Union.

post_name: What Would It Take for Donald Trump to Deport 11 Million and Build a Wall?
post_message: Donald J. Trump's ambitious ideas on immigration do not always add up.
post_description: Mr. Trump’s proposal, which calls for deporting millions and building a wall along the southern border, is financially, scientifically and legally problematic, experts say.

post_name: Federal Judge in Texas Demands Justice Dept. Lawyers Take Ethics Class
post_message: A federal judge in Texas excoriated the Justice Department, demanding ethics classes for the department’s lawyers.
post_description: Judge Andrew S. Hanen accused the lawyers of lying to him during arguments in a case involving the president’s executive action over immigration.

post_name: ‘Brexit,’ a Feel-Good Vote That Could Sink Britain’s Economy
post_message: If Britain leaves, it could presage the disintegration of the European project.

post_name: If Trump Breaks Up the G.O.P., It Won’t Be a First
post_message:
It’s rare, but major parties have fallen apart before, with friction over immigrants a common culprit. 

(via The New York Times Opinion Section)
post_description: It’s rare, but major parties have fallen apart before, with friction over immigrants a common culprit.

post_name: How the Saudis Turned Kosovo Into Fertile Ground for ISIS
post_message:
Not long ago, Kosovo was among the most pro-American Muslim societies in the world.

Now it's a hot bed for ISIS recruiting.
post_description: Extremist clerics and secretive associations funded by Saudis and others have transformed a once-tolerant Muslim society into a font of extremism.

post_name: Mexican Officials Take Steps to Counter ‘the Trump Emergency’

post_name: Trump Taps Into the Anxiety of American White Males
post_message: 64% of Donald J. Trump supporters reported feeling “bothered when dealing with immigrants who speak little or no English,” a PRRI poll found.

post_name: Mexican Military’s High Kill Rate Raises Human Rights Fears
post_message: According to the government's own figures, Mexico's armed forces are exceptionally efficient killers.

post_name: North Dakota Mosque a Symbol of Muslims’ Deep Ties in America

post_description: In an election year when immigrants have been made a polarizing part of the discussion, obscure mosque is a reminder that Muslims have been part of America for a long time.

post_name: How One Berliner Battles Hate: With Conscience and a Sharp Scraper
post_message: Carrying a canvas bag with the handwritten message “Against Nazis,” she roams the city in search of banned Nazi symbols, anti-immigrant catchphrases and political stickers.
post_description: For 30 years, Irmela Mensah-Schramm has crisscrossed her city, and her country, in an effort to rid Germany of neo-Nazi posters, stickers and graffiti.

post_name: In Brussels, Art Museum Brings Hope to Muslim Neighborhood of Molenbeek
post_message: "With the negative image that Molenbeek has now, the museum demonstrates that people are doing good."
post_description: The Millennium Iconoclast Museum of Art has opened in a district where homegrown extremists have been linked to some of Europe’s deadliest terror attacks.

post_name: Unsettling Political Climate Galvanizes Muslims to Vote

post_name: That Judge Attacked by Donald Trump? He’s Faced a Lot Worse

post_name: Could a Muslim Judge Be Trump Neutral? Trump Thinks Not

post_name: The Right Way to Observe Ramadan
post_message: Muslims should be able to fast according to the dictates of their conscience. Unfortunately, some authoritarian governments violate this fundamental freedom. Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.

post_name: Ramadan Is Here. What Islam’s Holiest Month Is About.

post_name: Drug That Killed Prince Is Making Mexican Cartels Richer, U.S. Says

post_name: Dump-Trump Talk Returns, but Actually Doing It Won’t Be Easy

post_description: In countries like Slovakia and Hungary, vigilante groups are portraying a menacing incursion of asylum seekers to build support for their xenophobic agendas.

post_name: Orlando Attack Roils Gay Community, Painfully Accustomed to Violence

post_name: Blaming Muslims After Attack, Donald Trump Tosses Pluralism Aside
post_message: “It’s war. It’s absolute war," said Donald J. Trump on Fox News. And he appeared to suggest that President Barack Obama might be complicit in terrorist attacks: “We’re led by a man that either is not tough, not smart, or he’s got something else in mind.”
post_description: Mr. Trump appeared to broaden his proposed ban on Muslim immigrants, while Hillary Clinton accused him of damaging efforts to defeat terrorism.

post_name: The Muslim Silence on Gay Rights

post_name: In Orlando, a Son of a Muslim Immigrant Rushed to Heal Pain Caused by Another
post_message:
When Dr. Joseph Ibrahim, a trauma surgeon, heard that the Orlando attack may have been linked to terrorism, he caught himself fearing any kind of link to his own Muslim, Middle-Eastern roots.

Please, he thought, don’t let Ibrahim appear anywhere in the gunman’s name.
post_description: Even as he spent hours repairing gun shot wounds, Dr. Joseph Ibrahim could not escape the parallels between his background and the gunman’s.

post_name: Britain Asks if Tone of ‘Brexit’ Campaign Made Violence Inevitable
post_message: "When you present politics as a matter of life and death, as a question of national survival, don’t be surprised if someone takes you at your word."

post_name: In Wake of Orlando Shootings, Mexican Soccer Chant Offends Many

post_name: A Donald Trump Immigration Ban Could Sour U.S. Ties in Middle East
post_message:

That could affect American citizens traveling and living abroad.
post_description: Immigration experts agree that while the president has the power to order a ban, it would prompt retaliation against American citizens abroad.

post_name: I’m Ghanaian-American. Am I Black?
post_message:
"Black immigrant parents may tell their children to shrug off their encounters with racism, but what good does that do the child who must leave his house every day and be black in America?"

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Growing up the daughter of immigrants, I considered myself different from “black Americans.” I learned that I wasn’t.

post_name: Apple, Uneasy Over Donald Trump, Won’t Support Republican Convention

post_description: The company, the latest in a string of sponsors to drop out, was said to be uncomfortable with Mr. Trump’s comments on trade with China, data encryption, Muslims and immigrants.

post_name: Nationalism and the Brexit Vote

post_name: Cucumber-Watermelon Salad Recipe
post_message: Refreshing with a kick.

post_message: Today's Supreme Court defeat will force President Barack Obama to finish his term without securing the major progress he promised to millions of Latino immigrants living under the threat of deportation.

post_name: Low-Priority Immigrants Still Swept Up in Net of Deportation
post_message: Immigration authorities say their focus is on removing convicted criminals and foreigners who pose national security threats. But thousands of deportation operations per week are sweeping up immigrants with minor or no offenses.

post_name: As Migrants Face Abuse, Fear That ‘Brexit’ Has Given License to Xenophobia

post_name: Revolt of the Masses

post_name: ‘President Hillary Clinton?’ She Wants Progress on Immigration and to Drink With G.O.P.
post_message:
5 things Hillary Clinton's team told us she would do in her first 100 days in The White House:

-Appoint women in half her cabinet posts
-Revive immigration reform with a path to citizenship 
-Push a $275 billion infrastructure/jobs plan 
-Seek common ground with the GOP over drinks
-If Republicans block her, prepare executive actions on immigration, guns and corporate inversions
post_description: Advisers and allies say Mrs. Clinton would try to find common ground with Republicans on immigration and infrastructure spending, and appoint women to half of her cabinet posts.

post_name: With Ramadan Attacks, ISIS Perverts Central Concept of Holy Month

post_name: ISIS Seems to Tailor Attacks for Different Audiences

post_name: Turkish Leader Erdogan Making New Enemies and Frustrating Old Friends

post_name: Denmark’s Tougher Citizenship Test Stumps Even Its Natives

post_description: The government, which has been tightening rules on immigration, has made little effort to hide the goal of the exam: to make it significantly harder to become Danish.

post_message: His journey into government reads like a do-it-yourself guide to disrupting politics as usual. Just take a peek at his Twitter feed.

post_name: After Food Safety and Drug Scandals, Chipotle Seeks a Fresh Start

post_name: A Trail of Terror in Nice, Block by Block

post_name: Family of Slain Man in India May Be Charged With Cow Slaughter
post_message: A man in India was killed by a mob last year over rumors that he had slaughtered and eaten a cow. The dead man’s family could now face charges.

post_name: Newt Gingrich Echoes Donald Trump With Remarks on Muslims and Terrorism

post_name: Mike Pence on the Issues: Immigration, Foreign Policy, Guns, the Economy

post_name: Where Mike Pence and Donald Trump Align and Differ on Big Issues

post_name: Attack in France Fuels Anti-Immigrant Parties on Europe’s Right

post_name: Attack in Nice Turns Spotlight on City’s Religious Divisions
post_message: Muslims and non-Muslims in Nice have lived alongside each other in relative peace for generations. But that's all starting to change.

post_name: Attacker in Nice, France, Looked for Articles on Orlando and Dallas Attacks

post_name: A Third of Nice Truck Attack’s Dead Were Muslim, Group Says
post_message: “We hope that this sends a global message that the barbarity touches the whole world and that the people here, the victims, are not those who commit the crimes in Syria and Iraq," said a spokeswoman for the Union of Muslims of the Alpes-Maritimes.

post_name: Populism Without Racism

That makes it hard to know whether the populism or the racism has played a bigger role in Trump’s nomination victory." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.

post_name: Skyscrapers’ Rise in China Mark the Fall of Immigrant Enclaves
post_message: In a city — and country — eager to modernize and redevelop, the days are numbered for a teeming tenement neighborhood like this one.
post_description: Baishizhou, an urban village within surging Shenzhen, has been a source of cheap housing for immigrants for decades, but its days are numbered.

post_name: Who Was Behind the Coup Attempt in Turkey?
post_message: There are reasons to believe that Fethullah Gulen might have been behind the failed coup in Turkey, writes Mustafa Aykol. Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.

post_name: Another Word for ‘Illegal Alien’ at the Library of Congress: Contentious

post_name: Obama Rejects Donald Trump’s Vision of America

post_name: Donald Trump Suggests He’d Expand His Plans to Limit Immigration

post_name: Searching for 43 Missing Students Deep Inside the 'Real Mexico'

post_description: Months after 43 college students disappeared in Mexico in 2014, Emmanuel Guillén Lozano forsook his own graduation gift to spend time documenting the plight and protests of their parents.

post_name: Father of Fallen Muslim American Soldier Rouses Convention with Trump Rebuke
post_message: “Go look at the graves of brave patriots who died defending United States of America. You will see all faiths, genders and ethnicities,” Khizr Khan directed  Donald J. Trump.
post_description: Khizr Khan said: “Go look at the graves of brave patriots who died defending United States of America. You will see all faiths, genders and ethnicities. You have sacrificed nothing and no one.”

post_name: Donald Trump Suggests Khizr Khan’s Wife Wasn’t ‘Allowed’ to Speak
post_message: Donald J. Trump suggested that Ghazala Khan, the mother of a U.S soldier killed in Iraq, "wasn’t allowed to have anything to say."

post_message: Khizr Khan said Donald J. Trump was running a campaign "of hatred, of derision, of dividing us" after Trump suggested that his wife wasn't permitted to speak at the Democratic convention.

post_name: Winner in Trump Feud With Khan Family? The Constitution
