post_name: A Muslim Father, a Soldier's Ultimate Sacrifice
post_message: “I apologized to Khizr Khan, for having photographed him in prayer,” writes Eugene Richards, who took this photo in 2007. “And without breaking his gaze, without a hint of judgment, he said that it was alright.”
post_description: When Eugene Richards saw the emotional remarks of a Muslim immigrant whose son died in action in Iraq, he realized their paths had crossed during a moment of grief at Arlington National Cemetery.

post_name: Muslims and Christians in French Town Pray Old Bonds Survive Priest’s Murder
post_message: Muslim and Christian communities around France came together over last weekend to show solidarity by attending each other’s religious services, in churches and mosques alike.
post_description: Efforts to strengthen interfaith ties resonated particularly in St.-Étienne-du-Rouvray, where Father Jacques Hamel was killed.

post_name: Donald Trump’s Draft Deferments: Four for College, One for Bad Feet
post_message: Donald J. Trump, who criticized the parents of a slain Muslim soldier, received 5 deferments from the Vietnam draft, including 1 for bone spurs.
post_description: With Mr. Trump accused by a dead soldier’s father of having never “sacrificed,” his medical deferment during the Vietnam era is facing new scrutiny.

post_name: Muslims in the Military: The Few, the Proud, the Welcome
post_message: Donald J. Trump’s clash with a couple whose Army captain son was killed in Iraq has turned a spotlight on Muslims in the U.S. military.
post_description: Donald J. Trump’s clash with a Muslim couple whose Army captain son was killed in Iraq has turned a spotlight on Muslims in the United States military.

post_name: Donald Trump Steps Up Criticism of Khans and G.O.P. Leaders
post_message: Ignoring the pleas of his advisers, Donald J. Trump only dug in further against the parents of a slain Muslim American soldier.
post_description: The continuing attacks threaten to shatter Mr. Trump’s uneasy alliance with the Republican Party at the outset of the general election

post_name: Syrians Seeking Asylum in South Korea Find Only a Cold Shoulder
post_message: They're working in a country that doesn't really want them while longing for another that war has destroyed.
post_description: Wary of Muslim immigrants after attacks in Europe, South Korea lets 670 Syrians stay only on annual visas, limiting their ability to find jobs and barring them from benefits.

post_name: 2 Muslim American Women Ordered Off American Airlines Flight
post_message: One of the women said they were ordered off the plane because their remarks made a flight attendant uncomfortable. The airline disputed that account.
post_description: Niala Khalil said that she and a friend were told to leave the plane this week after it was on the tarmac for hours in Miami.

post_name: How Do Texans Beat the Heat? With Water From Mexico
post_message: Their solution to the heat: A Mexican sparkling water with an effervescence as aggressive as the summer heat is oppressive.
post_description: Bottles of fizzy Topo Chico are a favorite in restaurants, bars and stores, even though marketing is minimal.

post_name: Raising American Muslim Kids in the Age of Trump
post_message:
"Our children should not live in fear," one mother said.

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: How to teach them our faith — and not to be afraid.

post_name: Listening to the Voices from Hijabi World
post_message: Young Muslim women express what it’s like to come of age in America in a time of xenophobia.
post_description: On what is likely the most diverse college campus in the United States, Muslim women who wear a hijab talk about their lives.

post_name: Ahmed Mohamed, Boy Handcuffed for Making Clock, Is Suing
post_message: The lawsuit accuses the principal and school district of discrimination and the police of arresting Ahmed without probable cause.
post_description: The Muslim teenager from Dallas whose homemade clock was mistaken for a bomb, says that he received death threats and that his civil rights were violated.

post_name: Mormons’ Distaste for Donald Trump Puts Utah Up for Grabs
post_message: “The issue of religious liberty is an important one in the state, and the notion of a religious test for immigration raises deep concerns.”
post_description: With their own history of facing religious bias, Mormons in reliably Republican Utah are worried about whether to support a nominee who denigrates Muslims.

post_name: Sudden Rainfall Left Little Time to Flee Mudslides in Mexico
post_message: When torrential rains poured down, a family retreated to the safety of the second floor. Then came a deadly mudslide.
post_description: At least 44 people have died in landslides in the Mexican states of Puebla and Veracruz amid torrential rainstorms from Tropical Storm Earl.

post_name: Mike Pence Hints at Trump’s Muslim Ban Extending to Other Religions
post_message: Mike Pence suggested in an interview that Donald J. Trump's ban on Muslims from entering the country could be broadened to include other religions.
post_description: Mr. Pence, the Republican vice-presidential nominee, did not rule out barring other faiths, if the people were coming from nations or territories that support terrorism.

post_name: Olympians in Hijab and Bikini
post_message: This photo juxtaposes 2 women, 2 beliefs and 2 dress codes, brought together by sport, Roger Cohen writes in The New York Times Opinion Section
post_description: The West's image of Islam and the Muslim image of the West are often mutually incommunicable. No area is as sensitive as the treatment of women's roles, dress and sexuality.

post_name: Cannes, Citing Security Risks, Bans Full-Body ‘Burkinis’ From Its Beaches
post_message: “The burkini is the uniform of extremist Islamism, not of the Muslim religion," the mayor said.
post_description: A temporary decree in the French city prohibits people in attire that is not “respectful of good morals and secularism” from swimming in public areas.

post_name: Bilingual Invitation to Arizona Mayor Draws an Angry Reply, in English
post_message: "I will NOT attend a function that is sent to me in Spanish/Mexican," Mayor Ken Taylor of Huachuca City, Arizona, wrote about an invitation to a border mayors meeting.
post_description: The response by Ken Taylor of Huachuca City, Ariz., to the U.S.-Mexico Border Mayors Association reflects a longstanding battle over the use of Spanish in the United States.

post_name: The Banana Man of Lower Manhattan
post_message: He delights in bringing cheer — and potassium — to the streets of New York City.
post_description: Abdulhamed Kharma, a Syrian immigrant who is a sidewalk fruit vendor in Lower Manhattan, has inspired popular online videos with his outsize personality.

post_name: Donald Trump’s Terrorism Plan Mixes Cold War Concepts and Limits on Immigrants
post_message: Donald J. Trump's plan calls for immigrants to answer a questionnaire about their commitment to "basic principles of tolerance," a policy adviser said.
post_description: Mr. Trump will call for significant changes in how the U.S. defines its allies, urge an end to “nation building” and move toward foreign policy “realism.”

post_name: Evictions by Armed Men Rattle a Mexican Tourist Paradise
post_message: Men with sticks and machetes seize hotels in Tulum, Mexico's laid-back tourist town, under a judge's orders.
post_description: Aggressive property seizures, apparently legal but surrounded by questions, have shaken the beach town of Tulum and stained its image.

post_name: Portraying Muslims as a Threat to Women, Donald Trump Echoes ‘Us vs. Them’ Refrain
post_message: Donald J. Trump has adopted a tactic that has long been a mainstay of strongmen and sectarian provocateurs: portraying outsiders as a threat to women’s safety.
post_description: Mr. Trump, knowingly or not, joined a long line of people who have justified harsh policies against a group by portraying its members, often in sexualized terms, as perilous to women.

post_name: Fighting for the ‘Soul of France,’ More Towns Ban a Bathing Suit: The Burkini
post_message: It's challenging to spot a burkini on most French beaches, so why are towns banning them?
post_description: The full-body bathing suit has become a flash point in a nation at odds with its Muslim population in the face of a series of terrorist attacks.

post_name: France’s ‘Burkini’ Bans Are About More Than Religion or Clothing
post_message: This, of course, is not really about swimwear.
post_description: The bans on full-body swimsuits are not primarily about protecting Muslim women from patriarchy, but about shielding France’s non-Muslims from a changing world.

post_name: ‘This Only Confirms the Image of the U.S.A.’
post_message:
"When I see rich Americans destroying our property and then lying about it to make us look worse, this only confirms the image of the U.S.A. as an arrogant rich country."
— Jose, in Rio de Janeiro, reacting to the Ryan Lochte case
post_description: Our top 10 comments: Readers debate the burkini, the Ryan Lochte episode, and conditions in immigrant detention centers.

post_name: Donald Trump, Shifting Immigration Tone, Stresses a ‘Fair’ Approach
post_message: “We want to come up with a really fair, but firm, answer,” Donald J. Trump said. “It has to be firm. But we want to come up with something fair.”
post_description: The comments from Mr. Trump follow months of vows to build a wall on the U.S.-Mexico border and deport immigrants who have entered the country illegally.

post_name: Fake ISIS Attack in Prague, Intended as Protest, Causes Panic
post_message: Sporting detachable beards, wielding fake submachine-style BB guns and waving an Islamic State flag, they shouted “Allahu akbar” and fired guns without pellets.
post_description: A stunt by an anti-immigration activist sent tourists running for cover, knocking over chairs at restaurants.

post_name: French ‘Burkini’ Bans Provoke Backlash as Armed Police Confront Beachgoers
post_message:
Police surrounded Muslim women on beaches and ordered them to remove their modest clothes or leave. 

Calls came from onlookers to “go back to where you came from.”
post_description: Some politicians began backpedaling as an outcry grew on social media over the apparent public humiliation and ostracism of Muslim women dressed in modest attire.

post_name: Anne Frank Today Is a Syrian Girl
post_message: History rhymes, writes Nicholas Kristof in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Indifference and paranoia are shaping America’s immigration policy, as they did during World War II.

post_name: ‘Burkini’ Inventor Says Sales Have Skyrocketed on Heels of Controversy
post_message: "The burkini swimsuit is freedom and happiness and lifestyle changes — you can’t take that away from a Muslim, or any other woman, that chooses to wear it."
post_description: Aheda Zanetti, who created the full-body swimsuit, said her invention was about “freedom and happiness.”

post_name: Donald Trump, Wavering on Immigration, Finds Anger in All Corners
post_message: Ann Coulter, the conservative author, seemed almost apoplectic about Donald J. Trump's near shift on immigration.
post_description: After Mr. Trump indicated he might retreat from his vow to deport all immigrants in the United States illegally, disgust poured in from all sides, if for different reasons.

post_name: Summer Corn at its Tangiest, Spiciest, Messiest Best
post_message: If you’re the kind of person who shudders at the notion of adding anything beyond a slick of butter to your boiled ears, you should probably stop reading right now.
post_description: This riff on elote, the Mexican street snack, makes for excellent barbecue fare.

post_name: The Dumbed Down Democracy
post_message: "If Donald J. Trump supporters knew that illegal immigration peaked in 2007, or that violent crime has been on a steady downward spiral nationwide for more than 20 years, they would scoff when Trump says Mexican rapists are surging across the border and crime is out of control," Timothy Egan writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: A big chunk of the citizenry will vote despite being unable to accept basic facts needed to process this American life.

post_name: Donald Trump Tries to Clarify Immigration Plan, but Avoids Key Issue
post_message: Donald J. Trump declined to clarify whether he would forcibly deport  undocumented immigrants who have been in the country and not committed a crime.
post_description: Mr. Trump said he would remove illegal immigrants who committed crimes, but he sidestepped what to do about the millions of others in the country.

post_name: Juan Gabriel, Mexican Music Icon, Dies at 66
post_message: Juan Gabriel was nominated for 6 Grammy Awards and received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. In 1996, he was inducted into the Billboard Latin Music Hall of Fame.
post_description: He was nominated for six Grammys and received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

post_name: Fans Mourn Juan Gabriel, Mexican Singer
post_message:
A populist at heart, Juan Gabriel's songs were broadly relatable, focusing on the everyday dramas of life and love.

Do you have a favorite memory of listening to Juan Gabriel's music or seeing him perform? Please share your memories and stories in the comments. And please include your age and where you live.
post_description: People in Mexico City honored the singer and songwriter on Sunday night after news of his death at 66.

post_name: Muslim Holy Day on Sept. 11? Coincidence Stirs Fears
post_message: One of Islam’s most important holidays could fall on the 15th anniversary of 9/11. Some Muslims say they’re worried.
post_description: Religious leaders are concerned about how to celebrate one of Islam’s most important holidays, Eid al-Adha, if it falls this year on the 15th anniversary of the terrorist attacks.

post_name: Muslims Seek New Burial Ground, and a Small Town Balks
post_message: “I’ve been here since 1983,” said Dr. Bahnassi, 56, a Syrian immigrant and an American citizen. “I don’t deserve to die here?”
post_description: A proposal for a Muslim cemetery in Dudley, Mass., has drawn opposition, prompting charges of bigotry.

post_name: Israel Joins Bikini Fray, Ordering Concert Singer to Cover Up
post_message: The flap over skimpy swimwear in Israel turned Europe’s burkini debate on its head.
post_description: In a twist on the French debate over the full-body burkini worn by some Muslim women, Israel is insisting on modest dress by performers at government-sponsored events.

post_name: White Lives Matter Has Been Declared a Hate Group
post_message: "They're against integration, immigration. This is standard white supremacist stuff," said Heidi Beirich at the Southern Poverty Law Center.
post_description: Researchers with the law center said White Lives Matter had been promoted by the Aryan Renaissance Society, a group in Texas that is a member of the United Aryan Front, a white nationalist coalition.

post_name: Donald Trump to Visit Mexico After More Than a Year of Mocking It
post_message: Donald J. Trump's Mexico trip is his latest gamble.

post_name: Mexicans Accuse President of ‘Historic Error’ in Welcoming Donald Trump
post_message: Mexico isn't exactly welcoming Donald J. Trump with open arms.
post_description: Many Mexican citizens are angry that President Enrique Peña Nieto would meet with Mr. Trump, let alone extend him an invitation.

post_name: Never the Noodles Shall Meet: A Chinese Treaty Is Tested
post_message: The treaty prohibits a Muslim ethnic minority from opening halal noodle shops within 400 meters of each other.
post_description: Halal food is big business in China. But to the Hui, a Muslim ethnic minority, a social pact may come before profit in the placement of halal noodle shops.

post_name: Live: Donald Trump Calls Mexican President ‘a Friend’
post_message: Donald J. Trump called Mexico’s president “a friend” after their meeting.
post_description: Mr. Trump said he focused on the two nations’ shared economic and security interests, and discussed his plan to build a border wall but not who would pay for it.

post_name: Donald Trump and Mexican Leader Clash in Accounts of Meeting
post_message: Donald J. Trump's efforts at diplomacy with Mexico’s leader, Enrique Peña Nieto, quickly backfired.
post_description: The Republican nominee said they did not discuss financing for a border wall, but his host said later that he made it clear that Mexico would not pay.

post_name: A Look at Trump’s Immigration Plan, Then and Now
post_message: Here’s a look at how Donald J. Trump’s positions on immigration have changed throughout the campaign.
post_description: Here’s a look at how the Republican candidate’s positions on immigration have changed, or remained the same, throughout the campaign.

post_name: Transcript of Donald Trump’s Immigration Speech
post_message: "We have to listen to the concerns that working people, our forgotten working people, have over the record pace of immigration and it’s impact on their jobs, wages, housing, schools, tax bills and general living conditions," Donald J. Trump said during an immigration speech.
post_description: Following is a transcript of the remarks by Donald J. Trump on immigration in Phoenix on Wednesday, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

post_name: As Donald Trump Calls for Wall on Mexican Border, Smugglers Dig Tunnels
post_message: Dozens of tunnels snake around Nogales, Arizona, part of a vast underground network that Mexican drug cartels have used for years to funnel illicit drugs into the U.S.
post_description: Fences along the frontier have only helped push smugglers underground, and experts say it may be years before the technology exists to reliably detect the tunnels.

post_name: ‘He Used Us as Props’: Conservative Hispanics Deplore Donald Trump’s Speech
post_message: “There was so much hope,” said Jacob Monty, a member of Donald J. Trump's Hispanic advisory council. “He used us as props.”
post_description: Some of Mr. Trump’s top Hispanic Republican supporters denounced his reversal after signaling a more conciliatory approach to illegal immigrants less than two weeks ago.

post_name: Muslim Women on Life in Europe
post_message: "How is it possible that in a 'modern' world, tanning naked is accepted but keeping your clothes on at the beach is not?"
post_description: An outpouring from Times readers described their daily experiences in parts of Europe that are most tense because of recent terror attacks.

post_name: Tensions Deepen Between Donald Trump and R.N.C.
post_message: There is no prospect of a full public breach between the Trump campaign and the R.N.C., but the strain is increasing.
post_description: The fiery tone of Mr. Trump’s speech on immigration tore a painful new wound in his relationship with the Republican National Committee.

post_name: Donald Trump Meets With Black Leaders Ahead of Detroit Church Visit
post_message: Donald J. Trump's day in Philadelphia included an emotional meeting with the mother of a young woman who was killed by undocumented immigrants.
post_description: Mr. Trump met business and community leaders and had an emotional meeting with the mother of a young woman who was killed by undocumented immigrants.

post_name: Israeli Police Recruiting Arabs to Join the Force, Not Resist It
post_message: Arab Muslims are currently 1.5% of Israel's police force. Israel wants to change that.
post_description: An initiative to increase diversity in the national force is seen as an effort to ease deep-rooted tension between officers and Arab citizens.

post_name: Egypt’s Christians Say They Are at a ‘Breaking Point’
post_message: "If they don't have a church in their village, why can’t they go to another village and pray?" a Muslim cleric asked.
post_description: While Imam Mahmoud Gomaa, appointed to keep the peace between two faiths, blames journalists for exaggerating the problem, a local bishop says, “We are at a breaking point.”

post_name: Migrant Wave Unleashes Danish Tensions Over Identity
post_message: "I've become a racist," a retired bank employee said after more than 36,000 asylum seekers poured into Denmark over the past 2 years.
post_description: The thousands of Muslim asylum seekers pouring into Denmark have spawned a backlash, and questions over whether the country has a latent racial hostility at its core.

post_name: Iran and Saudi Arabia Squabble as Millions of Muslims Begin Pilgrimage
post_message: Saudi Arabia and Iran have escalated their rivalry over which country represents the true Islam.
post_description: The two nations traded barbs over which one best represents Islam and which one ought to control the religious sites at Mecca and Medina in Saudi Arabia.

post_name: Mexico’s Finance Minister Resigns After Trump Visit
post_message: Donald J. Trump's meeting with Enrique Peña Nieto was reportedly his idea, according to several Mexican news reports.
post_description: The minister, Luis Videgaray, is said to have come up with the idea of inviting Donald J. Trump to meet with President Enrique Peña Nieto.

post_name: Britain and France to Begin Work on Wall Near Calais to Keep Migrants From Channel Tunnel
post_message: “We've done the fence, now we are doing the wall," the British immigration minister said.
post_description: Awaiting chances to reach Britain, thousands have converged on a sprawling, informal camp near the French port city that serves as a gateway to Britain via the Channel Tunnel.

post_name: 20 Marines Face Discipline After Investigation of Muslim Recruit’s Death
post_message: A 20-year old Muslim recruit died at a U.S. Marine Corps training facility in March. Now the Marine Corps says he committed suicide amid hazing and abuse at the camp.
post_description: The Marine Corps said trainers faced possible legal or administrative action over recurrent abuse at the camp in South Carolina where the recruit committed suicide.

post_name: From the Mundane to the Sacred: Lost Luggage and Spiritual Unity
post_message: "She kissed me on the cheek and said that was the way a Muslim should behave, and that I was her sister."
post_description: When Diaa Hadid, a Times correspondent, arrived in Mecca without her suitcase, she found kindness in a fellow hajj pilgrim who shared a prayer mat.

post_name: How to Celebrate Eid al-Adha Like an American
post_message: If Muslims sacrifice religious freedoms at the altar of making people feel comfortable and safe, we’ll have a hollow corpse of the American dream, Wajahat Ali writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Thanks to the moon, and the Saudis, it’s not on 9/11.

post_name: A New Gathering Spot at Arlington: Capt. Humayun Khan’s Grave
post_message: Captain Khan's grave is visited so often that tour guides have memorized the grave number so they can give directions.
post_description: The grave of the Muslim soldier whose parents denounced Donald J. Trump has drawn thousands of visitors since late July, emerging as a kind of organic meeting point.

post_name: Donald Trump’s Rough Rider
post_message:
Meet the rodeo star who advises Donald J. Trump on agriculture.  One of his Facebook posts suggested we make peace with the Muslim world as we did with Japan — by using the atomic bomb.

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: The rodeo star who advises the Republican nominee on agriculture.

post_name: Answers About the Hajj: What’s in the Kaaba and Where to Find Bathrooms
post_message:
What questions do you have about the hajj? Our correspondent Diaa Hadid grew up in an observant Muslim family in Australia, but stopped wearing a head scarf in college. Now, at 38, she leads a largely secular life. As a reporter, she came on her first hajj — the 5-day pilgrimage that is required of every Muslim — with many questions. 

She wants to hear your questions as well. Please include your age and town in the comments below. We may feature your question in "Postcards from the Hajj."
post_description: Diaa Hadid, a Times correspondent making the Muslim pilgrimage to Mecca, answers questions from readers.

post_name: Muslim Teenager Proposes Emoji of Woman Wearing a Head Scarf
post_message: A teenager in Berlin seeks to make emoji choices more inclusive of Muslim women.
post_description: A 15-year-old high school student in Berlin is proposing an emoji with a head scarf, or hijab, to represent the millions of Muslim women who wear one.

post_name: Throwing Stones and Slaughtering Sheep at the Hajj
post_message: "Usually, the post office is where you send mail or pay your bills. In Saudi Arabia during the hajj, it’s where you pay for your animal sacrifice."
post_description: Diaa Hadid, a Times correspondent making the Muslim pilgrimage to Mecca, picked up tips on how to practice some of the rites and rituals of the hajj.

post_name: 20 Marines at Parris Island May Be Punished in Hazing Inquiry
post_message: In one incident, a drill instructor ordered a Muslim recruit into a running clothes dryer where he was burned on his arm and neck.
post_description: An investigation into the death of a Muslim recruit and instances of abuse calls into question how far to go in fostering the Jarhead culture of toughness.

post_name: Muslim Teenager Proposes Emoji of Woman Wearing a Head Scarf
post_message: "I would like to be represented and acknowledged," she said.
post_description: A 15-year-old high school student in Berlin is proposing an emoji with a head scarf, or hijab, to represent the millions of Muslim women who wear one.

post_name: England’s Forgotten Muslim History
post_message:
"Islam, in all its manifestations — imperial, military and commercial — played an important part in the story of England." 

Read more from The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Isolated from Europe, Elizabeth I turned to the Islamic world.

post_name: Turkey’s Islamic Fashion Revolution
post_message: "There are a lot of us Muslim girls who wear the hijab, and we like fashion."
post_description: As Europe grapples with the burkini, Islamic dress in Turkey has become a symbol of religious freedom, and the nation has fostered fashion houses, magazines and bloggers.

post_name: Berlin Voters Deal Angela Merkel’s Party Another Blow
post_message: The anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany party is now poised to enter the city-state's legislature for the first time.
post_description: Ms. Merkel’s Christian Democratic Union won about 18 percent of the vote in a state election, not enough to allow it to remain the junior partner in a coalition with the Social Democrats.

post_name: After Bombings, Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Clash Over Terrorism
post_message: Hillary Clinton accused Donald J. Trump of imperiling U.S. national security with his campaign rhetoric, as he called for police profiling of people from the Muslim world.
post_description: Mrs. Clinton stressed her national security credentials and measured her words, and Mr. Trump sounded a note of furious alarm about Saturday’s attacks in New York and New Jersey.

post_name: Our Immigrants, Our Strength
post_message: Newcomers make New York, Paris and London healthier and more vibrant, Mayor Bill de Blasio, Anne Hidalgo and Sadiq Khan write in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: "It is wrong to characterize immigrant and refugee communities as radical and dangerous; in our experience, militant violence is vanishingly rare."

post_name: Immigrants Aren’t Taking Americans’ Jobs, New Study Finds
post_message: But there are some caveats.
post_description: Researchers found that, over the long term, immigration had no negative effects on the wages and jobs of native-born workers.

post_name: ‘In-Betweeners’ Are Part of a Rich Recruiting Pool for Jihadists
post_message: The accused perpetrators fit the same rough pattern: They're the young sons of immigrant families, who felt lost or rejected, and angry about American-led wars. And that made them vulnerable to groups like ISIS or Al Qaeda, experts say.
post_description: Terrorism experts say Islamist groups target the particular anxieties of Western Muslims from immigrant backgrounds — young adults whose identities have not yet solidified.

post_name: Haitians, After a Perilous Journey, Find Door to U.S. Abruptly Shut
post_message: Hundreds of Haitians are caught at the border as the U.S. stiffens its immigration policy.
post_description: After a trek through Latin America many migrants thought they were just days from entering the United States, but a shift in American policy has left them stranded.

post_name: Two Years After a Night of Horror, Mexican Students Seek Answers
post_message: "We still don't understand: Why did this happen to us? How is our government capable of shooting its own citizens?"
post_description: The families of 43 kidnapped college students continue to lobby the government for justice — accompanied by students who lived through the 2014 attack.

post_name: Prediction Markets Score the Debate a Rout: Clinton Over Trump
post_message: The value of the dollar relative to the Mexican peso fell sharply during the debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump.
post_description: Hillary Clinton’s odds of winning the election rose from around 63 percent in the minutes before the debate started to 69 percent by the end.

post_name: Thousands Eager to Vote Won’t Become Citizens in Time
post_message: "I've been checking my mail every day, but I haven't heard anything," said a Mexican immigrant. "I'm starting to get very worried."
post_description: Nearly a million legal immigrants applied for citizenship in the last year, causing an agency’s backlog to swell. Many will still be in the backlog on Nov. 8.

post_name: In Deposition, Donald Trump Says Illegal Immigration Led to Nomination
post_message: “All I’m doing is bringing up a situation which is very real, about illegal immigration,” Donald J. Trump said. “And I think, you know, most people think I’m right.”
post_description: Mr. Trump made the comments while being questioned as part of his lawsuit against the celebrity chef Geoffrey Zakarian for backing out of a restaurant in Washington.

post_name: Supreme Court Faces Volatile, Even if Not Blockbuster, Docket
post_message: A short-handed Supreme Court returns to the bench this week and will face timely cases on race, religion and immigration.
post_description: Short-handed since Justice Antonin Scalia died in February, justices say they are determined to avoid deadlocks. That will require resolve and creativity.

post_name: Anti-Semitism at My University, Hidden in Plain Sight
post_message:
"They don’t acknowledge the swastikas that I see carved into bathroom stalls, scrawled across walls or left on chalkboards. They don’t hear students accusing me of killing Jesus."

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Students protest hate crimes against Muslim Americans and bias against black people in politics, but they dismiss attacks on Jews.

post_name: ‘That Mexican Thing’ Takes On a Post-Debate Life
post_message:
At the vice-presidential debate, Gov. Mike Pence told Senator Tim Kaine, "You’ve whipped out that Mexican thing again."

Then the phrase took on a life of its own online.
post_description: ‘You’ve whipped out that Mexican thing again,” Gov. Mike Pence told Senator Tim Kaine, launching a new phrase into the online conversation.

post_name: Mike Pence Disavows Donald Trump’s Earlier Proposal Banning Muslims
post_message: Mike Pence said Donald J. Trump no longer wants to impose a temporary ban on Muslim immigration to the U.S.
post_description: Asked on CNN about why he will not condemn the Muslim ban now, Mr. Pence said, “Because that’s not Donald Trump’s position now.”

post_name: From ‘Locker Room Talk’ to ‘Muslims Report Stuff,’ the Internet Strikes Back
post_message: Women sharing stories of sexual assault, athletes disputing "locker room talk" and Muslims reporting stuff. How Twitter has responded to Donald J. Trump's latest comments.
post_description: Twitter has become the forum for three notable threads fueling public blowback to the presidential debate.

post_name: Case Accusing Bush Officials of 9/11 Abuses Heads to Supreme Court
post_message: The case began as a class action filed by immigrants, most of them Muslim, over policies that swept hundreds of people into detention.
post_description: The justices agreed to decide whether officials including a former attorney general and a former F.B.I. director may be held liable for policies that swept hundreds into detention.

post_name: The Professor Wore a Hijab in Solidarity — Then Lost Her Job
post_message: When Larycia Hawkins, the first black woman to receive tenure at Wheaton College, made a symbolic gesture of support for Muslims, the evangelical college became divided over what intellectual freedom on its campus really meant.
post_description: When Larycia Hawkins, the first black woman to receive tenure at Wheaton College, made a symbolic gesture of support for Muslims, the evangelical college became divided over what intellectual freedom on its campus really meant.

post_name: In City Built by Immigrants, Immigration Is the Defining Political Issue
post_message: “No one talks about white Americans and what we really need,” said a woman who blames her low wages on immigrant labor.
post_description: Many residents of Hazleton, Pa., who are losing ground, including Democrats, back Mr. Trump. Many who are prospering, including Republicans, support Clinton.

post_name: 3 Held in Bomb Plot Against Somalis in Kansas
post_message: Three men were arrested for plotting to bomb a community of Somali immigrants the day after the U.S. elections, investigators said.
post_description: The men scouted out an apartment complex in Garden City, Kan., stockpiled guns and composed a manifesto about their anti-Muslim motives, prosecutors said.

post_name: An Agent Shot a Boy Across the U.S. Border. Can His Parents Sue?
post_message: The boy was shot in the head from about 60 feet away.
post_description: The Supreme Court will decide whether the Constitution covers a teenager who was on the Mexican side of the line when an American guard killed him.

post_name: How 2 American Teenagers Became Assassins
post_message: One teen "dreamed of something glorious to fill the blah of life." He and a fellow Texan were then recruited by a Mexican drug cartel.
post_description: Dan Slater’s “Wolf Boys” is about how American teenagers trained by a Mexican drug cartel murdered on both sides of the border.

post_name: Californians, Having Curbed Bilingual Education, May Now Expand It
post_message:
In 1998, voters in California passed a law that severely restricted bilingual education in public schools.

In 2016, they are being asked to overturn it.
post_description: A ballot measure in November seeks to overturn limits passed in 1998, an effort that will test how the state’s attitude toward immigrants has changed in two decades.

post_name: Dreams and Dramas on the Other Side of the Border
post_message: “Separation. You see a lot of that. The mother leaving her child. The child leaving the mother. This is how it goes.”
post_description: A lot in the heart of Denver, where buses pick up passengers bound for dreams and dramas on the other side of the border, is a window into the immigrant’s split soul.

post_name: Sheriff Joe Arpaio, Accused of Targeting Latinos, Is Charged With Contempt
post_message: Prosecutors say the sheriff willfully defied a judge’s orders to stop targeting Latinos — including citizens and legal immigrants — in traffic stops and other law enforcement efforts.
post_description: Prosecutors said Sheriff Arpaio, of Maricopa County, Ariz., had willfully defied a judge’s orders to stop discriminatory policing.

post_name: Donald Trump Won’t Say if He’ll Accept Result of Election
post_message: Donald J. Trump said that he might not accept the results of the  election — a stunning statement that Hillary Clinton called “horrifying.”
post_description: At their third and last debate, Mr. Trump and Hillary Clinton argued over immigration, guns, the Supreme Court and especially each other.

post_name: ‘Lions Hunting Zebras’: Ex-Wells Fargo Bankers Describe Abuses
post_message: Immigrants who speak little English. Older adults with memory problems. These were the people Wells Fargo targeted.
post_description: In legal filings and statements, former employees of the bank said immigrants, older adults, college students and Native Americans were targeted for fake accounts.

post_name: ‘I Had a Scary Dream About Donald Trump’: Muslim Parents Face a Tense Election
post_message: 7-year-old Maaria has nightmares about Donald J. Trump. She says if he becomes president, “I’m going to stay in my room forever.”
post_description: Across the country, Muslims have been addressing with their children a news cycle that includes Mr. Trump’s calls to kick Muslims out of the United States and the recent bombing in Manhattan.

post_name: If Immigration Can’t Be Stopped, Maybe It Can Be Managed
post_message: "Barring legal immigrant workers will not protect American workers. But it will ensure that illegal immigration persists."
post_description: The United States can choose what kind of low-skilled immigration it will have, legal or illegal, and specialists say legal is undoubtedly better.

post_name: My Wife’s Killer Was Not an ‘Illegal Immigrant’
post_message: "Donald J. Trump demonizes undocumented immigrants. Though one of them killed my wife, I refuse to do the same," Andy Ostroy writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Trump demonizes undocumented immigrants. Though one of them killed Adrienne Shelly, my wife, I refuse to do the same.

post_name: Donald Trump Offers His Version of ‘New Deal for Black America’
post_message: "It is my highest and greatest hope that the Republican Party can be the home in the future and forevermore for African-Americans and the African-American vote," Donald J. Trump said.
post_description: The plan combines elements of his education proposals, tax cuts and immigration policies to revive cities that he has described as blighted.

post_name: California Today: Female Surfers Tear Down a Big Wave Barrier
post_message: One of the world’s top big wave surfing contests will add a women’s heat for the first time in its 17-year history.
post_description: Friday: A gender barrier falls in big wave surfing, support for Donald J. Trump makes a House stalwart vulnerable, and a look back at an anti-immigrant massacre in Los Angeles.

post_name: Geert Wilders, Far-Right Politician, Boycotts His Hate-Speech Trial in the Netherlands
post_message: Geert Wilders called himself "a politician who says what the politically correct elite do not want to hear."
post_description: Mr. Wilders’s tirades against Islam, immigration and the European Union have made him one of the most divisive figures in Dutch politics.

post_name: Cornrows? No. Superheroes? Yes.
post_message: "Every year, it seems, people need to be reminded that skin color is not a costume."
post_description: Beware of the Halloween failure: the white dudes dressed as Trayvon Martin; the college president shamed for dressing in stereotypical Mexican garb; the blonde woman wearing a sari or pretending to be a geisha.

post_name: Muslims Assert Their Fashion Identity
post_message: “The Arabs deserve their Vogue, and they've deserved it for a long, long time," said the new editor in chief of Vogue Arabia.
post_description: From Vogue Arabia to New York Fashion Week, Muslim consumers and designers are demanding global recognition and respect of their cultural and commercial clout.

post_name: Arizona’s Scarred Generation
post_message: Aracely and Dalia are strangers, with backgrounds that echo each other. But their daily routines each tell a different story of where Arizona, and the country, may be heading.
post_description: Two daughters of Mexican immigrants who crossed the border illegally. Two different futures for young Latinos. Which will we choose?

post_name: In Arizona, Tim Kaine Gives Speech Entirely in Spanish, a First
post_message: "Well, Señor Kaine, lo hablaste muy bien."
post_description: Steadily, confidently but far from flawlessly, Mr. Kaine spoke in a heavily Hispanic neighborhood in Phoenix, in a language that is a synonym for immigration here.

post_name: In Arizona, Tim Kaine Gives Speech Entirely in Spanish, a First
post_message: "Well, Señor Kaine, lo hablaste muy bien."
post_description: Steadily, confidently but far from flawlessly, Mr. Kaine spoke in a heavily Hispanic neighborhood in Phoenix, in a language that is a synonym for immigration here.

post_name: Gentrification Protesters in Los Angeles Target Art Galleries
post_message: "There is this perception that if you are doing art you are this rich white guy from Beverly Hills. But I am not this rich white guy. I came to this country with $36 in my pocket. And it’s pretty sad that after 30 years I am being told to go back where you came from."
post_description: Spray paint and hurled bottles draw the notice of the police as a neighborhood’s Mexican-American residents fear being displaced.

post_name: Gentrification Protesters in Los Angeles Target Art Galleries
post_message: "There is this perception that if you are doing art you are this rich white guy from Beverly Hills. But I am not this rich white guy. I came to this country with $36 in my pocket. And it’s pretty sad that after 30 years I am being told to go back where you came from."
post_description: Spray paint and hurled bottles draw the notice of the police as a neighborhood’s Mexican-American residents fear being displaced.

post_name: Undocumented Migrants, Free Now to Visit Mexico, Face Iffy Future
post_message: Thousands of undocumented immigrants have used a 2012 program to visit the countries they left as children, and then re-enter the United States. The program could be canceled.
post_description: The future of the program, an initiative of the Obama administration, remains uncertain.

post_name: Remembering Nohemi Gonzalez, a Year Later
post_message: She was the only American killed in the 2015 terrorist attacks in Paris.
post_description: Ms. Gonzalez, a first-generation Mexican-American student on a semester abroad in Paris, was undoubtedly special. Even in death.

post_name: Khizr Khan Revs Up Rally Before Introducing Hillary Clinton in New Hampshire
post_message:
“Donald Trump, would my son Captain Humayun Khan have a place in your America?”
“Would Muslims have a place in your America?”
“Would Latinos have a place in your America?”
“Would African-Americans have a place in your America?”
“Would anyone who is not like you have a place in your America?” 
“Well, thankfully, Mr. Trump, this isn’t your America."
post_description: In a call and response with voters, Mr. Khan, the father of a soldier killed in Iraq, portrayed a dark vision of the country if Donald J. Trump were to win the election.

post_name: Hopes for U.K. Trade Deal With India Hit a Snag: Immigration
post_message: Theresa May received a rocky reception on a visit to India.
post_description: Mrs. May had barely hit the ground when her aspiration to forge closer ties with one of the world’s fastest-growing economies began to falter over immigration.

post_name: Sheriff Joe Arpaio Loses Bid for 7th Term in Arizona
post_message: Breaking News: Joe Arpaio, the Arizona sheriff who was accused of bias against Latinos, has been ousted by voters.
post_description: The sheriff, 84, was undone by voters responding to his aggressive pursuit of Latinos in Maricopa County for immigration enforcement.

post_name: Mexico Braces for the Fallout of a Trump Presidency
post_message: For Mexico, the nightmare came true.
post_description: For many Mexicans, the election of Donald J. Trump is a harbinger for hard days to come for the country, its economy and even its state of mind.

post_name: As Donald Trump Took the Lead, Canada’s Immigration Website Buckled
post_message: Canada’s immigration website crashed, prompting speculation that it had been overloaded by Americans looking for a new home.
post_description: Around the time Mr. Trump pulled ahead in the election returns, the site for would-be residents of Canada buckled under a surge in interest.

post_name: Muslim in Trump's America
post_message: "Instead of being despondent, I am willing myself to be more passionate, energized and empowered for the sake of my children." Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Our president elect wanted to bar my people from entering this country.

post_name: Trump’s Victory, on Front Pages Worldwide
post_message: Mexican newspapers were especially critical.
post_description: Newspapers across the globe scrambled to create front pages befitting the day’s place in history.

post_name: Donald Trump Win Has Blacks, Hispanics and Muslims Bracing for a Long 4 Years
post_message: Latinos fear Donald J. Trump will pursue his mass deportation pledge, blacks anticipate an era of intolerance, and Muslims worry about being branded terrorists.
post_description: “If he said those things as a candidate, what will he say as president?”

post_name: Police Investigate Attacks on Muslim Students at Universities
post_message: In one episode, an attacker wore a “Trump” hat. In another, the assailants made comments about Donald J. Trump and Muslims.
post_description: The attacks underscored criticism from Donald Trump's opponents who said his harsh anti-Muslim language was emboldening extremists.

post_name: White Women Voted Trump. Now What?
post_message: "As a young white woman, I realize that white women did not do the work needed to keep Donald J. Trump from the White House. They did not rise to the uncomfortable challenge of convincing other white women to support not just their own interests, but those of women and men of color, L.G.B.T. Americans, immigrants and people in poverty," Phoebe Lett writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: White feminists have some work to do among their own.

post_name: White Women Voted Trump. Now What?

They did not rise to the uncomfortable challenge of convincing other white women to support not just their own interests, but those of women and men of color, L.G.B.T. Americans, immigrants and people in poverty," Phoebe Lett writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: White feminists have some work to do among their own.

post_name: What Will President Trump Do on Birth Control, Climate and Immigration?
post_message:
- Are U.S. military alliances in trouble?
- Will Donald J. Trump deport more undocumented immigrants?
- Will women have to pay for birth control again?
post_description: Anticipating what policies Donald J. Trump will try to put in place after Inauguration Day is best done by taking his campaign promises seriously.

post_name: What Will President Trump Do on Birth Control, Climate and Immigration?

post_name: I’m Muslim, but My Roommate Supports Trump
post_message: "When she outed herself to me as a Trump supporter, I realized I had finally found the 'silent majority.' " Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Did she really expect me to respect her choice when it undermined my presence in this country, in this university, in my very own dorm room?

post_name: When Melania Trump Met Michelle Obama, Their Clothes Did Some of the Talking
post_message: As Michelle Obama showed over the past 8 years — and reiterated on Thursday — a wardrobe can be a powerful platform for a first lady, making points without her having to say a word, fashion critic Vanessa Friedman writes in The New York Times Styles.
post_description: The first lady wore a dress by Narciso Rodriguez, the son of immigrants; the future first lady wore a black sheath dress and Christian Louboutin heels.

post_name: Red, Blue and Divided: Six Views of America
post_message:
"We are deliberately importing Muslims who are very intolerant and don't believe in live-and-let-live." — a Donald J. Trump supporter in Tennessee

"This is where we must be honest about the depth of racism and the psychic sickness of our country." — a minister and civil rights leader in North Carolina 

"I have this suspicion that I have no idea what's going on in the rest of white America." — a Hillary Clinton supporter in D.C.
post_description: Reporters for The New York Times spoke with people across the country to understand the issues that split voters before the election, and today.

post_name: Donald Trump Appears to Soften Stance on Immigration, but Not on Abortion
post_message: On "60 Minutes," President-elect Donald J. Trump said he would prioritize deporting up to 3 million illegal immigrants and pick a Supreme Court justice who opposes abortion rights.
post_description: The president-elect said his immigration priority was to deport up to three million undocumented immigrants rather than 11 million and that his border wall might be a fence in places.

post_name: A Song of Love and Longing on the Mexican Border
post_message: Every month, a musician in Mexico sings through the border wall to his daughter on the other side.
post_description: “The Other Side’’ documents the monthly meetings between a musician and his daughter who have been on either side of the United States-Mexico border.

post_name: Trump’s Choice of Stephen Bannon Is Nod to Anti-Washington Base
post_message: The nationalist movement — which has promoted and enabled anti-immigrant, anti-Muslim and racist sentiments — will now have a champion at Donald J. Trump's side in the West Wing.
post_description: Mr. Bannon, the former head of Breitbart News, will be President-elect Trump’s senior adviser, an appointment that has drawn criticism.

post_name: Court in Egypt Overturns Mohamed Morsi’s Death Sentence
post_message: Mohamed Morsi, who was the country’s first democratically elected president and was ousted in 2013 by the military, is likely to remain in prison indefinitely.
post_description: Mr. Morsi, a leader of the Muslim Brotherhood and former president, is likely to remain in prison indefinitely. Executing him could unsettle the country.

post_name: Catholic Bishops Challenge Donald Trump on Immigration
post_message: “This should not be happening in America,” said Archbishop Gomez, referring to Donald J. Trump's promise to deport millions of immigrants. “We are not this kind of people. We are better than this.”
post_description: In their annual conference, Catholic bishops elected new leaders and said they are preparing to defend immigrants and refugees against a wave of anger.

post_name: Trump Camp’s Talk of Registry and Japanese Internment Raises Muslim Fears
post_message:
“You’re not proposing that we go back to the days of internment camps, I hope,” said Megyn Kelly.

Carl Higbie denied that, but said, “We need to protect America first.”
post_description: A prominent supporter cited World War II-era internment camps as a “precedent” for an immigrant registry suggested by a member of Mr. Trump’s transition team.

post_name: Trump Camp’s Talk of Registry and Japanese Internment Raises Muslim Fears

“You’re not proposing that we go back to the days of internment camps, I hope,” said Megyn Kelly.

post_name: 1942 All Over Again?
post_message: Donald J. Trump’s campaign vow to register Muslims echoes the shameful treatment of Japanese-Americans during WWII, the Editorial Board writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: Donald Trump’s campaign vow to register Muslims is a frightening echo of the shameful treatment of Japanese-American citizens during World War II.

post_name: Iraqis Welcome Trump’s Stance on ISIS, but Fear It May Backfire
post_message: How people in the Middle East are responding to President-elect Donald J. Trump.
post_description: There is hope among Muslims that Donald J. Trump will be more forceful in combating extremists, but also fear that his efforts will be turned against him.

post_name: Muslim Americans Speak of Escalating Worries
post_message: Sara Khan, 17, a New Yorker whose parents immigrated to the U.S. from Pakistan, said of President-elect Donald Trump, “What are we going to do if he tries to kick us out?”
post_description: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s early personnel selections have compounded fears of discrimination, violence and deportation.

post_name: Avocados Imperil Monarch Butterflies’ Winter Home in Mexico
post_message: How our love of avocados threatens monarch butterflies.
post_description: Spurred by rising demand for the fruit, farmers in the Mexican state that hosts the annual butterfly migration are replacing a vital forest habitat with orchards.

post_name: Mexico Can Stand Up to Trump
post_message: The Mexican government should oppose the construction of the wall that was so central to Donald J. Trump's campaign, Jorge G. Castañeda writes in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: So far, the Mexican government has tried to appease the American president-elect. Here’s how it can fight back instead.

post_name: At a School of Immigrants, Challenges Reach Far Beyond the Classroom
post_message: This is a school of immigrants, in a city of immigrants, in a country of immigrants. So the aftermath of the election has been a delicate dance.
post_description: After the election of Donald J. Trump as president, anxiety rippled through Public School 160, a South Brooklyn school where most of the students come from poor, immigrant families.

post_name: George Soros Pledges $10 Million to Fight Hate Crimes
post_message: George Soros says he believes campaign statements from Donald J. Trump and his supporters were “directly responsible” for the recent attacks against immigrants and minorities.
post_description: Saying the Trump campaign awakened “dark forces,” Mr. Soros, the billionaire Democratic donor, will fund grants to community and civil rights groups and efforts to track attacks.

post_name: George Soros Pledges $10 Million to Fight Hate Crimes
post_message: George Soros says he believes campaign statements from Donald J. Trump and his supporters were “directly responsible” for the recent attacks against immigrants and minorities.

post_name: America Has Room for the Dreamers
post_message:
When Donald J. Trump takes office, he will have the power to upend the lives of more than 700,000 young people who have grown up in the U.S. after being brought here illegally as children.

Read on in The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: In a saner time, in a country whose politics were less poisoned, there would be no talk of punishing young immigrants.

post_name: The Privileged Immigrant
post_message:
"Once, during his first year of training, my dad fainted from exhaustion. When he came to, he still had a job, he still had a visa."

Read more from The New York Times Opinion Section.
post_description: My Indian family’s comfort is built on the work of other immigrants.

post_name: François Fillon Wins Center-Right Nomination for French Presidency
post_message: François Fillon, a former prime minister who pledged to limit immigration and control Islam, handily defeated Alain Juppé.
post_description: Mr. Fillon, with his themes of restoring France’s identity and national greatness and his tough language on immigrants and Islam, has been making a clear play for Ms. Le Pen’s voters.

post_name: California Today: Fretting Over the ‘Netflix Tax’
post_message: Dozens of California cities are considering a new way to raise revenue — taxing your "Gilmore Girls" binge.
post_description: Monday: Cities mull a tax on video streaming services, sanctuary cities vow to fight Donald J. Trump on immigration, and a look back at a rebellion for California secession.

post_name: Cities Vow to Fight Trump on Immigration, Even if They Lose Millions
post_message: Officials in U.S. sanctuary cities are gearing up to defy Donald J. Trump on immigration.
post_description: Officials in what are known as sanctuary cities say they will act as a bulwark against mass deportations, even at the risk of losing federal money for local services.

post_name: American Dreamers
post_message: These young immigrants have been spared from deportation. Read their stories, and share yours. (via The New York Times Opinion Section)
post_description: Stories from young immigrants who were spared from deportation and permitted to work during the Obama administration, but whose status is now in jeopardy.
