post_name: Congress passes one-week stopgap on Homeland Security funding
post_message:
Earlier today, the Senate approved funds to keep the Homeland Security Department fully operating past a midnight deadline tonight. But the House then rejected the three-week stopgap bill, a major defeat for Speaker John Boehner as the deadline loomed to avoid a shutdown of the agency.﻿

About 10 p.m. Eastern time, the House voted to approve a one-week stopgap bill, narrowly averting the deadline when the agency's money was set to run out.

[This post has been updated twice to reflect the House votes.]
post_description: Congress approved a stopgap measure late Friday to keep the Department of Homeland Security funded for another week – averting a crisis just before money was set to run out at midnight, but setting up a new standoff as conservatives press their fight over President Obama’s immigration pl…

post_name: 'Jihadi John' suspect took anger management classes, says teacher
post_message: A London teacher of Mohammed Emwazi,  believed to be the black-clad   militant   in the beheading videos of a number of Islamic State hostages,  says, “We did a lot of work as a school to help him with his anger and to control his emotions and it seemed to work.”
post_description: The British-educated Muslim man now believed to be the notorious Islamic State killer “Jihadi John” reportedly took anger management classes as a student.

post_name: House OKs Homeland Security funds as GOP gives up tactic on immigration
post_message: Congress ended the crisis over funding for the Homeland Security Department on Tuesday after House Speaker John A. Boehner abandoned the GOP’s strategy of trying to tack on restrictions to President Obama’s immigration plan.
post_description: House conservatives were outraged that the speaker declined to continue their fight against the president's actions on immigration, which many Republicans view as an overreach of executive authority.

post_name: 7,000 immigrant children ordered deported without going to court
post_message: More than 7,000 immigrant children have been ordered deported without appearing in court since large numbers of minors from Central America began illegally crossing the U.S. border in 2013, federal statistics show.
post_description: The high number of deportation orders has raised alarm among immigrant advocates, who say many of those children were never notified of their hearing date because of problems with the immigration court system.

post_name: The new civil rights leaders: Emerging voices in the 21st century
post_message:
Much in the spirit of activists who pushed for civil rights a half century ago, a new generation is fighting battles old and new.

We profile some of them, from St. Louis alderman Antonio French, who has figured prominently in demonstrations in Ferguson, to writer Ta-Nehisi Coates, to Chad Griffin of the Human Rights Campaign, to immigration activist Astrid Silva.
post_description: "All over the U.S., we are witnessing the dawn of a truth and reconciliation movement," says Fania Davis, founder of the group Restorative Justice for Oakland Youth.

post_name: U.S.-born students in Mexico risk becoming 'lost generation'
post_message: U.S.-born students with Mexican parents struggle to learn Spanish and adjust to school in Mexico. Will they become the 'lost generation'?
post_description: Emmanuel Vargas was 13 and just starting eighth grade in Davenport, Iowa, when his father was detained in a workplace immigration raid and deported back to Mexico.

post_name: Marine reservist freed from prison in Mexico is arrested in Georgia
post_message:
Do you remember the Marine reservist who was held for seven months in a Mexican prison on weapons charges, while U.S. politicians fought for his release so he could be treated for PTSD? 

Andrew Tahmooressi has been arrested in Georgia on suspicion of reckless driving and drunk driving.
post_description: "Our primary goal is getting him the help he needs, and ensuring he is not held up to undue public scrutiny as the result of his mental illness," a family representative said.

post_name: Michael Douglas finds Judaism and faces anti-Semitism
post_message: Michael Douglas, who writes in Los Angeles Times Opinion of his and his son's brushes with bias, gives three reasons for a recent spike in anti-Semitism: irrational hatred of Israel, a bad global economy, and a radicalized fringe of Europe's 25 to 30 million Muslims.
post_description: Last summer our family went to Southern Europe on holiday. During our stay at a hotel, our son Dylan went to the swimming pool. A short time later he came running back to the room, upset. A man at the pool had started hurling insults at him.

post_name: Chinese immigrant, denied law license in 1890, gets one posthumously
post_message: A Chinese immigrant denied a California law license in 1890 because of his race will receive one posthumously, the California Supreme Court decided unanimously Monday.
post_description: An Asian student law association at UC Davis asked the state's highest court to “right this historic wrong” by admitting the late Hong Yen Chang to the California bar.

post_name: LAPD officer accused of trying to smuggle Mexican citizen across border
post_message: A 10-year veteran of the LAPD was allegedly caught trying to smuggle a Mexican citizen into the U.S. in the trunk of a car.
post_description: The officer is at home on paid administrative leave pending an internal investigation by the LAPD, officials said.

post_name: Mexican farmworkers strike over low wages, blocking harvest
post_message:
Mexican farmworkers' strike over higher wages and better conditions has all but stopped the harvest. 

"We just want better lives," said one striker, a mother of three.
post_description: Veronica Zaragoza grew up in these coastal fields, picking berries and tomatoes and watching an industry being transformed.

post_name: Baja farmworkers' strike crimping some produce supplies in U.S.
post_message: Farmworkers protesting low wages at Mexican export farms in Baja California timed their strike for the peak of the harvest season, and their bold tactics appear to be having an impact.
post_description: Produce industry growers, retailers, shippers and importers on Friday reported some shortages of strawberries, zucchinis and tomatoes at stores and produce markets in Southern California and beyond.

post_name: Could the anti-immigrant loudmouths pass a U.S. citizenship test?
post_message:
Ted Rall has an idea for immigration reform: Deport anyone who can't pass a U.S. citizenship test.

(via Los Angeles Times Opinion)
post_description: To listen to talk radio and cable television, which are dominated by conservatives, the national and state debates over immigration give the impression that most legal residents of the state of California oppose immigrant workers here illegally and might even be favorably disposed to Mitt Romney 's…

post_name: Kenya university attack: At least 147 killed by Shabab gunmen
post_message: Al Qaeda-linked gunmen stormed a Kenya university, killing at least 147 people. According to one of the first responders: 25 bodies were removed from one classroom.
post_description: The Al Qaeda-linked group said the university was on Muslim land and was there to promulgate "missionary activities and to spread deviant ideology.”

post_name: California Democrats unveil immigration bills, jab Congress on inaction
post_message: State Democrats have announced 10 bills aimed at helping undocumented immigrants in California, including ones that would offer state-subsidized healthcare and legal protections against deportation.
post_description: Flanked by immigration advocates and lawmakers from both houses, California legislative leaders unveiled Tuesday a slate of new proposals to aid those in the country illegally, including offering state-subsidized healthcare and increasing legal protections against deportation.

post_name: Salvadoran immigrant held at Adelanto ICE facility dies
post_message: An immigrant rights group is calling for an independent investigation after a Salvadoran man died while in U.S. immigration custody after months of incarceration at a privately run detention center that has been accused of medical neglect in the past.
post_description: Raul Ernesto Morales-Ramos, 44, died Monday after being transferred from Adelanto Detention Center to a hospital in Palmdale, according to a statement from U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

post_name: Guilty verdict in Boston bombing sets stage for trial's death penalty phase
post_message: Dzhokhar #Tsarnaev has been found guilty of all charges against him in the Boston Marathon bombing trial, including conspiring to plan and execute the worst terrorist attack on U.S. soil since 9/11.
post_description: A seven-woman, five-man federal jury in the Boston Marathon bombing trial found Russian immigrant Dzhokhar Tsarnaev guilty of all charges against him, including conspiring to plan and execute the worst terrorist attack on U.S. soil since Sept. 11.

post_name: California may shield immigrants charged with drug crimes from deportation
post_message:
California considers minor drug charges to be wiped away once a defendant finishes treatment, but nearly all drug convictions still stand under federal immigration law — and can set off deportation proceedings for immigrants without legal papers and those with green cards.
 
A new bill, if it becomes law, would instead allow people charged with drug possession and other low-level narcotics crimes to opt for treatment before entering a plea. If they completed their courses, they would not have to enter a guilty plea. That, says the bill's author, would allow immigrants to choose drug counseling without risking deportation.
post_description: When Jesús Cordero was arrested for Ecstasy possession, his lawyer offered what seemed like an obvious solution: Plead guilty and undergo drug counseling. Once Cordero completed the course, the charges would be dismissed.

post_name: Mexican government raids farm labor camps in crackdown on abuses
post_message: The Mexican government has raided at least three squalid, makeshift farm labor camps in recent weeks, rescuing about 250 adults and children.
post_description: Government videos show dozens of people living under plastic tarps strung from trees. There is no running water or bathrooms. Barefoot toddlers stumble through muddy fields. Children lug 30-pound buckets filled with cucumbers.

post_name: The delay confirming Loretta Lynch was wrong, but it wasn't racist
post_message:
It was wrong for Senate Republicans to hold up Loretta Lynch's confirmation as attorney general -- but was it racist? Los Angeles Times Opinion's Michael McGough says no:

"There wasn’t a scintilla of evidence that action of Lynch’s nomination was held up because of her race. She was rather the victim of color-blind partisan obstructionism tied to Republican outrage over Obama’s executive action on immigration and, more recently, a dispute over abortion language in a human-trafficking bill."
post_description: When Loretta Lynch was finally confirmed by the Senate this week as U.S. attorney general, she received 10 Republican votes -- many fewer than she should have received but more than were expected given the GOP majority’s recent hyper-partisanship. Even Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell vo…

post_name: Private companies profit from U.S. immigration detention boom
post_message: Even as the number of immigrants caught illegally crossing the U.S.-Mexico border has fallen to the lowest levels since the 1970s, the federal government has increased spending on immigrant detention, filling 14,000 more beds last year than it did in 2006. Private prison companies have profited from the boom.
post_description: In the women's wing of the nation's newest immigrant detention center, 28-year-old Silia Ramirez sat Thursday writing a letter to her family.

post_name: Chipotle says it's the first chain to get rid of GMO ingredients
post_message: Chipotle Mexican Grill says that it is using virtually no genetically modified ingredients. The company is still working on tortillas but is closing in on completely eliminating GMOs from their food.
post_description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc. said Monday that it is using virtually no genetically modified ingredients and that it is the first restaurant chain to do so.

post_name: Vietnamese refugees began new lives in Camp Pendleton's 1975 'tent city'
post_message:
Tomorrow will mark the 40th anniversary of the end of the Vietnam War. Many had to flee their homes with little time to pack, so they chose only their most precious belongings to bring with them. Read about what Vietnamese immigrants brought with them to their new home in the United States -- the so-called "tent city" at Camp Pendleton.

Did you or your family immigrate to America from Vietnam during or after the war? We want to hear about it. Tell us your story in the comments or post about it on Twitter or Instagram with #VietnamToAmerica.
post_description: Inside the tent city, the lost and the bewildered roamed, one of them describing their arrival 'like coming to the promised land - just that we didn't know what was promised or where we would land.'

post_name: Vietnamese refugees began new lives in Camp Pendleton's 1975 'tent city'
post_message:
Tomorrow will mark the 40th anniversary of the end of the Vietnam War. Many had to flee their homes with little time to pack, so they chose only their most precious belongings to bring with them. Read about what Vietnamese immigrants brought with them to their new home in the United States -- the so-called "tent city" at Camp Pendleton.

Did you or your family immigrate to America from Vietnam during or after the war? We want to hear about it. Tell us your story in the comments or post about it on Twitter or Instagram with #VietnamToAmerica.
post_description: Inside the tent city, the lost and the bewildered roamed, one of them describing their arrival 'like coming to the promised land - just that we didn't know what was promised or where we would land.'

post_name: In Spain, proposed 'kebab law' angers Muslim business owners
post_message: A new proposal in Spain would bar any new kebab shops, dollar stores or Internet cafes unless they are situated more than 500 yards from existing ones. Muslims in the area say it's a policy intended to discriminate against their largely immigrant communities.
post_description: Ruling conservatives, who are seeking reelection in a May 24 municipal vote, hope to limit the number of kebab shops and other traditionally immigrant-owned businesses in Tarragona's historic quarter.

post_name: Arizona 'Dreamers' win lower in-state tuition rates at public universities
post_message: The Arizona Board of Regents will grant in-state tuition rates to young immigrants who entered the country illegally as children and now seek to attend public universities as Arizona residents.
post_description: “Students were getting priced out of an education,” said state Sen. Martin Quezada, a Phoenix Democrat.

post_name: Mexrrissey: The phenomenon that created a Mexican supergroup
post_message: This band has translated Morrissey's most venerable songs into Spanish and laced them with Latin beats.
post_description: By now, it is no secret that Mexicans love Morrissey .

post_name: Republicans block immigrant youth 'dreamers' from military
post_message: House Republicans have voted to block a measure that would have allowed the Pentagon to consider allowing young immigrants who are in the country illegally — but were given temporary legal status under a program started by President Obama — to enlist in the military.
post_description: Passage would have meant a sizable shift in Republican thinking on immigration-related matters.

post_name: Amid mounting tension, Mexico agrees to subsidize farmworkers' wages
post_message: Baja California farmworker leaders and the Mexican government have reached a tentative agreement that would increase wages and guarantee government-required benefits to thousands of laborers. In an unprecedented move, the government agreed to pay part of the workers' wages in order to meet their demands for a minimum daily wage of 200 pesos, or about $13.
post_description: The announcement came after weeks of stalled talks and increasingly violent clashes between protesters and police.

post_name: Stop Blood Tomatoes Act meant to curb Mexico labor abuses, lawmaker says
post_message: A California congressman has introduced a bill aimed at forcing U.S. retailers to rid their supply chains of child labor and forced labor -- legislation inspired by The Times' Product of Mexico series (http://lat.ms/1u7YGGO), which documented widespread abuses at export farms south of the border.
post_description: The Stop Blood Tomatoes Act, sponsored by Rep. Juan Vargas (D-San Diego), attempts to bring more oversight to minimally regulated Mexican farms that supply much of America's fruits and vegetabl...

post_name: Mexican satellite lost in second Russian space failure in a month
post_message: What's up with the Russian space program? Don't ask. A Russian rocket carrying a Mexican satellite just crashed in Siberia. This comes after an April 28 mishap.
post_description: A Russian Proton-M rocket malfunctioned shortly after it blasted off early Saturday from its  launchpad in Kazakhstan, crashing in Siberia along with the Mexican satellite it was intended to put into orbit.

post_name: Immigration: 445,000 awaiting a court date, which might not come for 4 years
post_message: Waiting for a day in immigration court? So are 445,000 others. The system has been overwhelmed since last summer’s influx of unaccompanied children from Central America.
post_description: Driven by last summer’s surge of illegal immigration from Central America, the already large backlog in federal immigration courts has reached an all-time high, with more than 445,000 pending cases, according to a new report.

post_name: Arizona Sheriff Joe Arpaio asks public's help with legal fees
post_message: In a letter to supporters, Maricopa County Sheriff Joe Arpaio asked for help with his legal fees, adding that he feels "targeted" by the immigration rights groups that have sued him to stop what they say are racist policies targeting Latinos.
post_description: With his legal fees mounting and a trial turning increasingly personal, Maricopa County Sheriff Joe Arpaio is turning to the public for money and the legal system for a new judge.

post_name: A major setback for Obama's immigration overhaul
post_message: No se puede: A federal court deals a major blow to Obama's immigration plan.
post_description: DACA is dead -- for now. A federal appeals court in Louisiana has refused to lift a lower court’s ruling that blocked President Obama’s landmark executive actions that aimed to shield up to 5 million people from deportation.

post_name: High court rules in favor of hijab-wearing job applicant who was turned down
post_message:
Today, the Supreme Court told employers that they had a duty under federal anti-discrimination law to accommodate the religious practices of employees and job applicants.

The court ruled in favor of a 17-year-old Muslim girl who wore a black head scarf to an interview for a sales job at an Oklahoma Abercrombie & Fitch store. She was turned away because managers feared her scarf would clash with the retailer’s image.
post_description: By an 8-1 vote, the justices sided with a 17-year-old Muslim girl who was rejected for a job at Abercrombie & Fitch because she wore a head scarf.

post_name: State Senate OKs health coverage for many immigrants here illegally
post_message: An estimated 2 million people in the state without authorization will now be eligible to enroll in Medi-Cal.
post_description: The state Senate on Tuesday approved a hotly debated measure that would allow many immigrants in the country illegally to sign up for special healthcare programs that would offer the same benefits as Medi-Cal.

post_name: Wine with your Taco Bell Sriracha Quesarito? The chain is testing alcohol options
post_message: Instead of getting drunk and then going to Taco Bell, the fast-food chain is test-driving letting you do it all in one place.
post_description: Taco Bell is where you might end up post-midnight, drunk on vodka Redbulls, but some new additions to the menu could get you into the Mexican fast food chain before dark.

post_name: United attendant who denied soda can to Muslim will no longer serve customers
post_message: A flight attendant who refused to give an unopened can of soda to a Muslim passenger will continue in her job after receiving additional sensitivity training, but will no longer be serving United customers.
post_description: United Airlines says a flight attendant involved in a dispute with a customer over a can of Diet Coke, leading to accusations of discrimination, won’t be serving customers on the airline any longer.

post_name: Decades later, Vietnamese refugees honor Navy commander who rescued them
post_message:
In 1979, four years after the fall of Saigon, a U.S. Navy commander named Bill Mathis was instrumental in saving the lives of 448 refugees who'd become stranded while trying to flee Vietnam on a 55-foot boat.

Today, Mathis is known as a hero in Orange County's Little Saigon. But he didn't fully understand his reputation until he was honored there recently.
post_description: Hundreds applauded Bill Mathis during an immigrant gathering, he was interviewed on Vietnamese television, and he was featured on "Paris By Night," the long-running Vietnamese variety show.

post_name: Border Patrol absolves itself in dozens of cases of lethal force
post_message: A Border Patrol internal investigation of 67 shooting incidents, which left 19 people dead, absolves agents of criminal misconduct in all but three cases.
post_description: A U.S. Border Patrol agent who killed an unarmed 15-year-old Mexican boy by shooting him in the face after a rock-throwing incident on a border bridge to El Paso in 2010 was recently cleared of wrongdoing by the agency's internal affairs office.

post_name: Immigration reform: Let the states lead the way
post_message:
States already experiment on welfare, drug and education policy, so why not let them do the same with another area where the federal government has repeatedly failed to craft a one-size-fits-all solution: immigration?

(via Los Angeles Times Opinion)
post_description: Texas and California are trying to reform legal migration on their own. The politics in these two states couldn't be more different, but legislators in both states recently proposed running their own guest-worker visa programs to get around the federal immigration reform gridlock. Relying on states…

post_name: Mark Zuckerberg donates $5 million to help undocumented immigrants attend college
post_message: "Without documentation, it’s often a struggle to get a college education, and they don’t have access to any kind of federal aid," Zuckerberg said on Wednesday. "We ought to welcome smart and hardworking young people from every nation, and to help everyone in our society achieve their full potential."
post_description: Zuckerberg has long supported immigrant rights, and co-founded the lobbying group FWD.us in 2013 with Bill Gates and other tech executives.

post_name: Mexican pop giant Maná hits a fresh wave of buzz with its edgier sound
post_message: Two bands are tied for playing the most sold-out shows at the Staples Center: Taylor Swift and Maná.
post_description: This week, the band is back at Staples for two nearly sold-out shows that could put them ahead of Swift, at least until August when the pop star returns to L.A.

post_name: India's plans for Yoga Day taking a stressful turn
post_message: Sunday is International Day of Yoga. And while many across India -- and around the world -- are readying for a mass sun salutation, not everyone there is receiving the practice with open arms.
post_description: "Chanting 'Om, hari om' — these are the words of Hinduism. Muslims cannot say these words," said Abdul Rahim Qureshi, general secretary of the All India Muslim Personal Law Board, who filed a case against for reportedly requiring student attendance.

post_name: Feds change rules to allow quicker release of immigrant families from detention centers
post_message: The move is designed to ease the strain on overcrowded detention centers, as well as to address criticism from activists who take issue with both the length of the detentions and the conditions in the center.
post_description: More than 68,000 families came into the U.S., many illegally, from Central America and Mexico during last year's border surge.

post_name: Immigration reform: 'The California Package'
post_message:
Call it "the California Package": As many states move toward stricter enforcement of federal immigration laws, California has been providing driver licenses, in-state tuition, health benefits and more to people regardless of immigration status. 

(via Los Angeles Times Opinion)
post_description: While the federal government stalls on immigration reform, some states have begun acting on their own. Much attention in the last decade has focused on Republican-dominated areas that have tightened enforcement. Meanwhile, more quietly, California moved in the opposite direction, encouraging integra…

post_name: Immigrant families in detention: A look inside
post_message:
Even toddlers get ID cards here.

A look inside one holding center, which has a dual nature as a place of confinement and of family life.
post_description: At the 50-acre compound here holding hundreds of immigrant women and children, the lights stay on 24-7. At night they're dimmed, but not entirely out.

post_name: Univision cuts ties with Donald Trump, Miss USA pageant over Mexican remarks
post_message: "They’re bringing drugs. They’re bringing crime. They’re rapists. And some, I assume, are good people."
post_description: The Spanish-language media giant Univision is cutting ties with Trump , saying the real estate mogul made "insulting remarks" about Mexican immigrants.

post_name: NBC dumps Donald Trump for derogatory comments about Mexican immigrants
post_message: NBCUniversal to Trump: You're fired.
post_description: NBCUniversal delivered a message to Donald Trump over his recent remarks regarding immigrants: "You're fired."

post_name: Fatal shooting in San Francisco ignites immigration policy debate
post_message: San Francisco law allows holds only for people with violent records. Francisco Sanchez, 45, had several felonies but no major violent crime conviction.
post_description: San Francisco and its liberal policy toward people in the U.S. illegally were thrust into the national political debate this weekend after the fatal shooting of a woman at a popular tourist destination, allegedly by a man with a criminal record who had been deported to Mexico several times.

post_name: SF shooting shows disconnect between ICE, local police
post_message: At the root of the tragedy is the uneasy relationship between immigration authorities and local law enforcement in many parts of the country – but most notably in California.
post_description: The suspect has used three different names, worked as a laborer in four states, has several criminal convictions – including at least four drug-related felonies – and has been deported five times. Each time, he returned.

post_name: Family of Mexican boy killed by Border Patrol can sue, judge rules
post_message:
The Border Patrol originally argued that a Mexican national killed on Mexican soil is not entitled to protections of the U.S. Constitution.

A U.S. District Court judge disagreed.
post_description: NA

post_name: An unfazed Trump ups the ante on immigration
post_message: "I will win the Hispanic vote because I'm going to create jobs. I'm going to take them away from China," said an unrelentant Donald Trump yesterday in Los Angeles.
post_description: In the weeks since he called Mexican immigrants "rapists" and criminals in his campaign announcement speech, Trump has risen in the polls. But the backlash has also been fierce.

post_name: California measure would allow work permits for farmworkers here illegally
post_message:
"We have a large population of people who came here to work, not to be any kind of a security threat to anybody," said Bryan Little, of the California Farm Bureau Association. 

"And they came to work in an industry that needs them badly."
post_description: California farmers supporting the measure said they have been waiting for Washington to act on immigration for nearly three decades.

post_name: El Chapo's escape tunnel probably cost millions
post_message: “Guzman has hired some of the best individuals that deal with mining technology, and he provides them with the resources to buy the best equipment,” said one former DEA agent. “They tailor-made the tunnel for him.”
post_description: The elaborate tunnel likely cost Mexican drug lord Joaquin “El Chapo” Guzman millions of dollars and took as long as a year to construct.

post_name: Parents look for 'some good' from daughter's slaying in San Francisco
post_message: Both parents expressed support for Fox News host Bill O’Reilly’s proposed “Kate’s Law,” which would impose a five-year federal prison term on those who return to the U.S. illegally after being deported.
post_description: The role a Mexican national that had been deported multiple times allegedly played in her death has set off a fierce debate over immigration policies.

post_name: U.S. offers aid to find fugitive 'El Chapo,' but Mexico balks, officials say
post_message: Federal law enforcement agencies have offered drone technology and U.S. agents to assist in the hunt for the escaped drug cartel leader, but so far the Mexican government has rebuffed them.
post_description: Authorities in the U.S. said that so far they have been turned away from having a large, public role in the manhunt.

post_name: After Chattanooga, U.S. Muslims face hard questions on a somber holiday
post_message: "It's not just as a Muslim. As a human being, as a Chattanoogan, as an American, the feeling is shock and disbelief.... As Americans, as fellow citizens, we shall overcome this terrible tragedy together."
post_description: They left floral dresses at home and dumped half-cooked desserts in the trash. They canceled the bouncy castle and cotton candy, opting instead for bare white plastic tables. On the happiest day on the Muslim calendar, they bowed their heads in solemn prayer.

post_name: Undocumented immigrants say Texas improperly denies birth certificates to their U.S.-born children
post_message: Children born in the U.S. are entitled by law to citizenship, regardless of the immigration status of their parents. But not so in Texas, immigrant advocates say.
post_description: “It says we need a U.S. license we don't have; a [Mexican] passport we have, but with a visa we don't have; voter ID card I have, but it expired.”

post_name: Latino deaths at hands of police draw less attention
post_message: Half the people shot by police in L.A. County are Latino, but the reaction has been muted compared to what happens in the black community.
post_description: Latinos are represented in law enforcement; families are more likely to fear immigration officers than police; and in the black community, churches can play a part in organizing protests, something the Catholic church typically does not do.

post_name: L.A. County considers new federal jails program in light of S.F. slaying
post_message:
"I'm here because of Kate Steinle's death and because I care about illegal aliens being cut loose and let out on the streets," a resident told a panel of sheriff's officials. 

"When is the next American citizen going to be murdered?"
post_description: Just how much should local law enforcement cooperate with federal immigration authorities?

post_name: Hillary Clinton's political director brings key lessons from her own (losing) campaign
post_message: When Amanda Renteria, the child of a Mexican immigrant, ran for Congress in a heavily Latino district and was defeated, it exposed the lack of strategy for Latino voters to get to the polls. Now, she's using that experience to help spearhead Hillary Clinton's unprecedented Latino outreach.
post_description: Last year, Amanda Renteria returned home to California's Central Valley to run for Congress -- and got crushed.

post_name: Kathryn Steinle's father tells Congress: Overhaul immigration laws
post_message: Anti-immigration activists have seized on Steinle’s death as an example of the need for more stringent enforcement of immigration laws.
post_description: The father of the woman shot to death on a San Francisco pier, allegedly by a man deported five times to Mexico, urged lawmakers to overhaul immigration laws.

post_name: Legislator vows to seek more healthcare coverage for immigrants
post_message: Children who entered the country illegally are eligible for medical coverage, but a Legislator hopes to expand coverage to everyone who entered California illegally.
post_description: Healthcare advocates in California this year successfully pushed for medical coverage for kids who are in the country illegally. But they say they're not satisfied.

post_name: San Francisco slaying upends immigration debate in 2016 presidential race
post_message: Even supporters of San Francisco's liberal politics paused and considered its status as a "sanctuary city" that generally refuses to turn over immigrants to federal law enforcement officials.
post_description: The death scrambled the political equation overnight, throwing immigration reform advocates on the defensive and fueling the anger of hard-liners.

post_name: GOP and Latinos: On immigration, history shows the way
post_message:
Many conservatives reject an inclusive approach to immigration, but that's what won them dominance in Texas.

(via Los Angeles Times Opinion)
post_description: On the question of immigration, the Republican Party is at a crossroads.

post_name: 'Monsoon on steroids' behind Southland's humid weather
post_message: Yes, it’s hot, but the real story is the humidity.
post_description: Record-high sea temperatures off the Mexican and Central American coast are supercharging moist air.

post_name: Mother who fled Honduras 'to escape abuse, mistreatment' says 'it's the same' in U.S.
post_message: “I thought I came to this country to escape abuse, mistreatment and disrespect. But it's the same here.”
post_description: Ten immigrant women who had been held at government-contracted family detention centers filed complaints with the Department of Homeland Security on Thursday alleging that they and their children had received substandard medical care at the facilities.

post_name: How a transgender man tries to honor his Muslim faith
post_message: Perhaps no identity in Islam is harder, Alex Bergeron thinks, than a person with female anatomy who wants to transition to life as a man.
post_description: He walked unsteadily across the tattered green carpet inside the mosque. Out of habit, he stepped for a moment toward the women's section. Then he made his way to the front, where the men pray.

post_name: Salma Hayek on Donald Trump's immigration stance: 'I'm not dumb, so I see through the manipulation'
post_message: "We have something to learn from this. That is that the educated people or the people with great human values have to wake up, because they are under the illusion that most of this country is like them and sometimes they don't even go to vote."
post_description: Hayek, who  has long been outspoken about women's rights and politics, chatted about the rising activism among women in Hollywood.

post_name: Immigrants object to growing use of ankle monitors after detention
post_message:
ICE officials say ankle monitors are used "on a case-by-case basis with a priority for detention of serious criminal offenders and other individuals who pose a significant threat to public safety."

But immigrant advocates argue that many detainees are coerced into wearing them.
post_description: Immigrants, who call the monitors "grilletes," or shackles, complain that they are uncomfortable, inconvenient and carry a stigma.

post_name: India's planned resettlement of Hindus in Kashmir Valley won't be smooth
post_message:
"We need to create an atmosphere of peace and normality here before we think of re-assimilating Pandits," said the editor of a local newspaper. 

"And that can only happen if the government engages with Pakistan and the discontented separatist groups. At the moment, there is a total deadlock."
post_description: Many Muslims in the valley don't consider themselves part of India.

post_name: Little Tokyo monument honors Japanese immigrant activist Sei Fujii
post_message: Fujii worked for more than four decades to overturn racially discriminatory laws that prohibited Japanese residents and their descendants from participating fully in the American dream.
post_description: The 8-foot-tall, galvanized steel monument to Fujii is in the form of a lantern like those found in his home village.

post_name: Immigrants' low-paid work in detention centers called voluntary but unfair
post_message: “We have a name for locking people up and forcing them to do real work without wages. It's called slavery.” -- ACLU attorney
post_description: Unauthorized immigrants at family and other detention centers are paid $1 to $3 a day through the detainee voluntary work program.

post_name: 2 immigrants in U.S. illegally are named to Huntington Park commissions
post_message: In a first for California, undocumented immigrants get a seat in city government.
post_description: Julian Zatarain always assumed the doors of City Hall were closed to him because he is here illegally, arriving from Sinaloa in 2007 when he was 13.

post_name: Latinos' rising fortunes are epitomized in Downey, the 'Mexican Beverly Hills'
post_message: It's the classic American story of moving up — and proving it.
post_description: "You work your way in here," said Gilbert Alarcon, 49. "We moved up the ladder, from Bell to South Gate and Downey. We never looked back."

post_name: Latest complaint on family detention: Few Spanish-speaking staffers
post_message: There's a basic problem at family detention centers: many of the staffers don't speak Spanish.
post_description: This year, Olivia Lopez was called in to translate for an inconsolable Central American mother held at a detention center with other immigrant families.

post_name: In his hometown, fugitive Mexican drug lord 'El Chapo' is a hero to many
post_message: El Chapo has a Robin Hood-like reputation, and in his hometown, you can buy hats featuring his image.
post_description: Guzman's criminal enterprises have helped provide income for many of the people in the mountains who make a living producing poppies and marijuana for his cartel.

post_name: Border fences are succeeding -- in keeping migrants in U.S.
post_message:
This is probably not what advocates of stronger border security had in mind.

(via Los Angeles Times Opinion)
post_description: In the first Republican presidential debate, Donald Trump swore he'd build a wall to keep out Mexican migrants and his GOP rivals lined up to assure voters that they would “secure the border.” What these aspiring candidates neglected to mention is that the United States has alrea…

post_name: California just banned this word for immigrants
post_message: California's labor laws will no longer include a term many immigrants see as outdated and derogatory.
post_description: Continuing his push for change on immigration issues, Gov. Jerry Brown signed a trio of measures Monday, including one removing a word from the legal code seen as a derogatory description of those not born in the U.S.

post_name: Without immigration reform, California citizenship will have to do
post_message: It started with in-state tuition. Then came driver's licenses, new rules designed to limit deportations and state-funded healthcare for children.
post_description: "[The state] doesn't have the luxury of being ideological.... The undocumented are not going anywhere," said Mike Madrid, a Republican strategist.

post_name: The Border Patrol has launched a recruitment effort for female agents
post_message: When dealing with immigrant mothers and families, a female Border Patrol agent said, "the perception is we're more natural, we put people at ease."
post_description: Border Patrol Agent Erica Sanchez is a rarity in the Border Patrol. Just 5% of the agency's 21,000 agents nationwide are women.

post_name: Donald Trump wants a 'permanent border wall,' and he wants immigrants to pay for it
post_message: Donald Trump has big plans for battling illegal immigration.
post_description: Donald Trump has been stirring up passions with his heated rhetoric on immigration for weeks, so he finally outlined a platform Sunday.

post_name: As immigration backlog surges, some overwhelmed judges retire
post_message: U.S. immigration judges are being increasingly overworked – and half of them are eligible to retire this fiscal year.
post_description: Immigration judges face a massive backlog of more than 450,000 cases – a backlog that has more than doubled during the last decade.

post_name: Young immigrants placed in sponsor homes are at risk of abuse, experts say
post_message: Th federal government's system to place youths with relatives and other "sponsors" does so without the same levels of screening and follow-up found in state and local foster-care agencies.
post_description: The incidents underscore what critics say is a haphazard system that frees children from government custody but leaves them vulnerable to neglect and abuse.

post_name: This is what Pope Francis said to Congress this morning
post_message:
We pulled out the best for you. Here's what the pope had to say to Congress on:

INEQUALITY
“A political society endures when it seeks, as a vocation, to satisfy common needs by stimulating the growth of all its members, especially those in situations of greater vulnerability or risk.”

IMMIGRATION
“We, the people of this continent, are not fearful of foreigners, because most of us were once foreigners. I say this to you as the son of immigrants, knowing that so many of you are also descended from immigrants.”

“On this continent, too, thousands of persons are led to travel north in search of a better life for themselves and for their loved ones, in search of greater opportunities. Is this not what we want for our own children? We must not be taken aback by their numbers, but rather view them as persons, seeing their faces and listening to their stories, trying to respond as best we can to their situation.”

DEATH PENALTY
“Recently my brother bishops here in the United States renewed their call for the abolition of the death penalty. Not only do I support them, but I also offer encouragement to all those who are convinced that a just and necessary punishment must never exclude the dimension of hope and the goal of rehabilitation.”

ARMS TRADE
“Why are deadly weapons being sold to those who plan to inflict untold suffering on individuals and society? Sadly, the answer, as we all know, is simply for money: money that is drenched in blood, often innocent blood. In the face of this shameful and culpable silence, it is our duty to confront the problem and to stop the arms trade.”

FAMILY
“I cannot hide my concern for the family, which is threatened, perhaps as never before, from within and without. Fundamental relationships are being called into question, as is the very basis of marriage and the family. I can only reiterate the importance and, above all, the richness and the beauty of family life.”

POLITICS
“A good political leader is one who, with the interests of all in mind, seizes the moment in a spirit of openness and pragmatism. A good political leader always opts to initiate processes rather than possessing spaces.”
post_description: Pope Francis' prepared remarks to the U.S. Congress.

post_name: Ignoring the slaughter in Nigeria
post_message:
Muslim terrorists killed 17 people in Paris earlier this month after storming the satirical weekly Charlie Hebdo. At the same time, Muslim terrorists who call themselves Boko Haram were killing an estimated 2,000 people in two Nigerian villages.

Guess which catastrophe drew more of the world's attention?
post_description: Why the difference? One answer, as real estate agents like to say: location, location, location. You don't have to be African to be widely ignored by people who live far away from you.

post_name: Chicago child of immigrants takes on 'near-impossible' task in Ukraine
post_message:
On a gusty spring day in 1986, Natalie Jaresko asked 500 Chicagoans gathered at Daley Plaza to pray for the victims of Chernobyl in Ukraine, site of the world's worst nuclear accident.

Nearly three decades later, the child of Chicago's close-knit Ukrainian-American community responded to another cry for help from a besieged Ukraine, accepting an appointment as its finance minister late last year.

More Global City Chicago coverage: http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/globalcity/

cc Sts. Volodymyr and Olha Ukrainian Catholic Church Orange Wave Ukrainian Independent Radio Buro247 Ukraine Women's Association for the Defense of Four Freedoms for Ukraine
post_description: The daughter of Ukrainian immigrants, Jaresko grew up in west suburban Wood Dale, and later Chicago's Ukrainian Village neighborhood.

post_name: Homaro Cantu brewery is called Crooked Fork
post_message:
Last August, Homaro Cantu announced that his brewery/brewpub had a name, Crooked Fork, but it has yet to open. What's with the  name? Cantu chose it based on a public vote of 12 names, all of which included the word "Fork."

In 2014, Tribune reporter Josh Noel wrote more about it and why Cantu decided to jump into brewing in the first place.
post_description: Cantu had said Crooked Fork Brewing, at 4419 W. Montrose Ave., will also be a brew pub, serving Mexican food inspired by his grandmother's cooking.

post_name: Chicago fugitive in 2009 fatal hit-run extradited from Mexico, faces trial
post_message:
This week, Mexican and U.S. authorities finally succeeded in getting Carlos Castillo extradited to Chicago, where he awaits trial for the 2009 accident that killed 25-year-old Rachel Gilliam.

Reporters found and interviewed Castillo in Mexico as part of the Tribune's "Fugitives from Justice" series, which documented how thousands of suspects flee across a U.S. border to evade trial on charges of murder, rape and other felonies.

After the story was published, Mexican officials ultimately determined that Castillo had "obstructed justice" — an extraditable offense — by fleeing the scene of the fatal accident.
post_description: Carlos Castillo talked about the night a fatal hit-and-run accident killed a promising DePaul University student and sent him on the run from Chicago.

post_message:
Chipotle Mexican Grill on Monday became the first large U.S. restaurant chain to declare it would not use any genetically engineered ingredients in its menu offerings.

But genetic engineering, like the science behind vaccines and climate change, is easy to misunderstand.
post_description: Let's unpack this burrito bowl.

post_name: Pilsen priest removed for inappropriate relationship with woman
post_message: A prominent Roman Catholic priest in Pilsen has been removed from his ministry after the Archdiocese of Chicago received an allegation from an adult woman of an inappropriate relationship.
post_description: The Rev. Brendan Curran, a Dominican priest, well-known immigration activist and longtime pastor of St. Pius V Catholic Church, acknowledged the relationship happened a number of years ago and apologized.

post_name: Rev. Curran may face long road back to pulpit after breaking chastity vow
post_message: Experts say situations like Rev. Brendan Curran's are rare. There are often measures in place to help keep priests faithful. When a priest does go astray, it can be a slow and arduous climb back to ministry.
post_description: Rev. Curran, a prominent Catholic priest in Pilsen and well-known immigration activist, was removed from his ministry last week.

post_name: A dad's influence: How the Flores twins learned the drug trade at home
post_message:
Margarito Flores Sr. had already been convicted of smuggling people into the country, and in an undercover sting in March 1981, he was caught selling 11 pounds of heroin to an undercover federal agent in front of the family home.

Three decades later, Flores' twin sons made international news for secretly recording notorious Sinaloa cartel boss Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman after the brothers' indictment for running what turned out to be their own billion-dollar drug enterprise. The stunning undercover federal operation has been called the most significant drug investigation in Chicago history.
post_description: Margarito Flores Sr. was by all appearances living an immigrant's dream in 1981. A father of five, he drove a forklift at Brach's candy factory and had a new Chevrolet station wagon parked in front of his home in the heart of Chicago's Little Village neighborhood.

post_name: When cheap laughs cost too much
post_message: Some people unfortunately think that the best way to respond to the intolerance of Muslim fanatics is to insult all Muslims, writes columnist Clarence Page.
post_description: Most Muslims quite sensibly ignored the stunt. But when you bait enough people, somebody will rise to the bait.

post_name: Suburban senior day cares cater to dramatic ethnic population growth
post_message: Without public transportation to get around or language skills to communicate in their suburban surroundings, many non-English speaking seniors — feeling isolated and lost — have turned to adult day care service providers that cater to immigrant communities.
post_description: Each weekday, in an unremarkable office park in suburban Wheeling , a 13,500-square-foot space transforms into a bustling celebration of Eastern European countries.

post_name: Rick Bayless has a new beer ... and a new brewery
post_message: La Guardia will be a beer brewed with hominy, epazote, lime peel and coriander, and will be the flagship beer tapped at Cruz Blanca, the forthcoming West Loop brewery of Chicago-Mexican food el presidente Rick Bayless.
post_description: Details are still getting ironed out, but the brewery will include a tasting room, food service, a growler program and the sale of large format bottles.

post_name: Seattle couple wills their entire $847K estate to U.S. government
post_message:
The Petraseks, an immigrant couple, left $847,000 to the United States. 

Peter Petrasek was a WWII refugee. He wanted to make a statement about how much it meant to him to be an American citizen.
post_description: Americans often go to great lengths to keep the government off their assets.

post_name: U.S. Supreme Court to decide whether 'one person, one vote' includes non-citizens
post_message: The Supreme Court said Tuesday that it will hear a Texas case to decide whether voting districts should continue to be drawn by using census data on total population -- including immigrants who are in the United States both legally and illegally -- or by counting only citizens who are eligible to vote, as conservative challengers are now seeking.
post_description: For 50 years the “one person, one vote” principle has been used to try to equally distribute political power.

post_name: Northwestern Muslim chaplain claims discrimination on United flight
post_message: The #UnitedforTahera campaign was sparked after a Muslim chaplain at Northwestern University was denied an unopened can of diet soda by a flight attendant while flying from Chicago to Washington, D.C.
post_description: Tahera Ahmad said a flight attendant denied her an unopened can of diet soda Friday because she "may use it as a weapon."

post_name: Northwestern chaplain happy for support after United flight attendant insult
post_message:
It started with a Facebook post, led to a trending hashtag on Twitter and then made international headlines.

The fracas over the way a flight attendant insulted Northwestern University chaplain Tahera Ahmad because she was wearing a traditional Muslim headscarf culminated Wednesday with an apology from United Airlines and the company's promise that the attendant for Shuttle America will not work on United express flights until she has undergone more training.

'This has really gotten people to talk and to think,' said Ahmad.
post_description: "It's indicative of something much deeper happening in our country right now," Ahmad, 31, said.

post_name: Brian Enyart, Jennifer Jones opening Mexican restaurant in Logan Square
post_message: You could argue that Bryan Enyart, the former chef de cuisine at Frontera Grill and Topolobampo, never really left town. And yet, he's back.
post_description: Bryan Enyart and his wife, Jennifer Jones (pastry chef for Frontera and Topolo), have signed a lease on a Logan Square space that will open this fall as Dos Urban Cantina.

post_name: 5 Rabbit brewery pulls beer from Trump Hotel bar
post_message: Donald Trump had a harsh message for Mexican immigrants while announcing his bid for the presidency two weeks ago. Now, 5 Rabbit Cerveceria has a harsh message for Trump.
post_description: "We shouldn’t be having this conversation," Araya said. "We shouldn’t have to be proving a point."

post_name: Macy's dumps Trump clothing line in response to comments
post_message: Macy's said in a statement that the retailer is disappointed and distressed by Trump's remarks and will end its relationship with him.
post_description: Macy's is the latest company to end its relationship with Donald Trump as the fallout from the real estate mogul's remarks about Mexican immigrants continues.

post_name: Our nation's immigrant story trumps hate
post_message: For all its faults, America is still a land where hard workers, tireless strivers and big dreamers can build a better life. And that is why so many people want to come here.
post_description: It's time once again for our annual family picnic. I can hardly wait to see my fun-loving, horseshoe-tossing, force-feeding, nonstop hugging, picture-taking relatives.

post_name: 10 things you might not know about patriots
post_message: As we mark Independence Day, let's wave the flag for some little-known facts about patriots.
post_description: These are tough times for patriotism. In March, a Georgia man who described himself as a "patriot" was charged with planting a bomb in the hope that Muslims would be blamed. And what NFL team has the worst reputation for cheating? The Patriots. As we mark Independence Day, let's wave the f…

post_name: Trump and the myth of immigrant crime
post_message: If Trump wants to avoid rapists, here's some advice from Steve Chapman: Head for areas with lots of residents who were born in Mexico.
post_description: Donald Trump sees himself as a martyr to the truth.

post_name: It's a no-brainer: Only citizens should vote, period
post_message:
John Kass says he has a radical idea.

That in order to vote in elections in the United States, you must be a citizen of the United States.

Thoughts?
post_description: Though he's sitting in the sanctuary city of Chicago, far from the angry immigration debates in Washington, D.C., and San Francisco, John Kass has a radical idea.

post_name: A Chicago family hurt by sanctuary city politics
post_message:
Some of you may remember a few columns John Kass wrote back in 2012 about William "Dennis" McCann. On June 8, 2011, William McCann was walking across Kedzie Avenue in the Logan Square neighborhood when he was struck by a black Dodge Neon driven by an alleged drunken driver.

Kass says you could say the testimony Tuesday before the Senate Judiciary Committee on violence committed by immigrants here illegally was heartbreaking.

"There was a lot of emotion in there," Brian McCann, William's brother, told him over the phone after his testimony.
post_description: the killings are made all the worse by federal immigration law that is ignored so Democratic Party pols can hustle Latino votes through so-called sanctuary city policies.

post_name: Trump sign a stop on one guide's Chicago disaster tour
post_message:
With all the news about Donald Trump lately, Tribune Architecture critic Blair Kamin has received this question:

Is now the time for Mayor Rahm Emanuel to force the bloviating, bombastic New Yorker to take down the ugly sign on his Chicago riverfront tower?

Sorry, Chicago. Blair says forget it. And he sums it up this way:

No legal Clearasil can remove Trump's self-inflicted urban acne.
post_description: Prompted by Donald Trump 's rants about Mexican immigrants and his comments questioning Sen. John McCain 's status as a war hero, readers have emailed me with a question:

post_name: Commentary: The GOP's woman problem goes beyond Trump
post_message: Republican candidates have tried to discuss the economy, but they've been drowned out by arguments over abortion, immigration and Trump.
post_description: After Mitt Romney lost the 2012 presidential election, Republican Party Chairman Reince Priebus commissioned an autopsy to determine what had gone wrong. High on the list: a yawning gender gap. Romney won the votes of most men but lost among female voters by 11 percentage points; among single women,…

post_name: Trump: Deport children of immigrants living illegally in U.S.
post_message:
Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump wants to deny citizenship to the babies of immigrants living in the U.S. illegally as part of an immigration plan that emphasizes border security and deportation for millions.

What are your thoughts?
post_description: He would also rescind Obama administration executive orders on immigration.

post_name: George Zimmerman selling Confederate flag painting at 'Muslim free' gun store
post_message:
Trending right now:

George Zimmerman selling Confederate flag paintings at 'Muslim free' gun store in Florida.
post_description: George Zimmerman is now selling prints of his Confederate flag painting at a gun store that made headlines earlier this year.

post_name: For Mexicans, the Donald Trump candidacy is getting scarier
post_message:
Mexicans are getting nervous.

The longer Donald Trump floats atop the polls, the more Donald Trump has started to make people in Mexico feel a bit queasy.
post_description: If Donald Trump were president, he would have Mexico pay to build a wall along its 2,000-mile border to keep itself out.

post_name: Birthright citizenship debate a distraction, GOP rivals say
post_message: The debate over a controversial proposal to end the automatic granting of citizenship to children of people in the U.S. illegally is a distraction from what the nation really needs to do to stem the tide of illegal immigration.
post_description: "Let's talk about the things that we can fix and fix simply without having to amend the Constitution."

post_name: A white separatist's anti-immigration stance
post_message:
Richard Spencer dreams of whites one day inhabiting a separate place -- "a big European empire."

Our Dawn Turner talked to the 37-year-old University of Chicago grad about what it means to be a white separatist.
post_description: He vehemently opposes immigration, feels the white race will soon be a "hated minority" in America, and supports Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump even though he never imagined he would.

post_name: How it feels when white people shame your culture's food — then make it trendy
post_message:
The lengths to which immigrant families have gone to hide the way we feed ourselves break my heart. But something has changed.

In cities big and small, Asian dishes and flavors have become popular among foodies at chic eateries. Foods that were once considered too strong, too spicy, too smelly or too obviously-from-an-animal for my white friends are now on Restaurant Week menus nationwide.
post_description: When I'm craving comfort food, I'll take my father's ngau lam over mac and cheese any day.

post_name: Commentary: Photo of drowned Syrian toddler may finally open world's eyes to realities of brutal war
post_message:
"How many photos of dead Syrian children show up on social media every day? Don't people know what has been happening in Syria?

And then it occurred to me — perhaps they don't."
post_description: He looks as though he is asleep — perhaps taking a nap before running off to play with his friends. But he's not asleep. He's dead. He died because of a war the world can't or won't solve and immigration policies that say: We don't care.

post_name: Muslim flight attendant suspended after refusing to serve alcohol files complaint
post_message:
A Muslim flight attendant says she was suspended by ExpressJet because of her refusal to serve alcohol due to her religious beliefs.

Her attorney says the Atlanta-based airline initially agreed to a religious accommodation, telling her another flight attendant could handle passenger requests for alcohol.
post_description: Charee Stanley, 40, filed a discrimination complaint with the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission in Detroit last week.

post_name: 15 things to do with the kids, Sept. 7-13
post_message: From stingrays to Mexican Independence Day celebrations, here are our best bets for kid-friendly fun in Chicago and the suburbs.
post_description: Back-to-school doesn't mean you and the kids can't have fun. Here are some things to do.

post_name: The pain of growing up Muslim in post-9/11 America
post_message:
"I was 10 when I first heard the word terrorist. I was 11 when I was first called it," Mahjabeen Syed writes.

"When I talk about America, I say 'we' because I am American-born and consider myself to be American. But somewhere between that time of mourning and chaos and now, 'we' became an 'other.'"
post_description: "Keep your head low." My mother said those words to me sometime after Sept. 11, 2001. It left me baffled and confused at the age of 10. What did my being Muslim have to do with an attack that turned buildings into ash and rubble more than 700 miles away?

post_name: Muslim boy arrested after homemade clock mistaken for bomb in Texas school
post_message:
Police detained a 14-year-old Muslim boy who enjoys engineering after a teacher at his Texas high school decided that a homemade clock he proudly brought to class looked like a bomb, according to school and police officials.

Irving police Chief Larry Boyd later said Ahmed Mohamed will not be charged with possessing a hoax bomb because there's no evidence that he meant to cause any harm. Boyd says the clock that Ahmed built looked "suspicious in nature."

President Obama also weighed in, tweeting this:

@POTUS
Cool clock, Ahmed. Want to bring it to the White House? We should inspire more kids like you to like science. It's what makes America great.
post_description: Ahmed's family says high school administrators suspended the teenager for three days after he showed the clock to teachers.

post_name: Debate showed GOP wants to stay white, male and old
post_message:
The problem Dawn M. Turner had with Wednesday night's marathon three-hour-long Republican presidential debate -- well, one of the problems -- was that there were few references, few indicators that the Grand Old Party wants to speak to people of color or young people. Or, for that matter, that it wants to remain anything but overwhelmingly white and male and old.

Do you agree?
post_description: Politicians speak to us, to our interests. Sometimes it's pretty overt -- as in the way Donald Trump has connected with the Republican Party's staunchly anti-immigration faction.

post_name: Ben Carson: Muslims should not be elected president
post_message: Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson, a devout Christian, says a president's faith should matter to voters if it runs counter to the values and principles of America.
post_description: Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson says Islam is antithetical to the Constitution, and he doesn't believe that a Muslim should be elected president.

post_name: GOP finds diversity in offending voters
post_message: "Donald Trump has been in charge of insulting Latinos. The co-chairs of the Gay and Lesbian Denigration Team are Mike Huckabee and Ted Cruz. And now retired neurosurgeon Ben Carson has stepped in to make sure Muslims don't feel under-disparaged."
post_description: Let's talk about the elephant in the room. It's a Republican, and he thinks you guys are being a little unreasonable.

post_name: Muslim student withdraws from school that suspended him over clock
post_message:
Ahmed Mohamed -- the 14-year-old Muslim student who got in trouble over a homemade clock -- has withdrawn from his suburban Dallas high school.

Mohamed's father, Mohamed El-Hassan Mohamed, said he withdrew all his children from their Irving Independent School District schools, and isn't quite sure where to send them next.
post_description: "Ahmed said, 'I don't want to go to MacArthur,'" Ahmed's father told The Dallas Morning News. "These kids aren't going to be happy there."

post_name: At least 717 pilgrims killed in hajj stampede
post_message: At least 717 people were killed and hundreds more injured in a stampede Thursday on the outskirts of Mecca, the deadliest tragedy to strike the annual hajj pilgrimage in more than two decades.
post_description: It was the second major disaster during this year's hajj season, raising questions about the adequacy of measures put in place by Saudi authorities to ensure the safety of the roughly 2 million Muslims taking part.

post_name: In historic address, Pope Francis urges Congress to embrace migrants
post_message:
Standing before a rapt Congress, Pope Francis issued a ringing call to action on behalf of immigrants Thursday, urging lawmakers to embrace "the stranger in our midst" as he became the first pontiff in history to address a joint meeting of the legislators.

Did you watch?
post_description: Thursday's speech was the latest highlight for the pope's whirlwind three-day visit to Washington, the first stop on a three-city U.S. tour.

post_name: Chicago priest removed for inappropriate adult relationship
post_message: A popular Roman Catholic priest who attended the pope's address to Congress last month has been removed from ministry because of an "inappropriate relationship with an adult man," the Chicago Archdiocese announced Sunday.
post_description: "As a human being I am not perfect, but as a priest my priority has always been the work of the Gospel and the struggle for immigrants and the most vulnerable," Mercado said in a statement.

post_name: Constellation Brands unveils first craft beer, with Rick Bayless
post_message: Constellation Brands is jumping into the craft beer game, teaming up with Chicago celebrity chef Rick Bayless for a line of Mexican-inspired beers.
post_description: Life is good these days for Constellation Brands, as American beer drinkers have a seemingly unquenchable thirst for Mexican beers.

post_name: Mexico: Drug lord El Chapo injured in recent evasion of capture
post_message: Neighbors described the Mexican military's search for El Chapo: "All I could hear was shooting."
post_description: Martha Marbella was getting ready to prepare dinner for her three children one evening last week when a plane flew over their home in the village of El Verano, deep in the Sierra Madre.

post_name: Debate lays bare a GOP dividing line
post_message: The two-hour debate spotlighted the rift between the outsider candidates and establishment governors.
post_description: The leading Republican presidential candidates clashed sharply over immigration policy, military spending, and other intractable and emotional issues in a debate here Tuesday night, bringing into sharp relief the party's fault line between rigid conservatism and mainstream practicality.

post_name: Data: Unaccompanied immigrant children in the U.S.
post_message: Chicago Tribune Graphics made a statistical snapshot of the unaccompanied immigrant children in the United States.
post_description:
Thousands of unaccompanied children flooded across the southwest border of the United States and caused a humanitarian crisis in 2014. 

Since then, these children have made their way through an overwhelmed immigration court system.

post_name: Honduran teen, who entered U.S. as unaccompanied child, awaits word on fate
post_message:
Maryori Urbina-Contreras, 15, risked everything when she left Honduras and traveled alone across more than 1,500 miles, in a desperate attempt to escape the violence of her homeland and reunite with her mother.

Hercase has become one of hundreds of thousands caught in the nation's overwhelmed immigration court system.
post_description: On the morning of her immigration court hearing, 15-year-old Maryori Urbina-Contreras woke before dawn.

post_name: Muslim group calls for Spirit apology after travelers pulled from plane
post_message:
A leading Muslim group is calling on Spirit Airlines to apologize after four people were removed from a Chicago-bound flight in Baltimore when a woman complained about a man, possibly of Middle Eastern descent, who was watching a news report on his phone.

The four were later released without any charges, but they missed their flight to O'Hare.

"Watching news on your smartphone has never qualified as a security threat or as suspicious behavior ... That this was escalated into an ordeal seems to be exclusively due to the passenger's perceived ethnicity," the Council on American Islamic Relations said in a statement.
post_description: “We call on Spirit Airlines to issue a public apology to all four passengers and take steps to ensure this does not happen again."

post_name: Americans see a government of, by and for the rich
post_message: Democrats and republicans don't see eye to eye on everything, but one thing they agree on is that the government tends to the interests of the wealthy.
post_description: At first glance — and second, and third — Americans look to be marching off in two diametrically opposed directions. On immigration, Democrats and Republicans could not have more contrasting views; cities, which have become distinctly progressive bas

post_name: For the first majority-Muslim U.S. city, residents tense about its future
post_message:
In many ways, Hamtramck, Mich., is a microcosm of the fears gripping parts of the country since the Islamic State's attacks on Paris: The influx of Muslims here has profoundly unsettled some residents of the town long known for its love of dancing, beer, paczki pastries and the pope.

Earlier this month, the blue-collar city that has been home to Polish Catholic immigrants and their descendants for more than a century became what demographers think is the first jurisdiction in the nation to elect a majority-Muslim council.
post_description: Karen Majewski was in such high demand in her vintage shop on a recent Saturday afternoon that a store employee threw up her hands when yet another visitor came in to chat. Everyone wanted to talk to the mayor about the big political news.

post_name: Man who led armed protest at Texas mosque publishes list of Muslims' home addresses
post_message: Days after organizing an armed protest outside the Islamic Center of Irving, Texas, the spokesman for a local anti-Islam group published the names and addresses "of every Muslim and Muslim sympathizer."
post_description: Days after organizing an armed protest outside the Islamic Center of Irving, Texas, the spokesman for a local anti-Islam group published the names and addresses "of every Muslim and Muslim sympathizer that stood up for ... Sharia tribunals in Irving," according to the Dallas Morning News .

post_name: San Bernardino shooting suspects seemed to be living the 'American Dream'
post_message:
Authorities identified the dead suspects as Syed Rizwan Farook, 28, and Tashfeen Malik, 27. A family member said they had been married for two years and had a 6-month-old daughter.

Farook was a U.S. citizen, born in Illinois, and a five-year employee of the government agency holding the holiday banquet where the shooting took place. His co-workers said Farook, a Muslim, had traveled in recent years to the Middle East.
post_description: Masked assailants armed with assault rifles opened fire on a holiday banquet for county employees in San Bernardino, Calif. on Wednesday, killing 14 people.

post_name: Donald Trump calls for 'complete shutdown' of Muslims entering U.S.
post_message: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said that his proposal comes in response to the level of hatred among "large segments of the Muslim population" toward Americans.
post_description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump says he is calling for a "complete and total shutdown" on Muslims entering the United States.

post_name: Chipotle E. coli case in Illinois: Officials mum on details
post_message: The Illinois Department of Public Health said Monday it is working with local officials to investigate an E. coli case linked to Chipotle Mexican Grill's multistate outbreak, but it won't release details about the restaurant or the person infected.
post_description: A sample of the E. coli from the infected person is undergoing DNA testing — considered the best evidence in linking an illness to an outbreak, said Nirav Shah the department's director.

post_name: 'Crazy man': Muslims respond to Donald Trump's 'shutdown' plan
post_message: "I didn't know Donald Trump was fluent in Nazi."
