post_message: Without naming names, House Speaker Paul Ryan said that a certain politician's recent comments on Muslims aren't indicative of the entire Republican party's beliefs.
post_description: House Speaker Paul Ryan on Tuesday dismissed Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's comments on Muslims, saying such views are "not what this party stands for and more importantly it's not what this country stands for."

post_name: For Trump Tower residents, association with Trump is 'embarrassing'
post_message: In the wake of outrage over Donald Trump's call Monday for a complete halt to Muslims entering the U.S., many residents told the Tribune that they are uneasy admitting where they live.
post_description: Donald Trump would surely approve of residents' reviews of life at Chicago's Trump International Hotel & Tower. But some residents of the gleaming riverfront skyscraper don't seem to approve so much of him.

post_name: Analysis: It's not chaos. It's Trump's campaign strategy
post_message: While it may seem like a lurching, chaotic campaign, Donald Trump is, for the most part, a disciplined and methodical candidate, according to a Washington Post review of the businessman's speeches, interviews and thousands of tweets and retweets over the past six months.
post_description: He referred to Mexicans as "rapists," questioned Sen. John McCain's status as a war hero, ridiculed the physical appearance of his opponents, falsely claimed that "thousands" in New Jersey cheered as the World Trade Center fell and, this week, called

post_name: Column: Contrast Donald Trump, Rahm Emanuel: Why you might be sorry for saying 'Sorry'
post_message: Apologies are a form of public theater, but only occasionally they can be effective and meaningful.
post_description: So Donald Trump is bickering with yet another nation that has sent immigrants to this country.

post_name: Teacher asks teenage Muslim student if she is carrying bomb in backpack
post_message:
A Georgia middle school teacher asked a Muslim student if she was carrying a bomb in her backpack.

While a spokeswoman said "the remark was not appropriate," school officials "don't believe it was made with ill intent."

So readers, we ask you ... is it ever appropriate?
post_description: The father of a Muslim middle school student says a teacher asked his daughter if she was carrying a bomb in her backpack.

post_name: Wheaton College suspends Christian professor who wore a hijab
post_message:
Wheaton College suspends tenured political science professor Larycia Hawkins, who wore a hijab to show support for Muslims -- but for her explanation, not the act.

"I stand in religious solidarity with Muslims because they, like me, a Christian, are people of the book," she posted on Facebook.
post_description: A tenured Wheaton College professor who, as part of her Christian Advent devotion, donned a traditional headscarf to show solidarity with Muslims has been placed on administrative leave.

post_name: Suspended Wheaton College professor seeks reconciliation with leaders
post_message: "I am committed to engaging in dialogue with appropriate colleagues at Wheaton toward the goal of reaching reconciliation so that I may continue to live out my vocation as a Christian scholar and teacher with my faculty colleagues and my remarkable students," Larycia Hawkins said in a statement Thursday.
post_description: A Wheaton College professor suspended for saying Muslims and Christians worship the same God said Thursday she has submitted a theological statement requested by school administrators and now will focus on grading final exams and praying.

post_name: Column: Religious bigotry is a dangerous weapon
post_message: Turns out, Donald J. Trump doesn't have a patent on anti-Muslim bigotry.
post_description: We are used to Trump's coalition of anti-Muslim crusaders spewing hatred and painting anyone who follows Islam as a potential terrorist.

post_name: Talks break down between Wheaton College, suspended professor
post_message: The Wheaton College professor suspended for saying Muslims and Christians worship the same God declared Tuesday that she would fight efforts by the college to force her out.
post_description: Larycia Hawkins said she will not accept a proposal offered by the college to teach again next fall that would revoke her tenure for at least two years. She said the college appears to be moving toward termination, meanwhile she has rejected suggesti

post_name: To American Muslim kids: Stay strong amid Islamophobic rhetoric
post_message:
Chicago Tribune reporter Marwa Eltagouri is Muslim, and she has an important message for American Muslim kids:

"I ask you to stand up for our faith. Educate your non-Muslim friends on the intricacies of Islam and its emphasis on thankfulness, humbleness and protecting humanity. Prove those who denounce Islam wrong with your achievements and your generosity and the love you have for your country."
post_description: Muslim children: If you don't educate your peers amid Islamophobia, who will?

post_name: On Muslims, Democrats find an unlikely ally: George W. Bush
post_message: As Hillary Clinton put it, "George W. Bush was right."
post_description: Taunted by Republicans to declare war on "radical Islamic terrorism" Democrats are turning to an unlikely ally: George W. Bush.

post_name: Americans are still attacking Sikhs because they think they're Muslims
post_message: "Hate violence has ebbed and flowed throughout our history in America, but being targets of racism is nothing new. It's part of our history here."
post_description: The bearded man in the blue turban was attacked before dawn on Saturday morning, while waiting for a ride to work.

post_name: Muslim, Christian Scouts come together to foster friendship, understanding
post_message:
A beautiful event unfolded recently at the Islamic Center of Naperville, where two Girl Scout groups met for an interfaith event that paved the way for a lifetime of understanding and friendship.

We should all be more like Girl Scouts, writes Heidi Stevens in today's Balancing Act column.
post_description: Girl Scouts Suha Khan, left, and Camryn Fox took part in an interfaith event hosted by Khan's troop at the Islamic Center of Naperville to learn about how women in different cultures embody the Girl Scout law.

post_name: Supreme Court set to make pivotal rulings on abortion, affirmative action and immigration
post_message: As the nation heads into a presidential election year, the Supreme Court is set to decide half a dozen politically charged cases in 2016 on such topics as abortion, affirmative action, contraceptives and immigration.
post_description: As the nation heads into a presidential election year, the Supreme Court is set to decide half a dozen politically charged cases in 2016 on such topics as abortion, affirmative action, contraceptives and immigration.

post_name: Donald Trump shrugs off militant recruiting video featuring his words
post_message: Donald Trump says it's no surprise extremists would try to capitalize on words of a Republican presidential front-runner.
post_description: Donald Trump is brushing off an African militant group's video that uses his comments against Muslims to attract recruits.

post_name: 15 things to do with the kids Jan. 4-10
post_message: From Winter Wonderfest to Mexican folk music, here are 15 things to do with your kids this week in Chicago and the suburbs.
post_description: From Winter Wonderfest to Mexican folk music, here are our best bests for kid-friendly fun in Chicago and the suburbs.

post_name: Wheaton College seeks to fire Christian professor over view of Islam
post_message: Wheaton College has begun the process of firing a professor who said Muslims and Christians worship the same God, the teacher confirmed Tuesday.
post_description: This week, she received word from Provost Stanton Jones that the termination process had begun.

post_name: Global City Chicago: Our future hinges on retooling schools for digital age
post_message:
Less than a year ago, 19-year-old Mario Arzate, the son of Mexican immigrants, was wiping counters, frying fish and working the cash register at a fast-food restaurant in the Blue Ridge Mountains' foothills. It was pocket-money work with a manager's job as the only hope for advancement.

Now Arzate designs sewer routes for a carpet mill and water lines for residential streets for the local utility company. The catalyst for change in his life was Dalton High School, which introduced him to computer-aided design during a series of manufacturing/ engineering classes, and helped him to line up an internship with the utility. He's going to college and wants a career in civil engineering.

Arzate may be several states removed from Chicago, but his story is one that this region may want to heed. Chicago's economy once rested on the broad shoulders of steel mills and stockyards. Today it's reinventing itself -- it's tech-driven and hungry for skilled workers at ease with the digital age.
post_description: Mario Arzate embodies the type of workforce transformation needed in Chicago and other American cities.

post_name: Drug lord 'El Chapo' recaptured, Mexican president says
post_message:
Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto announced Friday that fugitive drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman was recaptured seven months after he escaped from a maximum security prison.

An official said Guzman was apprehended after a shootout with Mexican marines.
post_description: Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto announced Friday that fugitive drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman was recaptured seven months after he escaped from a maximum security prison.

post_name: Glen Ellyn church members debate fate of Wheaton College professor
post_message: At their weekly discussion forum, 30 members of St. Mark's Episcopal Church in Glen Ellyn gathered to debate the case of Larycia Hawkins, the Wheaton College professor facing termination by the school's administration for saying Muslims and Christians worship the same God.
post_description: At their weekly discussion forum, 30 members of St. Mark's Episcopal Church in Glen Ellyn gathered Sunday to debate a topic

post_name: Syrian-born, Chicago-raised college grad heads to White House
post_message:
As a Syrian-born Muslim and Chicago area-raised activist, 23-year-old Alaa Basatneh has risked her life to help others living in war-torn Syria and yet, here at home, has endured looks of disgust and verbal attacks like "F--- you, go back to your country!" and "You are a f---ing Muslim terrorist."

The insults, looks and remarks have not deterred the recent Northeastern Illinois University graduate. In fact, her resilience landed her an invite from U.S. Rep. Mike Quigley to be a guest Tuesday for President Obama's State of the Union address.

RedEye's Leonor Vivanco reports.
post_description: Obama's speech comes at a time of polarizing debate over whether to allow or block refugees, including Syrians and Muslims, from entry into the U.S.

post_name: Immigrants in the U.S. illegally at lowest level in over a decade
post_message: The number of immigrants living in the U.S. illegally is at its lowest in more than a decade and, for the first time in years, has probably dropped below 11 million.
post_description: A new study by the Center for Migration Studies estimates that 10.9 million immigrants are living in the country without authorization. That is the lowest level since 2003 and the first time the number has dipped below 11 million since 2004.

post_name: Restaurant openings: Grassroots, Firecakes, De Noche Mexicana
post_message: The old Deleece space is now Grassroots, Firecakes brings its doughnuts to Lincoln Park and D’Noche in Logan Square gets a menu makeover a new name: De Noche Mexicana.
post_description: We've got the latest restaurant openings to whet your appetite.

post_name: Obama to visit Baltimore County mosque
post_message: Amid concerns about hostility toward Muslim Americans, President Obama will visit a Baltimore-area mosque on Wednesday.
post_description: President Barack Obama will visit a mosque in Baltimore County next week amid growing concern about hostility directed toward Muslim Americans. It will be Obama's first visit to an American mosque as president.

post_name: Man behind @Chipotle Twitter handle makes jokes, not burritos
post_message:
Charles "Chip" Clark is @Chipotle on Twitter. The burrito place is @ChipotleTweets.

Guacamole costs extra, but Clark spoke freely with Chicago Tribune Business about what happened next.
post_description: When Chipotle Mexican Grill's E. Coli outbreak was declared over Monday, it was old news to the man behind the @Chipotle Twitter handle.

post_name: Chipotle reports first sales decline on food safety crisis; criminal probe widens
post_message:
Chipotle Mexican Grill reported its first sales decline in the fourth quarter Tuesday due to a nationwide food safety crisis and said the criminal investigation in California over outbreaks has widened. During the quarter, E. coli, salmonella and norovirus were linked to illnesses at its restaurants. In total, 60 people in 14 states were sickened by E. coli linked to the chain.

If you have/had a Chipotle habit, has anything changed for you?
post_description: It said the drop in fourth-quarter net income was far less than feared.

post_name: Muslim youth fight stereotypes, suspicion
post_message:
Aasiyah Bhaiji is 13. She and her peers weren't alive for the Sept. 11 attacks on the U.S. Her 16-year-old sister, Saarah, was an infant at the time. 

But both Glenview teenagers have grown up beneath a cloud of suspicion about their faith. Classmates come to school repeating what they've heard at home or amplify tropes on social media that liken all Muslims to murderers.

And they are so far from alone. Stories like this are being told all over the Chicago area.
post_description: "People don't realize you're Muslim, so they think they can make all kinds of remarks without people judging them," said Aasiyah, who doesn't wear a head scarf.

post_name: Wheaton College reverses decision to fire professor
post_message:
Wheaton College administrator who last month called for the termination of a tenured professor for saying Muslims and Christians worship the same God has reversed his decision and apologized for acting in haste.

Wheaton Provost Stanton Jones told professors in an email Saturday night that he had turned over the decision of whether to vacate the administrative leave of their colleague Larycia Hawkins to college President Philip Ryken.
post_description: A Wheaton College administrator who last month called for the termination of a tenured professor for saying Muslims and Christians worship the same God has reversed his decision and apologized for acting in haste.

post_name: Obama's visit to U.S. mosque raised hopes -- then campaign rhetoric returned
post_message:
Dahleen Glanton thought the presidential visit to a mosque last Wednesday might ease the unfounded fears held by many Americans that most Muslims are terrorists. She hoped politicians would put their anti-Muslim attacks on ice for at least a few days to allow the president's message to sink in.

As it turned out, they couldn't even make it through the night.
post_description: After seven years in office, President Barack Obama finally visited a mosque in the United States.

post_name: Key informant against Mexican cartel to testify at Washington trial
post_message:
Eight years ago, Chicago drug traffickers Margarito and Pedro Flores risked their lives to secretly record meetings and telephone conversations with Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman and his top henchmen.

For the first time, one of the twins is scheduled to take the witness stand in the upcoming trial of Alfredo Beltran-Leyva in federal court in Washington, D.C., the Tribune has learned.
post_description: It's been almost eight years since Chicago drug traffickers Margarito and Pedro Flores made the stunning decision to cooperate against the notorious Sinaloa cartel, risking their lives to secretly record meetings and telephone conversations with Joaquin " El Chapo " Guzman and his top henc…

post_name: Wheaton College could face long-term fallout over professor controversy
post_message: The controversy over a tenured Wheaton College professor who said Christians and Muslims worship the same God has many former students concerned that the episode dealt lasting damage to the reputation of evangelical Christianity's flagship college.
post_description: The Tribune spoke with many Wheaton College alumni who said the school's handling of the dispute raised questions about what their alma mater represents.

post_name: Former Mexican president calls Donald Trump racist, compares him to Hitler
post_message:
So, about that wall Donald Trump is proposing?

When asked about Trump's assertion that he was going to get Mexico to pay for his proposed border wall, former President Vicente Fox used an explicative to make his point the country would never do so.
post_description: Former Mexican President Felipe Calderon on Saturday joined his predecessor in office in unloading on Donald Trump , calling the Republican front-runner's campaign racist and saying his discourse on immigration is fueling anti-American sentiment around the world.

post_name: In major blow to Cruz, Alabama Sen. Sessions endorses Trump
post_message: "Politicians have promised for 30 years to fix illegal immigration. Have they done it? Donald Trump will do it," Sen. Jeff Sessions, R-Ala. said at the Madison City Schools Stadium, where thousands gathered to hear Trump speak. "I've told Donald Trump this isn't a campaign, this is a movement."
post_description: Sen. Jeff Sessions, R-Ala., whose hard-line conservative stances on immigration and trade have made him a favorite of the party's base, endorsed Donald Trump's White House bid during a joint appearance here in his home state on Sunday.

post_name: Muslim child's fear: 'Is Trump going to exile us?'
post_message:
Many parents know the feeling of a child asking a difficult question they're not prepared to answer. But for many Muslim parents, those questions are increasingly fearful and focused on Donald Trump and the presidential race.

"I have kids coming in asking, 'Is Trump going to exile us?'" said Dr. Azmaira Maker, a San Diego psychologist.

Maker said questions crop up everywhere, from her office to dinner parties. An eighth-grader wanted to change his name, she recalled, calling it "a terrorist name." Another child, after seeing a campaign rally on television, asked if the family would be deported. Still others worry whether the election results will mean they can't see relatives who live abroad, such as grandparents.

"It's one thing as an adult. You hear all this hatred and maybe you can put it in context," said Ibrahim Hooper, spokesman for the national Council On American-Islamic Relations. "But imagine what it's doing to a young Muslim child."

Imagine, indeed. Why would you tell the children?
post_description: As any parent knows, best efforts to shield children from harmful, hurtful things can fall short.

post_name: Trump wants to build a wall on the U.S.-Mexico border. Can it be done?
post_message:
Donald Trump promises to build a great wall along the 2,000-mile U.S.-Mexican border and make Mexico pay for it, but it will be a difficult pledge to fulfill.

Can he do it?

Sure, a wall can be built, but it's not nearly as simple as Trump says it will be.
post_description: Donald Trump promises to build a great wall along the 2,000-mile U.S.-Mexican border and make Mexico pay for it, but it will be a difficult pledge to fulfill.

post_name: Column: Trump's Chicago rally and freedom of speech
post_message:
Donald Trump is outraged that his free-speech rights were abridged last night when the presence of thousands of opponents caused him to call off his rally at the University of Illinois at Chicago. And he has a point.

But his fondness for free expression is highly selective, writes Steve Chapman.
post_description: Rose Hamid is a middle-aged Muslim who went to a Donald Trump rally. Wearing a hijab and a T-shirt with the message, “Salam I come in peace,” she stood during his speech, silently protesting. The angry crowd began screaming abuse, and she was immedia

post_name: U.S. Olympian Ibtihaj Muhammad asked to remove headscarf for ID photo at SXSW
post_message: Ibtihaj Muhammad, a 2016 Olympic fencer and South by Southwest speaker who is Muslim, was asked to remove her hijab as she proceeded through registration at the festival Saturday afternoon.
post_description: Ibtihaj Muhammad is expected to make history this summer by being the first hijab-wearing woman to represent the U.S. in the Olympics. She will appear on a Saturday evening panel called "The New Church: Sport as Currency of American Life."

post_name: Chipotle faces no-win scenario as crisis taints every move
post_message: The company has hired a new director of food safety and says its updated protocols will reduce the risk of a new outbreak to "near zero." Still, it's not clear that customers are getting the message.
post_description: Chipotle Mexican Grill responded quickly when four of its workers called in sick last week with suspected cases of norovirus.

post_name: Want to move to Canada? Study up
post_message:
It's a little-known fact that applicants also have to pass an interview to establish whether they would make good Canadians.

In the spirit of international cooperation, we're offering the following sample questions to test your Canadian bona fides.
post_description: As Donald Trump rolls inexorably toward the Republican presidential nomination, more and more Americans are investigating the possibility of moving to Canada. While the paper application process to become a landed immigrant is fairly straightforward, it's a little-known fact that applicants also hav…

post_name: Helping monarch butterflies rule
post_message: The population of monarchs has rebounded since 2014, but there is still more work to do.
post_description: Every winter a fluttering blizzard of orange-and-black monarch butterflies settles in Mexican mountain forests after a 2,500-mile trek through the U.S. and Canada. Every spring, gardeners and butterfly enthusiasts across the Midwest cultivate milkweed plants that beckon the butterflies to alight on…

post_name: Muslim family kicked off flight demands apology from United Airlines
post_message:
A Muslim family of five from the Chicago area wants an apology from United Airlines after they were removed from a plane at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport last month.

The family's removal came after they requested an additional strap for their youngest daughter's booster seat.
post_description: A Muslim family of five from Libertyville wants an apology from United Airlines after they were removed from a plane at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport last month.

post_name: Library of Congress to stop using term 'illegal alien'
post_message:
The library will now use “noncitizens” and “unauthorized immigration” when referring to individuals and the larger phenomenon of people residing in the country illegally.

The library called the words more precise as well as less offensive.
post_description: The Library of Congress, saying a once common phrase had become offensive, announced it will no longer use “illegal aliens” as a bibliographical term.

post_name: High-rolling couple kept indentured servant, bilked taxpayers out of $45M: feds
post_message:
The young Lincolnwood couple seemed to have it all: a 5,000-square-foot McMansion, a small fleet of luxury SUVs, $1 million in Facebook stock and a housekeeper and nanny who helped raise their children while they ran a thriving home health care business.

But Richard and Maribel Tinimbang's success was built on a lie.

The feds say the couple's "nanny" was in fact little more than an indentured servant -- a Filipino immigrant whom they had forced to work on threat of deportation -- while the couple's main business was bilking taxpayers.
post_description: The Tinimbangs allegedly committed a $45 million Medicare fraud between 2008 and 2014.

post_name: Muslim family kicked off United flight still awaits resolution
post_message: The parents of a Muslim family abruptly removed from a United Airlines flight last month say the way they and their three children were treated by a flight crew at O'Hare went way beyond poor customer service. Yet three weeks later, they still have not reached a resolution with the airline.
post_description: Mohamad and Eaman Shebley of Libertyville said in an exclusive interview with the Tribune that they are still in shock over the way their family was humiliated.

post_name: Persecuted Muslim Rohingya find refuge in Chicago
post_message:
Almost 1,000 Rohingya refugees have found a new home in Chicago, the majority of whom began arriving in 2013. 

The local group makes up nearly a fifth of the Rohingya refugees resettled across the country since 2010, U.S. Department of State officials said.
post_description: For most of his life, Nasir Bin Zakaria was a citizen of nowhere.

post_name: President Obama gearing up for his last big showdown at the Supreme Court
post_message: The Supreme Court's last great case of the Obama era comes before the justices Monday when the president's lawyers defend his plan to offer work permits to as many as 4 million immigrants who have been living in the U.S. illegally for years.
post_description: The Supreme Court 's last great case of the Obama era comes before the justices Monday when the president's lawyers defend his plan to offer work permits to as many as 4 million immigrants who have been living in the U.S. illegally for years.

post_name: See something, say something? Well, being Muslim isn't something
post_message:
"If you see something, say something," the Department of Homeland Security tells us. Problem is, a lot of folks probably need a little coaching on what "something" is.

"Something" is not someone on an airplane who made a phone call in Arabic.

That is speaking another language. It is not terrorism.

Recruitment by radicals, violent ideas, criminal acts -- those are real somethings.

Wearing a hijab, speaking or writing Arabic, or being Muslim is simply being American. And it's time we learn the difference.
post_description: College student Khairuldeen Makhzoomi, 26, was booted off his Southwest Airlines flight in California last week because he made a phone call.

post_name: St. John Cantius: America's Most Beautiful Church
post_message:
Threatened with the wrecking ball in 1988, St. John Cantius Roman Catholic Church, with its opulent baroque interior, stands as one of Chicago's many symbols of resurrection.

This past weekend, the Goose Island neighborhood parish, built by Polish immigrants in the 19th century, was voted "The Most Beautiful Church in America."
post_description: The Rev. Joshua Caswell, a priest with the Canons Regular, the religious order housed at St. John Cantius, said he believes the contest provided a pleasant distraction for Catholic faithful.

post_name: Immigrants rush to apply for citizenship in last window before election
post_message:
This year's election has struck a chord with immigrants. About 8.8 million immigrants throughout the U.S. are eligible for citizenship, about 350,000 in Illinois.

And this is crunch time.
post_description: Elena and Esteban Salgado have been living in the U.S. for over 30 years. This year, they decided, would be the year they vote.

post_name: Best breakfast taco in Chicago? Get it at Jarabe Mexican Street Food
post_message: Breakfast for lunch, anyone?
post_description: Corn tortillas are to Chicago what imprisoned politicians are to Illinois — so ubiquitous you almost forget how many exist.

post_name: High school yearbook misidentifies Muslim student as 'Isis Phillips'
post_message:
Bayan Zehlif, a student at Los Osos High School, posted a photo from one of the yearbook’s pages on Twitter and Facebook.

The caption below the photo did not have her name but instead identified her as Isis Phillips.
post_description: A high school yearbook is supposed to be a keepsake, but for a Muslim student in Rancho Cucamonga it will be a painful reminder of being misidentified as “Isis Phillips” in a photo that showed her smiling and wearing a hijab.

post_name: Hyde Park church gives immigrant sanctuary, but strategy questioned
post_message: "All religions believe in protecting the vulnerable and welcoming a stranger, they all say this, and Christianity calls us to do the same thing."
post_description: It's been three weeks since Jose Juan Federico Moreno left his family and his Bolingbrook home to live in a room at a Hyde Park church, hoping to be protected from deportation.

post_name: Here's why Chicago's Chinatown is booming, even as others across the U.S. fade
post_message: Chinatowns in Manhattan, San Francisco, Boston and Philadelphia are fading. So why is Chicago’s getting bigger?
post_description: One of the first things Chinese immigrant Sau Fung Lam did upon arriving in Chinatown 24 years ago was go to the local grocery store to try to buy an apple.

post_name: David Petraeus op-ed: Anti-Muslim bigotry aids Islamist terrorists
post_message: "Those who flirt with hate speech against Muslims should realize they are playing directly into the hands of al-Qaida and the Islamic State."
post_description: Almost 15 years after the 9/11 attacks, and five years since the killing of the chief architect of those attacks, the United States and the world face a resurgent threat from terrorism. This stark reality should inform the national debate as we prepare to elect our next commander in chief.

post_name: Trump needs to start insulting white dudes
post_message:
Donald Trump has insulted Mexicans, Muslims, black people, women, Asians, Iowans, prisoners of war, Native Americans and Jewish people.

It's time for Trump to move on, Rex Huppke says, to insulting white men.
post_description: Great news, everyone. A presidential candidate's character no longer matters.

post_name: Mexican-American textbook stirs cultural debate in Texas
post_message:
A textbook called "Mexican American Heritage" was offered up to help with cultural teachings after activists demanded Mexican-American studies be formally included in the Texas state curriculum.

But, instead of a book that was respectful of Mexican-American history, the textbook was prepared by non-experts. It ended up poorly written and racist.
post_description: The textbook describes Mexican-Americans as people who "adopted a revolutionary narrative that opposed Western civilization and wanted to destroy this society."

post_name: The secret life of Kim Jong Un's aunt, a U.S. resident since 1998
post_message:
In New York City, a 60-year-old Korean woman runs a dry-cleaning business with her husband.

But she's not just any immigrant. She's an aunt to Kim Jong Un, the young North Korean leader who has threatened to wipe out New York with a hydrogen bomb.

And for the past 18 years, since defecting from North Korea into the waiting arms of the CIA, she has been living an anonymous life here in the United States, with her husband and three children.
post_description: Wandering through Times Square, past the Naked Cowboy and the Elmos and the ticket touts, she could be any immigrant trying to live the American Dream.

post_name: Mexican soccer star Alan Pulido, 25, kidnapped
post_message: Star Mexican soccer player Alan Pulido was rescued Sunday night, several hours after he was kidnapped in the crime-ridden northern border state of Tamaulipas, the Associated Press reported.
post_description: The rescue took place before midnight, according to a state group that coordinated the effort. Pulido was not believed to have suffered major injury but was undergoing a medical evaluation.

post_name: Volunteers feed Chicago's homeless and hungry during Muslim fast
post_message:
Every Sunday morning, dozens of volunteers gather in the basement of the Downtown Islamic Center to fill bags with peanut butter-and-banana sandwiches, fresh fruit and water. 

Children decorate each package with stickers and crayon hearts before the group ventures out, feeding any hungry and homeless they encounter.
post_description: They call it feeding it forward.

post_name: Waukegan family from Honduras details challenges amid rise in immigrant students in Lake County
post_message:
The U.S. is still feeling the effects of a Central American refugee crisis. 

The federal government has placed more than 100,000 children in U.S. communities where they are expected to attend school while they await an immigration hearing.
post_description: She crossed two countries to get to a single-family home in Waukegan, escaping a husband who kidnapped and beat her when she tried to leave.

post_name: Muhammad Ali remembered in Muslim world as champ, 'hero,' voice of change
post_message: "Muslims wanted a hero to represent them, and (Ali) was the only Muslim champion. ... No other Muslim athlete managed to achieve what (Ali) did. ... Thus, he was a symbol for Muslims."
post_description: Of all Muhammad Ali 's travels in the Muslim world, his 1964 trip to Egypt was perhaps the most symbolic, a visit remembered mostly by an iconic photo of the boxing great happily shaking hands with a smiling Gamal Abdel-Nasser, Egypt's nationalist and popular president.

post_name: Backlogs in immigration courts keep asylum seekers in limbo for years
post_message:
More than 20,000 deportation cases are pending in Illinois immigration courts, a number almost five times higher than the number of cases a decade ago. 

This means the average wait time for a hearing date at the Chicago courthouse is now nearly three years.
post_description: Jaime said he had no future in El Salvador because of the rampant gang violence. So he fled to the U.S., like many others, hoping for a better life. But he said he doesn't know whether he has a future here either — and he won't know for years.

post_name: Column: Amid the noise, is there middle ground for talks on U.S. born terrorists?
post_message:
John Kass doesn't want a war with Islam, and he understands that many on the right would march us down that path or at least isolate the U.S. from the Muslim world.

But the president — refusing to mention "Islam" and "terror" in the same sentence — appears ridiculous in the wake of the Orlando mass shooting.
post_description: The dead were still being collected at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando — the scene of the worst mass shooting in our nation's history — when I thought I heard something.

post_name: Commentary: Guns. It always comes back to the guns.
post_message:
Rex Huppke doesn't care whether the evil maniac who slaughtered at least 49 people in an Orlando gay bar was a Muslim or a Christian, a Democrat or a Republican, a bigot or a terrorist.

What he cares about is this: Without a legally purchased military-style rifle, he would've just been a guy standing in a bar.
post_description: I don't care whether you call what he did — the worst mass shooting in American history — a terror attack or an act of radical Islamic terrorism or a massacre or a hate crime.

post_name: After Orlando shooting, Donald Trump demonizes Muslims
post_message:
Donald Trump’s approach appeals to some Americans, particularly those who don’t know any Muslims. Attitudes toward Muslims have gotten more negative in recent years, but most Americans still have a favorable opinion. 

But when people feel angry and embattled, they are more susceptible to appeals to bigotry and hate. That means Trump’s demonization of Muslims may work.
post_description: Someone trying to affix blame for the unspeakable murders at an Orlando nightclub early Sunday morning could focus on any number of the killer’s traits: He was a young male. He was a gun owner. He was a homophobe. He was, according to his ex-wife, mentally disturbed.

post_name: Column: The Orlando attack and an elusive explanation
post_message: A terrible event is all the more terrifying when you can't box it up into a tidy explanation; until you have an explanation, you're not sure what to fix. It's hard to cure a disease without a diagnosis.
post_description: He was a Muslim terrorist who hated Americans.

post_name: Column: Born in America, yet kept apart
post_message: Depending on your politics, you can selectively tweet out all you need, and validate yourself, while demonizing those with whom you disagree.
post_description: The deconstruction of Omar Mateen, the son of Afghan immigrants, continues, and he becomes a feast for our politics.

post_name: Trump says to 'ask the gays' about his LGBT street cred; they fire back
post_message: Almost immediately after Donald Trump said to “ask the gays what they think," the Twitterverse jumped on the phrase — and turned it into a viral hashtag.
post_description: For weeks, presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump has been touting his “youge!” fanbase with Mexicans, women, a slew of other minorities — often times alienating them with the same breath. On Wednesday, he added “the gays” to his list.

post_name: Column: Muslim, gay and guilt for Orlando shootings
post_message:
After the Orlando gay nightclub shooting, Malik Gillani felt the "we" of being Muslim as deeply as he felt the "we" of being gay. 

He identified with the killer and the victims. Guilt blended with sorrow, writes Mary Schmich.
post_description: In Malik Gillani's fantasy, here in the holy month of Ramadan, the mosques of Chicago would make a meal and invite gay people in.

post_name: Double jeopardy? Gay Muslims in America
post_message: The Quran does not explicitly condemn homosexuality, and progressive scholars point to various passages to argue that the Quran acknowledges and accepts same-sex relationships.
post_description: One day on a golf course with actor-comedian Jack Benny in the late 1950s, song-and-dance man Sammy Davis Jr. was asked what his handicap was. "Talk about handicap," said Davis, according to various sources. "I'm a one-eyed Negro Jew."

post_name: Singer known from Mexico's 'The Voice' fatally shot in Chicago
post_message: Alejandro "Jano" Fuentes, who earned a major following after participating in the Mexican version of "The Voice," died Saturday after being shot Thursday in a vehicle in the Brighton Park neighborhood on the Southwest Side after celebrating his 45th birthday with friends and colleagues.
post_description: A singer who earned a major following after participating in the Mexican version of "The Voice" died Saturday after being shot Thursday in a vehicle in the Brighton Park neighborhood on the Southwest Side, officials said.

post_name: Donald Trump calls profiling Muslims 'common sense'
post_message: "Well, I think profiling is something that we're going to have to start thinking about as a country."
post_description: After doubling down on his proposal to ban immigrants from countries with a history of terrorism, Donald Trump is now doubling down on another controversial idea in the wake of the Orlando massacre: profiling Muslims already in the United States.

post_name: Singer known from Mexico's 'The Voice' fatally shot in Chicago
post_message: Alejandro "Jano" Fuentes was in a car in the 4300 block of South Archer Avenue after celebrating his 45th birthday with friends and colleagues when someone walked up, showed him a gun and told him to get out.
post_description: A singer who earned a major following after participating in the Mexican version of "The Voice" died Saturday after being shot Thursday in a vehicle in the Brighton Park neighborhood on the Southwest Side, officials said.

post_name: I reported Omar Mateen to the FBI. Donald Trump is wrong that Muslims don't do our part.
post_message:
"I had told the FBI about Omar because my community, and Muslims generally, have nothing to hide. I love this country, like most Muslims that I know. 

"I don't agree with every government policy (I think there's too much money in politics, for instance), but I'm proud to be an American."
post_description: Donald Trump believes American Muslims are hiding something. "They know what's going on. They know that [Omar Mateen] was bad," he said after the Orlando massacre. "They have to cooperate with law enforcement and turn in the people who they know are bad ... But you know what? They didn't turn them i...

post_name: Column: Facts suggest a whiter shade of profiling
post_message:
Since Sept. 11, 2001, there have been 418 people killed in mass shootings. The total killed by white men is 185. The total killed by Muslim extremists is 81.

So, Rex Huppke says, if we're going to start profiling, we should start by profiling white men with legally purchased firearms. Not Muslims.
post_description: After a Muslim-American claiming allegiance to the Islamic State killed 49 people in an Orlando, Fla., nightclub using a legally purchased assault-style rifle, many dismissed the issue of gun control and said concern should focus on the "fact" that America is under direct attack by Muslim extremists...

post_name: Hopes dashed for millions of undocumented immigrants after court ruling
post_message:
"I don't know what I'm going to do. We came here out of necessity to give our families better lives. Will I be able to stay in this country?"

- Yolanda Perez-Reyes, who arrived from El Salvador 11 years ago and has two U.S.-born children
post_description: Every night after arriving home from her house-cleaning job, Yolanda Perez-Reyes checked for news about a U.S. Supreme Court ruling that could offer a way for her and millions of other undocumented immigrants to avoid deportation.

post_name: Chipotle executive charged in cocaine-delivery bust
post_message: Chipotle's Mark Crumpacker, one of the beleaguered company's top four executives, was placed on administrative leave following reports that he was linked to a cocaine bust in New York.
post_description: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc.'s Mark Crumpacker, one of the beleaguered company's top four executives, was placed on administrative leave following reports that he was linked to a cocaine bust in New York.

post_name: Islamic group: Muslim man beaten outside mosque nightclub shooter attended
post_message:
An Islamic civil rights group said a Muslim man was beaten outside the Islamic Center that Orlando nightclub shooter Omar Mateen had attended. 

The incident comes as the group says local authorities ignored requests for increased security, despite numerous threats.
post_description: An Islamic civil rights group said a Muslim man was beaten Saturday outside the Fort Pierce Islamic Center that Orlando nightclub shooter Omar Mateen had attended. The incident comes as the group says local authorities ignored requests for increased security, despite numerous threats.

post_name: Iraq: Death toll from Islamic State-claimed bombing climbs to 175
post_message: Iraqis are still recovering bodies from the site of Sunday's truck bombing in the center of the capital — the single deadliest attack claimed by the Islamic State group worldwide.
post_description: The series of attacks, which bore the hallmarks of the Islamic State group, killed both Muslims and non-Muslims, but also highlighted the reach of the militants beyond Iraq and Syria, where they hold territory and where a U.S.-led coalition is focusi

post_name: American craft brewers put their spin on Mexican lagers
post_message:
If you look at beer rating websites or apps, you'll see a broad consensus that Mexican lagers are, quite frankly, terrible beers. 

But, those sites don't tell the whole story.
post_description: "Sometimes you just want a beer," says Shaun O'Sullivan, co-founder and brewmaster of 21st Amendment Brewery.

post_name: Muslim group erects billboards designed to fight terrorism, Islamophobia
post_message: "We are trying to tell average Americans this is who we are, and we do not condone (terrorism)."
post_description: A suburban Chicago Muslim group hopes two giant billboards hanging over busy Chicago highways will help to fight terrorism while also combating Islamophobia.

post_name: Straddling East and West, Turkey is a critical ally of the U.S.
post_message: The sprawling nation of Turkey is one of the United States’ most important and most critically strategic allies, straddling the divide between the Middle East and the West.
post_description: As the only majority-Muslim member of NATO, Turkey has lent its soil to U.S. air bases, supported American military operations in key conflicts — such as Syria today and the Balkans in the 1990s — and served, until recent years, as a rare friendly in

post_name: Chipotle executive's alleged cocaine buys line up with company's worst days
post_message: The top Chipotle marketing executive's alleged drug purchases coincide with some of the company's worst days of 2016.
post_description: A top Chipotle Mexican Grill marketing executive might have been driven to drugs as the fast-food chain's brand was tarnished by health scares at the burrito restaurants.

post_name: Column: Clinton's convention shows race is between a woman and a little boy
post_message: There are adults in this presidential race and there are children, and this week’s DNC did an excellent job of separating the women from the boys, writes Rex Huppke.
post_description: No, a real estate mogul and reality television star is not qualified to be president. No, the condemnation of an entire religion is not in line with American values. No, demonizing immigrants will not make America great again.

post_name: In response to father of dead Muslim soldier, Trump insists he's made a lot of sacrifices
post_message: In an interview, Donald Trump insisted that Khizr Khan, whose son was killed in 2004 by a car bomb in Iraq, was misguided in his criticisms.
post_description: Donald Trump responded Saturday to criticism from the Muslim father of a fallen soldier, who in an emotional speech at the Democratic National Convention said the billionaire businessman has "sacrificed nothing" for the country.

post_name: Donald Trump spokeswoman blames Obama for 2004 Muslim soldier's death
post_message: The death occurred more than four years before Barack Obama became president and before he joined the federal government.
post_description: A spokeswoman for Donald Trump placed blame on Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton for the June 2004 killing of U.S. Army Capt. Humayun Khan in Iraq — even though the death occurred more than four years before Obama became president and before he joined the federal government.

post_name: The Whopperito: Burger King takes aim at Chipotle with Whopper burrito
post_message: We're intrigued.
post_description: Burger King's latest new item is taking a stab at Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc., which is still reeling from a string of foodborne illness outbreaks.

post_name: The Final Five: Proof America's already pretty great
post_message:
The gold medal-winning, Russia-dominating, gravity-defying women's gymnastics team — Lauren Hernandez, Madison Kocian, Simone Biles, Alexandra Raisman and Gabrielle Douglas — is a gorgeous rainbow of diversity. 

(If rainbows had thigh muscles of steel.)
post_description: The U.S. women's gymnastics team is the best in the world, and they're a diverse group coached by an immigrant

post_name: Commentary: The harrowing lives, and deaths, of Muslims victimized by Islamist extremism
post_message: "For them, terrorism is not some outlier event like a plane crash, or something more likely to happen in a Hollywood movie than in real life. It's just another day."
post_description: When Islamist terrorists killed a priest in France last month, it was front-page news. Yet when terrorists in Mogadishu, the capital of Somalia, killed more than a dozen civilians that same day, the story received much less prominent coverage. This was despite the amazing revelation that one of the…

post_name: Muslim woman sues Chicago, police, alleging excessive force, false arrest
post_message:
A CTA surveillance video shows her climbing the stairs alone toward the platform when a group of five officers approaches her from behind. 

One of the officers grabs her by the shoulder and brings her to the ground, where the police huddle around her and appear to search her.
post_description: A woman filed a federal civil rights lawsuit Thursday against the city of Chicago and six of its police officers after she said the officers profiled her based on her religious garb and assaulted her outside a CTA train station last year.

post_name: The rise and fall of a Silicon Valley mogul accused of domestic violence
post_message:
As an ascendant multimillionaire mogul, Gurbaksh Chahal found himself at the center of the "tech bro" culture — wearing fancy ties and ripped jeans to work, spending lavishly on luxury sports cars and penthouse apartments, and talking openly about his search for the right woman.

But these days, the story of Gurbaksh Chahal is told in a much different way.

Chahal was accused in 2013 of punching and kicking his then-girlfriend 117 times and attempting to smother her with a pillow.
post_description: There was a time when Gurbaksh Chahal's story was depicted as a true rags-to-riches tale — one that started in the projects in San Jose, Calif., where a young Indian immigrant was bullied for standing out.

post_name: French resort town Cannes bans full-body 'burkini' swimsuits from beaches
post_message: The French resort town of Cannes has banned full-body, head-covering swimsuits from its beaches, citing security reasons — a measure some are decrying as a discriminatory anti-Muslim move that only worsens religious tensions.
post_description: The ban on so-called burkinis, at the height of the French Riviera's vacation season, comes as France remains on edge after deadly Islamic extremist attacks in nearby Nice and on a Catholic church in northwest France.

post_name: Donald Trump to propose political tests for immigrants in speech today
post_message:
Donald Trump will declare an end to nation building if elected president, replacing it with what aides described as "foreign policy realism."

Trump is also expected to outline a new immigration policy proposal.
post_description: Donald Trump will declare an end to nation building if elected president, replacing it with what aides described as "foreign policy realism" focused on destroying the Islamic State group and other extremist organizations.

post_name: Son of 'El Chapo' among those kidnapped in Puerto Vallarta, officials say
post_message: Mexican officials say one of the men taken in Puerto Vallarta was a son of imprisoned drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman.
post_description: Mexican officials say they have confirmed that one of the men taken from an upscale restaurant in the Pacific resort city of Puerto Vallarta was a son of imprisoned drug lord Joaquin " El   Chapo " Guzman.

post_name: Column: Thongs are passe. It’s the burkini that has France laying down the law.
post_message: "It's hard to imagine that a Muslim woman dressed traditionally is a threat to any but her own comfort."
post_description: Once upon a time, a scantily clad lass padding down a beach might cause a riot — at least of eyeballs eager to extend the sidelong glance.

post_name: Latina server in Virginia gets hateful message on receipt instead of tip
post_message:
Instead of leaving a gratuity, a couple eating at a Virginia restaurant wrote: "We only tip citizens."

The message was aimed at an 18-year-old waitress, who was born in America but is of Honduran and Mexican descent.
post_description: The message on the receipt rattled Sadie Karina Elledge, but it made her grandfather see red.

post_name: Trump accepts last-minute meeting in Mexico with the country's president
post_message: Donald Trump is going to Mexico.
post_description: Donald Trump is jetting to Mexico City on Wednesday for a meeting with Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto, just hours before he delivers a high-stakes speech in Arizona to clarify his views on immigration policy.

post_name: Trump's meeting with Mexico president ends in dispute over border wall payment talk
post_message:
Mexican President Pena Nieto tweeted, "At the start of the conversation with Donald Trump I made it clear that Mexico will not pay for the wall."

This contradicts what Donald Trump said, that the two men didn't discuss who would pay.
post_description: On Mexican soil for the first time as the Republican presidential nominee, a firm but measured Donald Trump defended the right of the United States to build a massive border wall along its southern flank, standing up for the centerpiece of his immigr

post_name: Column: The Trump pivot is dead, in its place was a hate speech
post_message: Moderate Republicans who have been praying daily for nominee Donald Trump to grow into a plausible candidate had to be sickened by what they saw Wednesday night, Rex Huppke says.
post_description: Expecting a pivot, Americans got Donald Trump at his worst, delivering an immigration speech filled with hate

post_name: Khans thank Islamic convention attendees, warn 'assault' on community will outlast election
post_message:
Khizr Khan and his wife, Ghazala, whose son, Capt. Humayan Khan, was killed in 2004 in Iraq, spoke at the annual Islamic Society of North America convention in Rosemont.

"Some people believe that this assault may be over, assault on my community and assault on my religion, will be over in November," Khizr Khan said. "Do not be mistaken. This assault is far beyond elections."
post_description: The couple who lost a son in the Iraq War and were attacked by Donald Trump after their appearance at the Democratic National Convention this summer on Saturday thanked those at a national Islamic convention for their support but warned the "assault" on the Muslim community won't end with the Novemb...

post_name: U.S. to track religious discrimination in schools as anti-Muslim sentiment grows
post_message: "Students of all religions should feel safe, welcome and valued in our nation's schools."
post_description: The U.S. Education Department announced it will begin collecting data this year about allegations of discrimination or bullying of students based on their religion, bringing new attention to what educators and advocates call a growing problem in public schools, particularly for Muslim students.

post_name: Stranger raises more than $135K for Little Village vendor: 'There will be no need for me to work'
post_message:
After watching 89-year-old Fidencio Sanchez struggle to push a popsicle cart around Little Village, a stranger decided to help.

“It broke my heart seeing this man who should be enjoying retirement still working at this age."

Now, more than $135,000 has been raised for Sanchez and his wife,  who have been working to pay bills following the death of their only daughter.
post_description: There’s no way of knowing how long it would’ve taken Fidencio Sanchez to sell 90,000 paletas, or Mexican ice pops, for $1.50 each from the paleteria he pushes around Little Village.

post_name: Kass: What binds a nation of immigrants together?
post_message: Columnist John Kass, remembering his father's allegiance to America in an oath a half-century ago, wonders what binds us together now, if not the Pledge of Allegiance.
post_description: My father would sometimes tell the story of the day he became a citizen of the United States of America.

post_name: Which fast-food chains served the meat, held the antibiotics?
post_message: Panera Bread and Chipotle Mexican Grill passed with flying colors, but KFC and Olive Garden were among the laggards in commitments to eliminate medically important antibiotics from their meat and poultry supply chains, according to a new report.
post_description: Strong progress nonetheless was made across the top 25 fast-food and casual dining retailers, suggesting that public pressure has helped slow the meat and poultry industry’s routine use of antibiotics.

post_name: Rick Bayless' Frontera Foods sold to ConAgra; brand staying in Chicago
post_message: Slim Jim, Banquet and Reddi-wip. And now, Frontera Foods.
post_description: Frontera Foods, the Chicago-based gourmet Mexican food company started by Chef Rick Bayless , has been purchased by ConAgra Foods , the packaged food giant known for such brands as Slim Jim, Banquet and Reddi-wip.

post_name: Big Star to open second spot in Wrigley Field hotel? Partners talk details
post_message:
One Off Hospitality — the group that includes Mexican street-food restaurant Big Star — has big plans for Hotel Zachary, opening across the street from Wrigley Field in 2018.

From Chicago Tribune Food & Dining.
post_description: One Off Hospitality, the restaurant group that includes Blackbird, The Publican, Avec and, not incidentally, Big Star, has big plans for Hotel Zachary, opening in 2018.

post_name: Black superheroes breaking out, but who gets to tell their story?
post_message: The superhero universe is starting to look a lot like the rest of the universe: In recent years we have been offered a Chinese Superman, a Muslim Ms. Marvel, a half-Latina Hawkgirl, gay X-Men. No superdemographic has exploded, though, quite as exponentially as African-American superheroes (and villains).
post_description: Even as black superheroes seem to be having a breakout moment, questions remain about who gets to tell their story, and how.

post_name: Opinion: Are we at the bottom yet? Trump threatens Clinton with jail time
post_message: Threatening Hillary Clinton to her face in a national debate with jail was an assault that went beyond Donald Trump's attacks on women, Muslims, Mexicans, the disabled, prisoners of war and Gold Star families to strike at the American democratic system itself, Eric Zorn says.
post_description: No one would have thought it possible under all the appalling circumstances, yet Republican nominee Donald Trump hit a new low a little more than 19 minutes into the second presidential debate Sunday evening.

post_name: 3 militia group members arrested in alleged bomb plot targeting Somalis in Kansas
post_message: The arrests were the culmination of an eight-month FBI investigation that took agents "deep into a hidden culture of hatred and violence."
post_description: Three members of a Kansas militia group were charged Friday with plotting to bomb an apartment complex that's home to Somali immigrants in the western Kansas meatpacking town of Garden City, a thwarted attack prosecutors say was planned for the day after the November election.

post_name: 'It will be a bloodbath': Inside the Kansas militia plot to ignite a religious war
post_message: Federal court documents reveal how the trio's hatred and Islamophobia coalesced into a plan for domestic terrorism.
post_description: The "Crusaders" knew they wanted to kill Muslims - and with luck, use the "bloodbath" to ignite a religious war - but for months they couldn't settle on a plan.

post_name: Column: Women voters to Trump: We're going to take you down
post_message:
Early on, Donald Trump managed to get away with making vile attacks against Muslims, Hispanics, African-Americans and gays without being punished in the polls. Even when he mocked the disabled, some supporters looked the other way. 

But he met his match when he disrespected women, writes columnist Dahleen Glanton.
post_description: Right now, women are mad as hell at Trump. And three weeks from now, they are going to lead the way in taking him down.

post_name: Emanuel won't return $50,000 Trump contribution
post_message: Mayor Rahm Emanuel's campaign Tuesday said the mayor won't return a $50,000 campaign contribution from Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.
post_description: The question arose after the City Council voted to remove the remaining honorary "Trump Plaza" sign outside the GOP nominee's eponymous River North tower on Wabash Avenue in retaliation for his comments on Chicago violence and immigration in general.

post_name: Emanuel won't return $50,000 Trump contribution
post_message: Mayor Rahm Emanuel's campaign Tuesday said the mayor won't return a $50,000 campaign contribution from Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.
post_description: The question arose after the City Council voted to remove the remaining honorary "Trump Plaza" sign outside the GOP nominee's eponymous River North tower on Wabash Avenue in retaliation for his comments on Chicago violence and immigration in general.

post_name: Salpicon restaurant closing after nearly 22 years; new chapter begins for owners
post_message: Salpicon, the noted Mexican restaurant in Chicago’s Old Town neighborhood, will close Nov. 30 after almost 22 years in business.
post_description: Owners Priscila Satkoff and Vincent Satkoff are moving to Mexico where they expect to launch a new restaurant.

post_name: Salpicon restaurant closing after nearly 22 years; new chapter begins for owners
post_message: Salpicon, the noted Mexican restaurant in Chicago’s Old Town neighborhood, will close Nov. 30 after almost 22 years in business.
post_description: Owners Priscila Satkoff and Vincent Satkoff are moving to Mexico where they expect to launch a new restaurant.

post_name: Canadian immigration website crashes amid Trump victory
post_message: Trying to figure out how to move to Canada last night? You weren't alone.
post_description: Canada and the prospect of Americans moving there appears to have drawn so much online interest that it knocked out the country's immigration website.

post_name: Canadian immigration website crashes amid Trump victory
post_message: Trying to figure out how to move to Canada last night? You weren't alone.
post_description: Canada and the prospect of Americans moving there appears to have drawn so much online interest that it knocked out the country's immigration website.

post_name: She's one of CoverGirl's new faces. And she's wearing a hijab.
post_message: 24-year-old Nura Afia will appear in a commercial for CoverGirl, marking the first time a Muslim woman wearing a hijab has been featured in an ad for the brand.
post_description: Nura Afia's YouTube channel has thousands and thousands of subscribers.

post_name: She's one of CoverGirl's new faces. And she's wearing a hijab.
post_message: 24-year-old Nura Afia will appear in a commercial for CoverGirl, marking the first time a Muslim woman wearing a hijab has been featured in an ad for the brand.
post_description: Nura Afia's YouTube channel has thousands and thousands of subscribers.

post_name: Build-that-wall pledge has companies bracing for labor shortages
post_message:
For corporate America, there’s a lot to like about President-elect Donald Trump’s platform: fewer regulations, lower taxes and a singular devotion to deal-making.

Yet there’s one signature campaign pledge — to round up and deport millions of undocumented immigrants — that has many executives across the country on edge.
post_description: The proposal, if implemented even remotely as vigorously as Trump at times promised, would squeeze a labor pool that companies like Dunkin’ Brands Group Inc. and Bojangles Inc. say has already been tightening for months.

post_name: Grubhub faces backlash after CEO's anti-Trump email to employees
post_message: “While demeaning, insulting and ridiculing minorities, immigrants and the physically/mentally disabled worked for Mr. Trump, I want to be clear that his behavior - and these views, have no place at Grubhub..." - CEO Matt Maloney
post_description: Grubhub CEO Matt Maloney spoke out against President-elect Donald Trump in an email to employees Wednesday, saying if employees don’t agree with creating…

post_name: OPINION: Will Donald Trump govern in prose or profanity?
post_message: Donald Trump has shown a cavalier disdain for free speech. His policy pronouncements, which target Muslims and Latinos based on their religious beliefs and ethnicity, isolate our fellow citizens and give racists permission to lash out. It is embarrassing and un-American, writes the Chicago Tribune Editorial Board.
post_description: Condoning Trump's ugly language, even shrugging it off as sloppy, heat-of-the-moment rhetoric, would be dangerous.

post_name: Oak Lawn faith leaders call on businesses to support Muslim neighbors
post_message: Crowds gathered in Oak Lawn today to talk about the rise of Islamophobia in the United States.
post_description: Community members asked business owners to post signs in their windows that read "We support our Muslim neighbors."

post_name: Donald Trump plans to immediately deport 2 to 3 million undocumented immigrants
post_message: "What we are going to do is get the people that are criminal and have criminal records, gang members, drug dealers, where a lot of these people, probably 2 million, it could be even 3 million, we are getting them out of our country or we are going to incarcerate."
post_description: In a "60 Minutes" interview scheduled to air Sunday, President-elect Donald Trump said he planned to immediately deport two to three million undocumented immigrants after his inauguration next January.

post_name: Quigley worries Chicago sanctuary city rules imperil federal funding under Trump
post_message: Democratic U.S. Rep. Mike Quigley worries President-elect Donald Trump could use Chicago's status as a sanctuary city for undocumented immigrants to cut off funding to the city.
post_description: Welcome to Clout Street: Morning Spin, our weekday feature to catch you up with what's going on in government and politics from Chicago to Springfield.

post_name: Quigley worries Chicago sanctuary city rules imperil federal funding under Trump
post_message: Democratic U.S. Rep. Mike Quigley worries President-elect Donald Trump could use Chicago's status as a sanctuary city for undocumented immigrants to cut off funding to the city.
post_description: Welcome to Clout Street: Morning Spin, our weekday feature to catch you up with what's going on in government and politics from Chicago to Springfield.

post_name: Anxiety over Trump's election galvanizes immigration advocacy in Chicago
post_message: "I've never been a part of anything like this. It feels like I'm living in a different time period."
post_description: Lily Martinez had never been involved in activism. But after Donald Trump was elected president, the 20-year-old Little Village resident felt an immediate call to action.

post_name: Non-Muslims vow to add their names to a Muslim registry. Would that help or harm?
post_message:
On social media, Heidi Stevens frequently sees non-Muslims pledging to register themselves on a hypothetical Muslim database in a show of solidarity.

Is that feasible? Is that enough? She called a couple of experts to get their take.
post_description: Experts share ways to push back against growing sense of Islamophobia in the United States
