post_message:
On social media, Heidi Stevens frequently sees non-Muslims pledging to register themselves on a hypothetical Muslim database in a show of solidarity.

Is that feasible? Is that enough? She called a couple of experts to get their take.
post_description: Experts share ways to push back against growing sense of Islamophobia in the United States

post_name: Chicago Muslims give thanks, 5,000 turkeys
post_message:
For 16 years, the Chicago Muslim community has distributed free Thanksgiving turkeys to underprivileged families on the South Side.

But this holiday season, the group more than tripled the number of free birds from last year to 5,000 and expanded the project to eight elementary schools in three neighborhoods.
post_description: As a line of schoolchildren obediently marched past the canary yellow lockers Tuesday morning at Woodlawn Community School, two more lines had formed at the end of the hallway — an assembly line of volunteers unloading a semitrailer full of turkeys, and the mothers and grandmothers waiting to take o...

post_name: Emanuel announces immigrant legal fund
post_message: The $1 million fund was created to "provide immediate legal information, screenings, consultations, and representation to individuals who may be at risk for deportation."
post_description: The money will come from the $20 million the city set aside for Emanuel's property tax rebate program, according to city spokeswoman Jennifer Martinez.

post_name: Amid deportation threats, universities exploring 'sanctuary campuses' for immigrants
post_message: Universities and colleges in several states are considering labeling themselves "sanctuary campuses" amid fears from immigrant students and pressure from activists following the election of Donald Trump.
post_description: College administrators in New Mexico are looking into proposals that would grant immigrant students living in the country illegally protections while they pursue their studies.

post_name: Emanuel, Trump talked immigration during recent phone call
post_message: Rahm Emanuel tried to walk the line between honoring the privacy of the chat and letting Chicagoans know he stood up to the president-elect for the city's values.
post_description: Mayor Rahm Emanuel and President-elect Donald Trump discussed Chicago's status an a sanctuary city for undocumented immigrants during a phone conversation since Trump's election win last month, Emanuel said Monday.

post_name: Methodist church eases post-election fears for Muslim, minority artists
post_message: Silk Road Rising theater at the First United Methodist Church at Chicago Temple has been a balm for Muslim and other minority artists as anxiety grows over the Trump administration.
post_description: Malik Gillani remembers the first day his world turned upside down. It was Sept. 11, 2001, the day terrorist attacks cast a cloud of suspicion on his entire Muslim community.

post_name: Trump vows to fight heroin epidemic, but his policy plans remain vague and contradictory
post_message:
"If we can reduce the amount that comes into the country, we'll limit the supply and, I think, reduce the number of users," Trump said.

But Trump has also promised to repeal Obamacare, which many people use to access addiction treatment.

"I truly believe this could be a disaster. I'm an optimistic person but I'm having a hard time being optimistic here," said Chelsea Laliberte, leader of an Arlington Heights-based nonprofit dedicated to combating heroin.
post_description: President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to curb America's heroin epidemic by cracking down on the Mexican border. That sounds terrific to DuPage County State's Attorney Robert Berlin, who has seen the drug ravage his suburban jurisdiction.

post_name: Number of unauthorized immigrants living in Illinois down 10 percent
post_message:
Chicago's unauthorized immigrant community, three-quarters of which is Mexican, is growing older. With heightened border security and a slowed economy, the number of Mexican immigrants entering the U.S. illegally isn't nearly as high as it was 10 years ago.

North American immigrants make up most of Illinois' undocumented immigrants, with Asia and Europe contributing the next largest group, but a relative fraction.
post_description: There's a quote stenciled onto the wall of Michel Mora's childhood bedroom: "Dream until your dream comes true."

post_name: Chicago's Honey Butter Fried Chicken signs on to 'sanctuary restaurant' movement
post_message: Chicago's Honey Butter Fried Chicken is among a couple of dozen restaurants across the country to sign onto a new "sanctuary restaurant" movement meant to offer safe workplaces for immigrants, Muslims and other communities they feel are under threat in the current political climate.
post_description: The movement is a joint project of ROC United, a national group that advocates for higher wages for restaurant workers, and Presente.org, whose mission is to "advance Latinx power" (Latinx is a gender-neutral alternative to Latino and Latina).

post_name: COMMENTARY: It's immigrants who have made America great
post_message: "Deport them, and we deport our future builders of bridges, teachers of children, savers of lives. Deport them, and we deport our fundamental values as Americans." - Cardinal Blase J. Cupich
post_description: To remove DACA protections would put hundreds of thousands of young people at risk of deportation, cutting short their dreams of a better future. Deport them, and we deport their potential to make our nation stronger.

post_name: No unauthorized immigrants? Manufacturing, hospitality workforces would struggle
post_message: Among the many unknowns about President-elect Donald Trump's immigration agenda is what will happen to the estimated 7 or 8 million unauthorized workers who fill a variety of jobs in the U.S., and to the employers that have come to rely on their labor to keep costs down or supply skills they say they can't find elsewhere.

post_name: Chicago immigration rally has message for Trump: We're here to stay
post_message:
Student Cindy Agustin fears her parents will be deported and she'll never see them again. And she's not alone.

Anxiety about the future — and resolve to change it — brought Cindy and 1,000+ people together Saturday for a Chicago rally against Donald Trump's hard-line immigration proposals.
post_description: Anxiety about the future — and resolve to change it — brought 1,000+ people together Saturday for a Chicago rally against Trump's hard-line immigration proposals.

post_name: Small Catholic university, big Muslim enrollment try to build bridges
post_message:
Benedictine University, a Catholic institution in Lisle, may have the highest percentage of Muslim students of any Catholic university in the nation.

It's a result in part from the church's effort to define its education as accepting all faiths in hopes of serving everyone in the search for what the president of the national Catholic association of universities called "transcendence and meaning."

"I think the way they receive Muslims is very welcoming," said Abdul Rahman Damra, a senior health science major who is applying to dental schools. "Benedictine caters to the needs of Muslims more than most schools do."
post_description: Zainub Fiaz did her homework on Benedictine University before enrolling in the quiet institution in west suburban Lisle . She found out that its education major is rigorous and has affiliations with strong school districts in the area, two factors that impressed her.

post_name: Chicago immigration rally has message for Trump: We're here to stay
post_message:
Anxiety about the future — and resolve to change it — brought more than 1,000 people together Saturday for a Chicago rally against President-elect Donald Trump's hard-line immigration proposals.

The rally, held at the Chicago Teachers Union headquarters on the Near West Side, coincided with similar protests in dozens of other U.S. cities Saturday, six days before Trump is to be inaugurated.

"I mean, that's the issue with Trump, right? He's completely unpredictable," Chicago rally organizer Lawrence Benito said. "He says one thing and then he walks it back. I don't know what to expect."
post_description: Student Cindy Agustin fears her parents will be deported and she'll never see them again.

post_name: With days left in office, Obama ushers in dozens of policies. But will they stay put?
post_message:
In the final days before President Barack Obama leaves office, administration officials are rushing to complete dozens of tasks that will affect millions of lives and solidify the president's imprint on history.

But in many cases, their permanence is uncertain, and President-elect Donald Trump is already pledging to undo some of them after taking office.
post_description: In the past week, President Barack Obama 's administration overturned a decades-old policy toward Cuban immigrants, forged two major agreements to address racial bias in big-city police departments and approved an unexpected cut in mortgage premiums for hundreds of thousands of low-income and first-...

post_name: As soon as he is inaugurated, Trump will move to clamp down on immigration
post_message: Expect to see images of workplace raids on the evening news.
post_description: Trump will also single out people with criminal convictions for deportation, and he could move immediately to reduce the number of refugees allowed in the U.S.

post_name: Women's March on Chicago: What to know if you go
post_message: Going to the Women's March in Chicago tomorrow? Here's what you should know.
post_description: The Chicago event has nearly 30 speakers and seven performers lined up. Speakers will address reproductive rights, racial justice, immigration, gun violence and issues involving the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer community.

post_name: Meet the Chicago immigrant who's helping thousands from Illinois get to the Women's March in D.C.
post_message:
What started with the UIC grad student and Indian immigrant asking herself “What am I going to do?” the day after the 2016 election grew into a full-time job figuring out how to mobilize thousands of people across the nation for a grassroots phenomenon that’s possibly the largest inauguration demonstration in history. 

Thanks to RedEye for the story.
post_description: Mrinalini Chakraborty doesn’t know when she became an activist. The 26-year-old University of Illinois at Chicago graduate student from India said it just complements her opinionated personality. In March 2016 she was at the front lines of student-led protests against a  Donald Trump rally to be hel...

post_name: What to expect in President Trump's first 100 days in office
post_message: Donald Trump and his team are determined to deliver quickly on promises — on the economy, healthcare, tax reform and immigration — that critics told him he could not possibly fulfill.
post_description: President Trump’s unorthodox quest for the White House was fueled by his disregard for convention and the nagging sense that he — and ultimately his supporters — were underestimated and disrespected.

post_name: OPINION: 'Grannies protect what they love:' Why my mom joined the Women's March
post_message:
My 72-year-old mom and her environmentalist friends caused a stir with their granny signs at Saturday's Chicago's Women's March, writes columnist Heidi Stevens.

"I'm trying to figure out what's such a surprise to people. We're the generation who fought for these rights in the first place; why wouldn't we be upset about losing them?" Jean Muntz, 75, said.

Stevens saw hundreds of thousands of people participating in the rally: Women and men, girls and boys, mothers and daughters and grannies, living their principles.

"I think silence is compliance," Sue Harney, 65, said. "I can not be compliant when I see transgender rights, women's rights, immigrants' rights threatened. If I'm not out there actively opposing it, then I'm compliant in their oppression."

At 70, LuAnne Lewandowski marched because she needed a reminder that she has both a voice and an outlet for it.

"Trump keeps telling me he's for the common man," she said. "But I have nothing in common with this man."
post_description: My mom and her book club friends were among Chicago's 250,000 marchers on Saturday.

post_name: What to expect in President Trump's first 100 days in office
post_message: Now sworn in to office as the 45th president, Trump and his team are determined to deliver quickly on promises — on the economy, health care, tax reform and immigration — that critics told him he could not possibly fulfill.

post_name: Executive orders jumpstart border wall construction, strip funding for ‘sanctuary cities’
post_message:
U.S. taxpayers are expected to pay for the upfront costs of the U.S.-Mexico border wall, though Trump continues to assert that Mexico will reimburse the money through unspecified means.

Trump also signed an executive action to block federal funding from cities that don't cooperate with immigration authorities, a move that could cost individual jurisdictions millions of dollars, but which also could face legal challenges.
post_description: President Donald Trump signed executive actions today to jumpstart construction on the U.S.-Mexico border wall and block federal funding from "sanctuary cities."

post_name: As Trump signs order on immigration, Emanuel vows Chicago will remain sanctuary city
post_message: "There is no stranger among us. We welcome people, whether you're from Poland or Pakistan, whether you're from Ireland or India or Israel and whether you're from Mexico or Moldova, where my grandfather came from, you are welcome in Chicago as you pursue the American Dream," Mayor Emanuel said today.
post_description: As President Trump signed an executive order Wednesday to cut off some federal funding from sanctuary cities, Mayor Emanuel vowed Chicago would remain one.

post_name: Immigrants, advocates vow to fight Trump orders on wall, sanctuary cities
post_message: Striking a defiant tone, immigrants and their advocates in Chicago responded immediately to President Trump's executive orders Wednesday to jump-start construction of a border wall with Mexico and strip funding for sanctuary cities.
post_description: "Our community is strong and united, and we will not live in fear," said Mony Ruiz-Velasco, executive director of the West Suburban Action Project.

post_name: Chicago politicians get crash course on how Trump will govern
post_message: Members of Chicago's political class got a crash course today on how President Trump will govern, as they fretted over an executive order on immigration that could cost the city millions in federal funding and scrambled to respond to a Twitter threat to "send in the feds" to fix the city's gun violence.
post_description: The Democratic response to the Republican president's moves was a unified one. On gun crime: Send us money to combat violence, but don't dare send in the National Guard.

post_name: GOP leaders: Congress to fund Mexico border wall, will cost up to $15 billion
post_message: Republican leaders would not say how they would prevent the massive project from adding to federal deficits.
post_description: Congress will move legislation this year providing up to $15 billion to build a wall along the Mexican boundary, Republican leaders said Thursday. But they would not say how they would prevent the massive project from adding to federal deficits.

post_name: Mexican President Peña Nieto cancels trip to Washington
post_message: Earlier Thursday, Donald Trump had tweeted that "If Mexico is unwilling to pay for the badly needed wall, then it would be better to cancel the upcoming meeting" in Washington D.C.
post_description: Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto says he has informed the White House he has canceled trip to Washington.

post_name: Border Patrol chief tells agents he was forced out: official
post_message: Border Patrol chief Mark Morgan told senior agents that he was asked to leave and that he decided to resign rather than fight the request, officials say.
post_description: From the start, he clashed with the Border Patrol's union, which forcefully endorsed Trump. The union was also incensed when he said he supported a comprehensive immigration overhaul.

post_name: Pub apologizes for 'Build-A-Wall' burger with Mexican toppings
post_message: A Chicago-area pub that announced a "Build-A-Wall" burger with "amazing Mexican" toppings has apologized and rescinded the offer after swift backlash.
post_description: A notice on the Facebook page of Durty Nellie's in Palatine advertised the special, listing homemade mole, pico de gallo and Chihuahua cheese among its topping options.

post_name: Trump signs new vetting measures for immigrants aimed at keeping out terrorists
post_message: "We only want to admit those into our country who will support our country and love deeply our people."
post_description: Pushing full-speed into international controversies, President Donald Trump on Friday ordered "new vetting measures" to keep "radical Islamic terrorists" out of the United States.

post_name: Chicago Muslim Basketball League provides competition, brotherhood
post_message: The Chicago Muslim Basketball League began about 10 years ago as a fundraiser tournament three friends set up to help replace flooring at a Morton Grove school. Word spread, and it quickly grew into an annual league drawing players throughout Illinois.
post_description: Farhan Khalique made his way to the bleachers at halftime and scooped up his two young daughters in each arm before heading back to the court.

post_name: Countries where Trump does business are not hit by new travel restrictions
post_message:
For example, Trump's travel bans make no mention of Turkey, a country seeing "an increase in anti-American rhetoric" that the State Department says has the potential to inspire violence against U.S. citizens.

Turkey is also a country where Trump has licensed his name to two luxury towers, and a Turkish company manufactures a line of Trump-branded home furnishings. The president's most recent financial disclosure, filed in May, showed that he had earned as much as $6 million in the previous year from the deals.
post_description: Excluded from the list of nations targeted for visitation restrictions are several majority-Muslim nations where the Trump Organization is active.

post_name: OPINION: Trump blocks Muslim refugees, America loses a part of itself
post_message:
Refugees may not be Americans, but they are as human as you or me and as worthy of help and love and respect as anyone, writes Rex Huppke.

Think about it as you tuck your children in and tell them to pray to a God of love. Think about what this callous decision makes us, and what it makes you if you're celebrating.
post_description: The terrorists won. They can claim victory for getting us to defy who we are, not due to force, but due to fear.  We have to do better.

post_name: 13 held at O'Hare after Trump order, but Park Ridge man freed
post_message:
UPDATE: Lawyers who came to the aid of more than a dozen travelers who were in custody at O'Hare International Airport on Saturday night after an executive order on immigration said all were set free after a federal judge temporarily barred deportations.

Earlier in the evening, hundreds of people protested inside and outside O’Hare, chanting “the whole world is watching.” As the crowds swelled, police shut down vehicle access to the terminal.
post_description: Thirteen people were believed to be in custody Saturday night at O’Hare International Airport as authorities enforced President Donald Trump ’s executive order on immigration from certain majority-Muslim countries – a crackdown that left relatives frantic and prompted protesters to rush to the airpo...

post_name: Trump tasks son-in-law Kushner, a diplomatic novice, with managing Mexico dispute
post_message: By the end of the president's hourlong phone call on Friday with Mexican President Enrique Peña Nieto, Trump had tasked his son-in-law and senior adviser, Jared Kushner — a real estate executive with no national security experience — with managing the ongoing dispute, according to an administration official with knowledge of the call.
post_description: The episode Peña Nieto, an uneven diplomatic debut, revealed the earliest signs of how the new president plans to manage world affairs.

post_name: 'I feel real pain': The system is broken, this immigrant founder says
post_message:
"I landed in the United States of America on Sept. 4, 2004. That's 12-plus years ago. And I'm still not a citizen. Not because I don't want to be. I want it so bad — to have my vote count. But that's how broken our system is."

-Shradha Agarwal, president and co-founder of Chicago-based Outcome Health (formerly ContextMedia) and co-founder of JumpStart Ventures.
post_description: The topic of immigration is so misunderstood.

post_name: Second lawsuit in Chicago challenges Trump travel ban
post_message:
Update: A young Chicago doctor who had his visa canceled after traveling to the United Arab Emirates to get married is the latest "collateral damage" stemming from President Donald Trump's controversial executive order on immigration, according to a lawsuit filed Tuesday in federal court.
---
A Chicago man who traveled to his native Iran to care for his ailing mother is asking a federal judge to declare President Donald Trump's executive order on immigration unconstitutional.

The man was planning to return to Chicago in early February in time for the birth of his first grandchild, according to the suit. But when he tried to purchase a ticket for his return flight on Saturday, the ticketing agency "refused to issue a ticket for his travel to the United States due to the executive order," the suit said.
post_description: A young Chicago doctor who had his visa canceled after traveling to the United Arab Emirates to get married is the latest "collateral damage" stemming from President Donald Trump 's controversial executive order on immigration, according to a lawsuit filed Tuesday in federal court.

post_name: Mosque shooting suspect in Canada known for far-right, nationalist views
post_message:
Alexandre Bissonnette, charged with killing six Muslim men during a shooting rampage at a Quebec City mosque, was known by those who monitor extremist groups for his far-right, nationalist views.

Officials say he has espoused support on his Facebook page for the French rightist party led by Marine Le Pen, as well as for U.S. President Donald Trump and "Génération Nationale," a group whose manifesto includes the rejection of "multiculturalism."
post_description: The French Canadian university student charged with killing six Muslim men during evening prayers at a mosque was known for far-right, nationalist views and his support of the French rightist party led by Marine Le Pen.

post_name: The story behind the viral photo of Muslim and Jewish children protesting at O'Hare
post_message: "If this picture, in some small way, can bring a bit more light and love into the world, I'm so happy about that."
post_description: A Muslim and a Jewish father had never met before bringing their children to O'Hare International Airport Monday to join in a protest of President Donald Trump 's immigration ban.

post_name: OPINION: Trump gives the hard left a chance at power
post_message: Every day, columnist John Kass writes, the hard American political left uses wave after wave of anti-Trump hysteria — much of it carried in the media — to stoke anger, like that over Trump's immigration policy.
post_description: Kass: What Trump gives the hard left: A chance at power

post_name: Jordanian teen sent to Chicago for detainment after being held in Texas
post_message:
A high school student was traveling on a Jordanian passport before being detained for two days at a Houston airport, where his attorneys say he was made to sleep in a chair before being moved Monday to Chicago. They have not been able to speak with their client.

"My experience ... leaves me to believe that Customs and Border Protection at the airport is pulling all Muslim travelers, even those not from the seven listed countries..." said one of the boy's attorneys.
post_description: "He's alone. He doesn't know where he is. He doesn't even know if the family is trying to get a hold of him or not."

post_name: In Chicago, protesters call for reversal of Trump travel ban order
post_message: More than 200 protesters gathered today outside the Department of Homeland Security office in downtown Chicago, the latest in a string of demonstrations that have erupted since President Trump signed an executive order banning refugees and travelers from seven Muslim-majority countries from entering the U.S.
post_description: A coalition of religious, advocacy and legal groups held the rally to show their unity in calling for a reversal of the executive order, which they say amounts to a ban on Muslims.

post_name: Trump's immigration order revives horrible memories for Chicago Holocaust survivors
post_message: "I don't know if you want to know what I'd say to the president if he was here."
post_description: It's been more than 70 years since Aaron Elster survived the Holocaust by hiding in a Polish family's cold, dirty attic.

post_name: Chicago soldier fights deportation after serving time for drug charge
post_message:
After returning to the country he's called home for 30 years, Pfc. Miguel Perez Jr., a decorated Army veteran, faces possible deportation to Mexico following a felony drug conviction.

On Monday, an immigration judge in Chicago will decide his fate.
post_description: Perez is one of many veterans who have been decorated for service, then confronted with the possibility of deportation after committing a crime.

post_name: Federal judge in Seattle temporarily blocks Trump's travel ban nationwide
post_message: A U.S. judge has temporarily blocked President Trump's ban on people from seven predominantly Muslim countries after Washington state and Minnesota urged a nationwide hold on the executive order that has launched legal battles across the country.
post_description: U.S. District Judge James Robart in Seattle ruled against government lawyers' claims that the states did not have the standing to challenge Trump's order and said they showed their case was likely to succeed.

post_name: Lisa Madigan presses Rauner to oppose Trump immigration push
post_message: Escalating a political feud, Democratic Attorney General Lisa Madigan has called on Republican Gov. Bruce Rauner to demonstrate opposition to President Donald Trump's immigration plans while Rauner's state party accused her of trying to stop state worker paychecks to shill for her father, House Speaker Michael Madigan.
post_description: The actions represented a ratcheting up of the rhetoric and political animosity between Rauner, who is the main source of financing for the state GOP, and Democrats whose power he's trying to erode in Springfield amid a stalemate that's left Illinois

post_name: Syrian refugee family arrives in Chicago to cheers as court weighs controversial ban
post_message: A Syrian refugee family was greeted with applause and joyful tears today at O'Hare as a federal appeals court heard arguments on whether to restore President Trump's controversial immigration order.
post_description: "This is what I expected of the American people," Baraa Haj Khalaf said through a translator, minutes after exiting the international terminal doors to see people cheering, holding welcome signs and waving U.S. flags.

post_name: Senate confirms Jeff Sessions as attorney general
post_message: The Senate has confirmed Sen. Jeff Sessions to be attorney general, despite fierce Democratic opposition to the Alabama Republican over his record on civil rights and immigration.
post_description: The 52-47 nearly party-line vote capped weeks of divisive battles over Sessions, an early supporter of President Donald Trump and one of the Senate's most conservative lawmakers.

post_name: Gorsuch says Trump's tweets on judiciary are 'demoralizing' and 'disheartening'
post_message: President Trump's escalating attacks on the federal judiciary drew denunciation today from his Supreme Court nominee, Neil Gorsuch, who told a senator that the criticism was "disheartening" and "demoralizing" to independent federal courts.
post_description: Trump on Wednesday declared that an appeals court's hearing Tuesday night regarding his controversial immigration executive order was "disgraceful."

post_name: Melissa McCarthy on 'SNL' shows the power comedians have under a Trump presidency
post_message: Late-night comics lampooning a president is nothing new, particularly on SNL. If any other heads of state were upset by these portrayals, they kept their criticism private. Not Trump. And this signals an opening for professional comics opposed to his agenda.
post_description: No attempt to ridicule Donald Trump's controversies — from his remarks about Mexicans to the "Access Hollywood" tape — could derail his successful road to the White House.

post_name: U.S. appeals court refuses to reinstate Trump travel ban
post_message: A federal appeals court in San Francisco has refused to reinstate President Trump's ban on travelers from seven predominantly Muslim nations.
post_description: A federal appeals court in San Francisco refused Thursday to reinstate President Donald Trump 's ban on travelers from seven predominantly Muslim nations.

post_name: COLUMN: Appeals court introduces President Trump to Mr. Checks and Mrs. Balances
post_message: Democracy is complicated — as President Trump is now learning — but it tends to work, writes columnist Rex Huppke.
post_description: In response to a federal appeals court’s decision to not reinstate a ban on travelers from seven Muslim-majority countries, the president of the United States of America tweeted, in part: “SEE YOU IN COURT.”

post_name: On Devon Avenue in Chicago, news of immigration raids intensifies fears
post_message: "Every time the doorbell rings, they get scared."
post_description: News that Chicago was one of the cities targeted this week by federal agents in a series of immigration enforcement raids has intensified growing fear and anxiety in immigrant communities — even among families with legal status.

post_name: Master Chicago bridge builder Ralph Modjeski subject of new film
post_message: Ralph Modjeski may be the most illustrious Chicagoan most Chicagoans have never heard of.
post_description: A Polish immigrant, Modjeski built nearly 40 bridges in the U.S. and Canada.

post_name: Why you should know Harlem Renaissance writer Claude McKay
post_message: He was, in a precursory way, the future of American literature, an immigrant who wrestled with ideas of home and, specifically, the best way to represent the totality of African-American life.
post_description: Almost 80 years since the death of Claude McKay in Chicago, the Harlem Renaissance touchstone has a new work — and a new reason to be appreciated.

post_name: 48 unauthorized immigrants arrested in Chicago area during last week's ICE raid
post_message: Of those arrested, 45 were convicted criminals and 20 were previously deported, an ICE official said.
post_description: In Chicago, 15 people were arrested, including an Iraqi citizen with a previous conviction of criminal sexual abuse of a victim unable to consent.

post_name: Rick Bayless to close 4 restaurants Thursday to support immigrants
post_message: The chef is the most high-profile Chicago employer so far to participate in A Day Without Immigrants, meant to demonstrate the importance of immigrants by encouraging them to skip work.
post_description: Chicago chef Rick Bayless plans to shut down four of his restaurants for the day on Thursday in a show of support for his immigrant workers.

post_name: Little Village streets, restaurants quiet as deportation fears rise
post_message: In the Chicago neighborhood known as the "Mexican Capital of the Midwest," residents say the streets no longer bustle with commerce and conversation.
post_description: The specter of Trump-era immigration enforcement has dimmed the energy of Little Village.

post_name: Anti-Trump protesters take to downtown streets again
post_message: With a police escort, several hundred people marched from Trump Tower to Federal Plaza expressing displeasure with the Trump administration's court-paused travel ban, its policies on immigrants in the United States without legal permission and his promise to build a wall at the United States-Mexico border.
post_description: Protesters took to the streets again Sunday afternoon in Chicago’s Loop to voice their concerns about several parts of President Donald Trump ’s agenda, including immigration issues.

post_name: Sanctuary movement: Houses of worship consider offering refuge to immigrants
post_message: "When Trump was elected, it turned into an immediate priority situation."
post_description: Alarmed by President Donald Trump's campaign proposals to crack down on immigration and subsequent executive orders that called for barring refugees and expediting deportations, hundreds of churches, synagogues and mosques nationwide — and about two dozen in the Chicago area — are considering the b....

post_name: Memos show Trump administration greatly expanding number of people targeted for deportation
post_message: Homeland Security Department memos lay out that any immigrant living in the U.S. illegally who has been charged or convicted of any crime — and even those suspected of a crime — will now be an enforcement priority. That could include people arrested for shop lifting or minor traffic offenses.
post_description: The documents represent a sweeping rewrite of the nation's immigration enforcement priorities.

post_name: CPS tells principals not to allow immigration officials in schools without warrant
post_message: Principals were also urged to have parents update student emergency contact forms and include backup contacts that schools could turn to if a child's parents were detained.
post_description: Amid ongoing tensions over changes to U.S. immigration policy, CPS told principals not to let federal immigration authorities inside district buildings unless they have a criminal warrant.

post_name: Chicago restaurant’s immigrant dinner series looks to unite people through food
post_message: "We're all from different places, but food brings people to the table."
post_description: "We're all from different places," says Ardit Dizdari, "but food brings people to the table."

post_name: Cook County Sheriff's office has 'no interest' in joining federal immigration efforts
post_message: "Our focus is and will remain on addressing violence in the city."
post_description: As the Trump administration publicly detailed its plans to more aggressively enforce immigration laws, a top Cook County sheriff's official said Tuesday the department has "no interest" in joining an effort that would use local police to round up immigrants living in the country without legal permis...

post_name: Muhammad Ali's son detained at Florida airport, asked by border agents: 'Are you Muslim?'
post_message: It was the first time Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they're Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said.
post_description: Returning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other on Feb. 7 at the immigration checkpoint at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport,

post_name: George W. Bush on Trump and Russia: 'We all need answers'
post_message:
Former President George W. Bush didn't rule out the idea that a special prosecutor could be necessary to lead an investigation on the extent of contact between President Donald Trump's team and the Russian government.

The Republican also defended the media's role in keeping world leaders in check, noting that "power can be addictive," and warned against immigration policies that could alienate Muslims.
post_description: Former President George W. Bush said Monday "we all need answers" on the extent of contact between President Donald Trump 's team and the Russian government, and didn't rule out the idea that a special prosecutor could be necessary to lead an investigation.

post_name: ICE agents, Chicago-area sanctuary status at odds as Trump pushes deportations
post_message: Primitive workarounds are a reality for ICE agents whose territory is Chicago, one of the largest cities to call itself a sanctuary and to implement policies aimed at defying federal crackdowns on illegal immigration — a movement that has gained steam in opposition to Trump.
post_description: Chicago-area policies barring local authorities' cooperation with the feds on immigrants here illegally have stymied ICE agents. Will they survive Trump?

post_name: Thousands of ICE detainees claim they were forced into labor, a violation of anti-slavery laws
post_message: Tens of thousands of immigrants detained by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement were forced to work for $1 day, or for nothing at — a violation of federal anti-slavery laws — a lawsuit claims.
post_description: It's the first time a class-action lawsuit accusing a private U.S. prison company of forced labor has been allowed to move forward.

post_name: Could dramatic immigration workplace raids make a comeback under Trump?
post_message: Uncertainty is prompting some employee rights groups to dust off decade-old raid-training manuals.
post_description: President Donald Trump's plans to aggressively enforce the nation's immigration laws haven't specified what that will look like inside the workplace.

post_name: Suburban Muslim couple ejected from O'Hare flight sues United Airlines
post_message: The couple said they were humiliated when their family was ushered off a plane last year after seeking help with their youngest child's booster seat.
post_description: Nearly a year after their family was removed from a flight at O'Hare, a Muslim couple from the north suburbs filed a federal lawsuit against United Airlines.

post_name: Can immigration laws hinder new 'Bachelor' couple's togetherness?
post_message: He used to be a Chicagoan before decamping for Los Angeles. She lives in Montreal.
post_description: Vanessa Grimaldi agreed to move to the U.S. to be with Nick Viall. But will it be that easy?

post_name: Immigration activist Elvira Arellano allowed to remain in U.S. for another year
post_message: The twice-deported activist whose year of living in a Humboldt Park church a decade ago made her a lightning rod in the immigration debate was granted a reprieve today.
post_description: "I want to send a message to the community so they can all fight together and not stay home and watch how all of the executive orders are affecting us.”

post_name: COLUMN: For St. Patrick's Day — Who's the modern version of Irish immigrants?
post_message: "You don't get to celebrate ancestors who came over during a famine and then ignore immigrants coming over for the same reasons."
post_description: Cook County Commissioner Bridget Gainer wants Chicagoans and Americans to reflect on immigration this St. Patrick's Day.

post_name: Cardinal Cupich tells national TV audience: Church 'stands with' immigrants
post_message: "From this immigrant nation's early days, the church has accompanied those who sought refuge from persecution, fled poverty and war in their homelands and came here, seeking to trade their labor and loyalty for citizenship."
post_description: Organized by Telemundo, the meeting at a church in Chicago's Brighton Park neighborhood gave the cardinal a chance to showcase his fluent Spanish.

post_name: Inside McHenry County jail, immigrants prefer detention to deportation
post_message:
Detainees spend their days in cells, wearing orange uniforms, writing letters or reading religious texts or stories about overcoming adversity. 

Many pray they'll never have to board the white prison buses that take them to the airport, pray they won't be forced to abandon their American-born children and pray they won't be sent back to a native country where they suffered domestic abuse or threats from drug cartels.
post_description: Living in limbo, detainees are unsure how much longer their cases for asylum or release will take or what the outcome will be.

post_name: A rare look at life inside a Chicago-area ICE immigration detention center
post_message: Many detained immigrants are forced to accept one of two difficult realities: be deported immediately to the country they fled or remain in the custody of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, unsure how much longer their cases for asylum or release will take or what the outcome will be.
post_description: Living in limbo, detainees are unsure how much longer their cases for asylum or release will take or what the outcome will be.

post_name: Indiana woman thought Trump would deport 'bad hombres.' Instead, he's deporting her law-abiding husband.
post_message: Indiana resident Helen Beristain voted for Donald Trump. Now, her husband is getting deported back to Mexico.
post_description: When Helen Beristain told her husband she was voting for Donald Trump last year, he warned her that the Republican nominee planned to "get rid of the Mexicans."

post_name: Skilled immigrants often struggle to put degrees, credentials to use in U.S.
post_message: Highly skilled immigrants often encounter a labyrinth of obstacles when they try to find jobs in the U.S., frustrating not only their ambitions but also their earning potential as they settle for lower-skill positions.
post_description: Those already here say the expertise they brought with them to the U.S. often goes to waste.

post_name: Skilled immigrants often struggle to put degrees, credentials to use in U.S.
post_message: "You have a master's degree and you're working at a deli?"
post_description: President Trump praised merit-based immigration, but highly skilled immigrants often hit obstacles when they seek jobs in their fields in the U.S.

post_name: Attorney General Jeff Sessions says sanctuary cities may lose federal funding
post_message: It is the latest effort by the Trump administration to crack down on illegal immigration.
post_description: Attorney General Jeff Sessions on Monday threatened to strip some "sanctuary cities" of coveted Justice Department grants for state and local law enforcement.

post_name: U.S. judge in Hawaii extends order halting Trump's travel ban
post_message: Hawaii says the policy discriminates against Muslims and hurts the state's tourist-dependent economy.
post_description: A federal judge in Hawaii decided Wednesday to extend his order blocking President Donald Trump's travel ban.

post_name: OPINION: Trump's wall is already collapsing
post_message: "Trump fooled a lot of voters when he made that promise, and he may have even fooled himself. But at some point, you run out of fools."
post_description: President Donald Trump's Mexican border wall is not living up to his campaign promises.

post_name: More immigrants afraid to show up for ICE check-ins
post_message: Many immigrants — who were allowed to stay in the U.S. provided they checked in with ICE officials every six months to a year — now fear they'll be handed notices of deportation at those check-ins.
post_description: Several immigration attorneys said stricter Department of Homeland Security policies have led to a change in how check-ins are conducted.

post_name: Your ultimate guide to Mexican restaurants in and around Chicago.
post_message: We're featuring a new Mexican dish every day in April. Which restaurant do you hope to see make the cut?

post_name: Video: Gary Johnson talks Libertarianism with Nick Gillespie at FreedomFest
post_message: Gary Johnson sat down with ReasonTV to talk about his legal cannabis company, what he learned from his 2012 Libertarian campaign for President, how he handled immigration as a two-term border state Governor, his opinions of two-party candidates like Donald Trump, Rick Santorum, and Hillary Clinton - and his plans for the 2016 election.
post_description: Johnson says he wants nothing to do with the GOP.

post_name: ICE issues new guidance on the care of transgender individuals in custody
post_message:
The Libertarian Party platform contains two planks which taken together call for policies that would directly eliminate this, and many other harms, by the immigration detention system in America. Equal access to coercive detention policies is no equality at all!!

1.4  Personal Relationships: "[G]ender, or gender identity should have no impact on the government's treatment of individuals, such as in current [...] immigration [...] laws."

3.4 Free Trade & Migration: "Political freedom and escape from tyranny demand that individuals not be unreasonably constrained by government in the crossing of political boundaries."

Outright Libertarians is committed to raising awareness of how these laws impact not only the LGBT migrant community, but hinders liberty and prosperity for all.

#MigrationIsAVictimlessCrime
#LiberationNOW

http://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-issues-new-guidance-care-transgender-individuals-custody
post_description: This new guidance is the result of a six-month agency Working Group that examined these issues with subject matter experts, sought input from transgender individuals, and visited various non-federal facilities across the country to observe best practices.

post_name: Freedom for Thee, But Not for We
post_message:
From the article: "...But the solution is not to wall off the country; it’s to wall off the welfare state. David Friedman has pointed out that liberal immigration policies can create political incentives to hold down welfare benefits."

We'd like to hear your comments about this.
post_description: I expected and got some pushback about my post comparing the Berlin Wall to the wall along our southern border. Happily, it was more civil than the reactions I often get when I talk about immigration and free movement of people. One fair comment focused on the key distinction between the Berlin Wall…

post_name: A Matter Of Consent. | Libertarian Perspectives
post_message:
A Matter Of Consent.

"Libertarians get it. The only thing that should separate lusty adults is acknowledged, affirmative, and informed mutual consent. We’ve recognized this in various forms since the party’s first platform in 1971."
post_description: A Matter Of Consent. “Sexual orientation, preference, gender, or gender identity should have no impact on the government’s treatment of individuals, such as in current marriage, child custody, adoption, immigration or military service laws. Government does not have the authority to define, license o…

post_name: Transgender Travelers Collide with TSA’s Security Theater
post_message:
"Many travelers may not even realize it, but as they're forced in to spread eagle for body scanners in security lines at the airport, a TSA agent is pressing a button telling the machine whether the person inside is a male or female. They don't ask—they just look and decide. In Petosky's case, the TSA employee saw a woman and pressed the appropriate button. [...] Then it became a big mess."

Outright Libertarians is proud to stand behind the Libertarian Party's platform, which states: "Sexual orientation, preference, gender, or gender identity should have no impact on the government's treatment of individuals, such as in current marriage, child custody, adoption, immigration or military service laws."

Learn more about the LP platform here:
http://www.lp.org/platform#1.4

Learn more about our LGBT caucus here:
http://outrightusa.org/

#LiberationNOW
post_description: Blame it on the body scanners, poor training.

post_name: Libertarians Working For You show features Father Larry Beane and Andy Craig
post_message:
The latest episode (10/28/2015) of Libertarians Working For You hosted by LNC Vice Chair Arvin Vohra is now available online, with guests Father Larry Beane of the Louisiana LP on helping the poor, and Andy Craig, 2016 LP-WIsconsin candidate for the US House of Representatives fourth congressional district, on immigration and corporate welfare.

#Libertarian
post_description: Today's episode (10/28/2015) of Libertarians Working For You hosted by Arvin Vohra is now available online, with guests Father Larry Beane of the Louisiana LP on helping the poor, and Andy Craig, 2016 LP of Wisconsin candidate for the US House of Representatives fourth congressional district, on imm…

post_name: Utah judge orders baby taken away from married lesbian foster parents
post_message:
"Sumner, from the child welfare agency, said she could not speak to specifics of the case but confirmed that the couple’s account of the ruling was accurate — the judge’s decision was based on the couple being lesbians. The agency was not aware of any other issues with their performance as foster parents."

Plank 1.4 of our Platform states: "Sexual orientation, preference, gender, or gender identity should have no impact on the government's treatment of individuals, such as in current marriage, child custody, adoption, immigration or military service laws."

post_name: Simmons for Congress 1st CD-Mass.
post_message: NA
post_description:
Candidate Statement on the Orlando Shooting

Thomas Simmons, the openly gay Libertarian candidate for Congress in Western Massachusetts’ First District, issued the following statement today in response to the Orlando shooting.

“Words can not convey the depth of heartache that accompanies this terrible tragedy. Just two weeks ago, I was in Orlando at the Libertarian Party National Convention, and patronized the nightclubs in this very neighborhood.  The Pulse was not just a nightclub, but a community epicenter for Orlando’s LGBT community. This horror – occurring during the nation’s Pride celebrations - was made even worse for us all when we learned that at least two of the victims had direct ties to western Massachusetts.

We must never give in to hate, whether that hate is directed against the gay community, immigrants, or the Muslim community.  The politics of hate and division has been all too prevalent in recent political campaigns, and Americans from all walks of life must stand together in refusing to allow our diverse, liberty-loving nation to be torn apart by those who would seek to divide and conquer.

As a gay man, I have long been painfully aware that, statistically, I am more likely to be assaulted than most; for that reason, I have a concealed carry (LTC-A) license for self-protection.  In spite of the fact that I have Homeland Security Clearance through my activities with the U. S. Coast Guard, and have been fingerprinted through the FBI no fewer than eleven times during the course of my life, it still took me more than 8 months to receive this license to carry in Massachusetts.  The fact that it took me 8 months, while the Orlando terrorist was granted a license to work in Private Security after having been investigated by the FBI three times for terrorist connections, points to a breakdown in the nation’s security systems that puts innocent lives at risk while allowing criminal elements to proceed unchecked.

It is a sad reality that we will never live in an incident-free utopia; that simply is not possible.  We must avoid quick, feel-good solutions and clichés in dealing with terrorism, both domestic and foreign, even though our raw emotions might demand action.  Thoughtful but decisive changes – and a commitment to rejecting hate on all sides, while preserving all American’s civil liberties  – is the only way forward.”

Thom Simmons

post_name: No joke: a French comedian on trial
post_message: From Espresso: Since last month’s attacks in Paris in which 17 people were shot dead, scores of individuals have been charged with “justifying terrorism” under France’s strict new anti-terror laws. Today Dieudonné M’bala M’bala, a prominent stand-up comedian, appears in court on such a charge. He was arrested after posting a message on Facebook after the murders at Charlie Hebdo, a satirical newspaper, and a kosher supermarket, which read: “I feel like I am Charlie Coulibaly.” This was a reference both to the popular slogan in favour of free expression, Je suis Charlie, and to Amédy Coulibaly, the supermarket killer. A conviction could trigger anger among Dieudonné’s followers in France’s heavily Muslim banlieues. Either way, this will not be the end of his judicial troubles. The comedian faces other charges, including one of inciting racial hatred, for a sketch in which he refers to a Jewish journalist by muttering “gas chambers….shame” http://econ.st/1ApRNJJ

post_name: Reality bites: Belgium’s jihadist trial
post_message: From Espresso: Verdicts are due in Antwerp this morning in Europe’s largest-ever trial of alleged jihadists. Forty-six suspects linked to Sharia4Belgium, a now-defunct organisation, are accused of engaging in terrorism by travelling to Syria to fight with radical Islamists. Some are being tried in absentia (and may even be dead). The state’s key witness is Jejoen Bontinck, a Muslim convert and former reality-show contestant (“Move Like Michael Jackson”) who was brought back from Syria by his father and has come to symbolise Belgium’s problem of youth radicalisation. An estimated 450 Belgian Muslims are fighting in Syria and Iraq—relative to population, the most in Europe. In January Belgian police carried out a series of raids, killing two returned jihadists said to have been plotting attacks inside the country. Prosecutors have demanded 15 years in jail and a €30,000 ($34,000) fine for Sharia4Belgium’s spiritual leader, Fouad Belkacem. Mr Bontinck faces up to four years’ imprisonment http://econ.st/1AlwKXU

post_name: Quadruple jeopardy: Morsi on trial, again
post_message: From Espresso: Muhammad Morsi, Egypt’s ousted Muslim Brotherhood president, goes on trial on Sunday for the fourth time since he was deposed. He is accused of espionage: handing national-security documents to Qatari intelligence and Al Jazeera television, owned by Qatar. The Brothers have been outlawed and dubbed terrorists by President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, who as army chief led the 2013 coup against Mr Morsi. The party will therefore not contest parliamentary elections next month, which the regime says will complete Egypt’s transition to “democratic rule”. Other opposition groups, activists and journalists have also been stifled. Yesterday the retrial started of two Al Jazeera journalists originally sentenced to seven and ten years’ imprisonment for allegedly supporting the Brotherhood; both were freed on bail. (A third, an Australian, Peter Greste, has been deported, but not pardoned.) Mr Morsi’s fate contrasts with that of Hosni Mubarak, the president toppled in the Arab spring, who is now free http://econ.st/1ElprhS

post_name: The mute leading the mute
post_message: A recent survey by Mexicanos Primero, an education NGO, found that four-fifths of secondary-school graduates in Mexico had “absolutely no knowledge” of English, despite having spent at least 360 hours learning it in secondary school. Comparable global data are scarce, but experts say the situation is similar in much of the non-Anglophone world http://econ.st/1KOToen

post_name: A progressive patrician
post_message: He was the last of Australia’s truly liberal leaders of the conservative Liberal Party to become prime minister. And he was scathing about how it had, under today's prime minister, Tony Abbott, lurched to the right. What irked Malcom Fraser most was its newfound hard line on personal freedoms and its harsh treatment of asylum-seekers: he dismissed it as a “party of fear and reaction”.  When his Liberal successors, less humane towards the plight of refugees, began refusing entry to those arriving by boat in 2001, Mr Fraser called the move a “step backwards into a darker future, where we’re prepared to say that some people are not people”. After Mr Fraser died on March 20th, aged 84, eulogies remembered him as the father of progressive reforms that shaped modern Australia, not least its multicultural immigration policy. post_name: Looking for trouble: Pakistan and Yemen
post_message: From Espresso: Swathes of Pakistan’s territory are beyond government control; terrorists strike its cities; war continues on its western border with Afghanistan, while an 11-year ceasefire on the eastern one, with India, almost broke last year. So it may seem bizarre that Pakistan’s rulers are discussing sending soldiers to fight in Yemen. On Monday and Tuesday parliament debated deploying troops there, though security policy is mostly directed by Pakistan’s army; civilians add a patina of legitimacy. Pakistan’s interest is in helping its Sunni Muslim ally and donor, Saudi Arabia, which is bombing the mostly Shia Houthi rebels who have overrun much of Yemen. But participating in the conflict would be risky, not least if it incurs hostility from Iran, which has a 900km frontier with Pakistan and allegedly backs the Houthis. Pakistan already suffers awful religious violence, mostly by Sunnis against Shias. Involvement in Yemen could provoke yet more sectarian bloodshed at home http://econ.st/1CkEJkc

post_message: At least 1,300 miles long, 40 feet high, and containing 19 million tons of concrete. Donald Trump's much heralded wall along the Mexican border would be a massive undertaking. Just how massive the cost would be is harder to determine. http://cnnmon.ie/2klYc3E

post_description: President-elect Donald Trump’s transition team asked the Department of Homeland Security for documents relating to the biographic information of some undocumented immigrants, Reuters reported Tuesday.

post_name: 'Affluenza' teen Ethan Couch detained in Mexico
post_message: Mexican authorities have detained so-called "affluenza" teen Ethan Couch and his mother near the popular Mexican Pacific beach resort town of Puerto Vallarta.
post_description: Ethan Couch, 18, went missing earlier this month, two years after he made national news when he was sentenced to probation for a drunken driving crash that killed four people.

post_name: City unearths artifacts from 1800s near Old North Church
post_message: Boston archaeologists got one step closer to discovering what life was like for European immigrants in the 1800s.
post_description: They found ceramic pottery, children's toys, religious figurines and medicine bottles.
